description:
I used to think ABV was just **okay**... but after my visit yesterday, everything has changed.

The cocktail list is very refined, with a range of drinks that goes from light/refreshing to boozy. I was able to get my fill of both mezcal and bourbon drinks, no problem, all extremely balanced.

The fermented edamame was mindblowing! Hope they keep it, or similar items on the menu. I also recommend trying the burger and the octopus fries.

The service was exceptional, waitstaff was extremely nice and attentive. Everyone worked as a team, everything came out lightning fast.
author: Patrick L.

description:
Surprised to find ABV pretty full on a Wednesday around midnight. Personally not into loud crowded places but the kind service, excellent drinks and delicious food made up for it. 

The Mumbai mule(4.1/5) Well crafted and had a pretty interesting bite/spice to it. 
Gin and celery (3.8/5) i don't remember trying anything that has used the taste of celery as its foundation but it was very refreshing. simple but unique.  
The drifter (3.5/5) nicely made old fashioned but I've  tried better. 

The burger and spicy chips(4.5/5) If you find yourself at ABV the burger is a must try. Very tasty and not too greasy. Consistency of the patty has been so far unmatched- Melts in your mouth but doesn't fall apart while picking it up.
author: Matt L.

description:
Great drinks great vibe! However, one most not go there with a big appetite. Menu is considered "finger food" little did we know it was literal. We ordered meatballs which were the size of my grandmas pearl necklace, finger food. 

But hey if you want great drinks and vibes, do it!
author: Oliver N.

description:
ONE OF THE LATEST OPEN KITCHENS IN SF! Truly a hidden gem; right on 16th between Valencia and Guerrero, this drinkery serves more than meets the eye.

The first thing you'll notice is the SNACKS menu on the wall. All cocktails / drinks are found in a book they'll hand you. The bar seating often gets rather crowded in the front, and people don't realize if you walk farther back there is open seating, that has been available every time I've been. Also, they have tees next to the menu, and the first thing you'll think is "ohh, merch- whatever," but NO! Each tee is by a local artist AND a percentage of the profits go to charity! In the back, there's a huge mural (that's done by a local artist), two communal high-top tables, and more bar seating before the restroom in the very back. 

Eating at ABV is such a fun experience. They don't serve utensils so all their food becomes FINGER FOOD! You must must try their Japanese-style Celery Root "tater tots." Last time I went I also had the Pulpo a la plancha con Fritas (grilled octopus w french fries) and it was delicious!! I think it's safe to say everything on the menu is drool-worthy. I really wanted dessert, but unfortunately they don't have any. Our server suggested getting the Soft Cow, which is a warm, cow's milk cheese from a farm in Vermont, served with sides of jam. 100% was the perfect way to end our "meal" with the red wine we were drinking. I will definitely return to try the Thai-style anchovies! 

If you're still reading, you must be interested in this place!! Another cool feature of this bar is that upstairs they have a completely different concept called OVERPROOF. It's a fixed-menu meal paired with drink setting, and they change the WHOLE INTERIOR to fit the theme each month!! It's incredibly unique and creative, and I hope I get a spot at their next event.
author: Navila H.

description:
Pretty cool, lively bar with some great cocktails and bites to snack on! My bf and I came for dinner on a Friday night (we came just before there was a line forming outside) and had a pretty good time even though we had to stand by a wall. It was a bit challenging having 3 plates of food (one was a cheese board) on a rather narrow table that lines along the wal (I kept bumping into the person behind me!). 

Food: 
Cheese board: loved the assortment and homemade strawberry jam. The jam was the star. It paired so perfectly with the cheeses. The only thing I didn't care for was how buttery the toasted bread was. Less butter please! (4/5)

Ceviche: delicious delicious delicious! It's hard to taste a ceviche that isn't drowned with lime juice and that the fish is completely raw. Most of the time places would slightly sear the fish since the fish isn't fresh enough. That's def not the case with this place. (5/5)

Pork tacos: these were tasty. Loved the addition of the pickled onions on top. Flavorful, not heavy, and the perfect amount of pork to toppings ratio. I like how thin the flour tortillas were-- although they were thin, they held the fillings well. (5/5)

Drinks were overall great. I really liked the gin and cucumber one-- so refreshing. 
I'll be back.
author: Christina W.

description: ABV's cocktails are legit!  My favorite is Summer at Todd's House, which is a really refreshing (and slightly dangerous) gin drink. The Gin & Celery is good if you REALLY like celery (which I do, but if you're not you may want to stay away or request less bitters). ABV is a solid Mission bar and one I find myself returning to whenever I'm in the area!
author: Sarah B.

description:
I've been meaning to try out ABV for a while now since I've been on a bar binge. With Yelp elites rating it 4 and 5 stars, and discovering the bar through a "top SF bars" list, I had some expectations, but I kept them at bay. 

I'm happy to say, two thumbs up :)

Setting: Larger and nicer than expected. There are bar seats, shared large tables, and also smaller intimate tables. There's even an upstairs for reservations. More bougey than grungy as my best friend said, haha. 

Drinks: My friend and I chose from the gin/vodka list, and everything was amazing. 
-Mumbai Mule($13): ginger, mint, vodka, and lemon
-Summer at Todd's House ($12): summer gin, lime, vodka, I forget the last ingredient...
-Late Checkout ($13): gin, lemon, passion fruit, campari, manzanilla

*a pitcher of water was given, and our glasses never went empty. Shout out to Irene for excellent service*

Bar bites: Some of the best bar bites I've ever had
FYI: there are no utensils, you use your hands, seriously! I was waiting for them to tell me they were kidding. You do get a wet wipe though. 

-Japanese style tater tots: must order! One question is, how? They taste so good smothered in Japanese mayo and bonito flakes. The best tots ever! Wish the portion size was bigger though.

- Octopus with fries: the octopus was pretty good, but those fries were insanely good too. Very crispy and fresh. 

Overall, both food and drinks knocked my socks off. A bar to remember.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Corinna T.

description:
I'm struggling with this review, only because as a bar, ABV is a solid establishment. I enjoyed the Late Check-Out, a cocktail made of gin, compari and passion fruit.   

But we also ordered the New Fucking Burger and were not happy when it arrived rare. As a matter of fact when we asked if it could be cooked a bit more, we were rudely told, "No, we only serve it one way"-with a take it or leave it attitude. That being said, if they indeed only cook it rare, than by all means make your customers aware so they can make an informed decision of whether or not to order the NF burger, especially with the added health risks involved. 

https://www.consumerreports.org/cro/food/how-safe-is-your-ground-beef

https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.express.co.uk/news/uk/743494/Rare-burgers-health-warning-alert-peril-gourmet-meals/amp

Btw, the burger was eventually taken off our bill and deliberately disposed of under the bar. With so many amazing bars in San Francisco, it's likely I won't return.
author: Alicia P.

description: Pork tacos are delicious!!!!! Cauliflower amazing as always. Fermented edamame was super yummy. Also tried a tequila tarragon drink which was super refreshing. Love this place
author: Laura D.

description:
I went for dinner/drinks on a Thursday night. It was pretty crowded and my party of 2 struggled to find seats (eventually ended up at the bar).

The cocktail list looked great. Standard cocktail pricing in my eyes (around $15). I got the Summer at Todd's House.

Food is mostly appetizers and small bites, no full meal. Is a little fancier than your average bar food, and also a little pricier. Got the Japanese "Tater Tots" for $10. 

The price would've been fine except the serving was very small. It was good though. And is whole potato as opposed to hash (not a positive or negative, just a note). 

Once we were seated it was a great spot to chat. Lively but not too loud to talk.
author: Mika S.

description:
Checked this place out last night and had a great experience!

The ambience is modern and hipster, yet unpretentious. It is spacious inside: we weren't able to find seats at 6pm on a Saturday (and were comfortable standing at the wall opposite the bar) and I imagine it must get even busier as the night goes on, but we still had room to spread out and not feel like we were on top of others. There is also outdoor seating in front, tables in the back and an upstairs (from other reviews, I guess this upstairs area is for reservations). While definitely bustling, it was also blessedly not loud: I tend to automatically love a bar where you can have a conversation without having to yell, and ABV delivered on this!

We tried a bunch of the cocktails and small plates and enjoyed everything! The cocktails we tried were all creative, strong and well balanced. My favorite cocktail was the La Botana, a spicy, mezcal-based drink. I also enjoyed the Mumbai Mule, with saffron infused vodka - an interesting and tasty take on a Moscow Mule!

All of the small plates were great, too. We started with the foie gras stuffed olives, which were an interesting pairing. We also tried the soft shell crab, Japanese tater tots and octopus a la plancha. The tots were not conventional tots, but were delicious: more like perfectly soft-on-the-inside, crispy-on-the-outside pieces of potato, complemented well by the mayo and bonito flakes. The octopus was tender and perfectly cooked, the chimichurri was a nice complement, and the garlic fries served with it were crispy and delicious as well. Portions are small but satisfying!

Our server was helpful, nice and attentive, as were all the other staff we interacted with. It was nice to have a server helping us out when we were standing in a different part of the bar, as opposed to having to fight our way through to place an order with a bartender. Our waters were refilled and we got fresh plates and napkins as needed without asking, too. This is not a cheap spot ($57/pp to share small plates and 2 drinks each) but the quality is excellent.
author: Christine G.

description:
ABV is my favorite cocktail bar in the city. Heh, not like I go to many.. but still. Oh, and I live 2.6 miles away from it (a 15 minute walk and two Bart stops aka far in SF terms). It's still my go-to which says a lot.

They have really creative cocktails here. My personal favorite is the Mumbai Mule. Whether you're into whiskey, vodka, mezcal, etc., they'll have a drink for you. 

To be honest, I don't even come here for the drinks -that's just a plus. I come here for the food, specifically the octopus. The octopus a la plancha is hands down THE. BEST. OCTOPUS. EVER. Do not pass on this!!

If you really like eating octopus and want to get a bit tipsy doing so, ABV is your place!!
author: Laverne N.

description:
It is a nice place for a drink or two. They have great cocktails and delicious snacks. The Staff is very friendly and you get your drinks very quickly. I had a very good time her and I will definitely come back.  

I highly recommend the Mumbai Mule which has an intense taste of ginger and the Tartine Toast with peach and tomato, goat cheese and shiso.  So Yummy
author: St Giles I.

description:
#46 of World's 50 Best Bars

Excellent cocktails - Mumbai Mule, Tarragon Fix, and Jackal were all delicious, refreshing, sparkling and without any alcohol taste. 

Fried cauliflower - Amazing how well it's cooked. It's crunchy, hearty, and crisp to perfection. 

Japanese tater tots - Softer than the cauliflower, somewhere between a mashed potato and an actual tater tot.

Spicy chips - Nice kick in flavor. 

Octopus a la plancha with fries and herbs - Octopus was soft and savory like calamari. Fries were delicious.

Service - Excellent. I loved our waiter. Open seating. Sit anywhere and the servers will come find you.
author: Ee Vonn Y.

description:
Great cocktail and international liquor selection. Even rarely spotted treasures like the Italian Ramazotti or Averna can be found here.

The bartender was super knowledgeable and demonstrated great cocktail mixing techniques. The Aperol Spritz I had was super convincing. However, next time I'd love to try an old fashioned here! They know what they're doing!
author: Stefani K.

description:
I came here based on a recommendation from a friend who knows I love to eat and was staying close by.  ABV is a cool place to hangout with tables in the far back and bar stools in the front.  Nice dark atmosphere and I had a pretty good drink -MUMBAI MULE (saffron vodka, lemon, ginger, mint and soda.)

Because my friend and I got in late from our flight, we were a bit hungry.  
We ordered the new fuckin burger  with spicy-ass chips based on the menu on the wall.  When we received our order it was RARE with  blood dripping.  I'm not a person to eat RARE ground beef so we asked one of the bartenders if we can get the burger cooked more.  With a rude and short attitude, the guy says "NO, that is how it's served, MEDIUM RARE."  My jaw completely dropped.  So we sat there thinking "what an ass" but I will speak to our server directly instead of that guy.  When our bartender became available I asked again if the kitchen can cook our burger just a tad bit more.  He said "no" and said the same thing the other bartender said.  He then said that the kitchen cannot do such a thing because the grill is small and they cannot cook a lot.  WOW!  That small huh.  Like really?  Okay, I get it.  Obviously, there's no changes to the way they cook their food.  The bartender offered to remove the burger from our bill and grab the burger and chips and threw it in the trash in front of us instead of taking it to the back to throw away.  

Recommendation:  Please UPDATE YOUR MENU AND STATE THAT THE BURGER IS SERVED RARE (RAW) AND NO EXCEPTIONS. SERVER SAID MEDIUM RARE BUT IT WAS RARE.  If I had seen this on the menu I would not have ordered it.  Also, if the bartender warned us it was served Rare - RAW we would've been informed and would have not ordered it.  

My experience here was such a negative one that I will never return or recommend this place to anyone.
author: Nette B.

description: Solid spot - been here for first dates or with a group of friends. I've ordered their cocktails and just well drinks while friends ordered cocktails / beer. I've had bites here which were fine but never ate a full meal. Ambiance is great, particularly if you can get a table near the back. Standing in the narrow walkway near the front can be annoying.
author: Sophia L.

description:
Been here 20+ times from 2014-2017 for the great ambiance and cocktails.  Came back two weekends ago with 5 friends and had the worst service ever in a bar.  First we were told not to eat outside food and if we wanted to eat it to go outside.  Ok totally fair, our friend was visiting from Asia and didn't know.  The server was pretty rude in delivery but we let it slide.  

15 min later the same waiter comes up to me and tells me he needs to take my chair and put it back because they can't move furniture as a bar policy.  He then puts that chair 2 feet behind me at an empty table.  Thanks dude...  30seconds later he brings me a replacement chair from the bar violating his own statement and abv policy.  

The final straw was the manager coming over and after we explained what happened and that the waiter needed to be retrained, the manager ends up defending the policies rather than apologize for the rude service. 

Absolutely ridiculous, whoever is the GM is allowing this place to go downhill.  As one bar owner to another, you should retrain your people.
author: Alex L.

description:
I came here on a weekend with a friend who knew the owner, so of course we got the rockstar treatment. So this review is about the ambiance and the food. 

Ambiance - This looks like a cool hipster place, but its actually really cool and relaxed. Case and point, I was wearing black yoga pants, and I felt like I still fit in. The front is a till more crowded with the bar area, but the back had a nice seating area that we chose to dine at. The bathrooms were clean and well maintained. The bathrooms are all-gender, so pick whichever one you want. 

Food: We got to try so many things on their menu. And you can really make a meal out of the small bites. 
* Spicy Chickpeas: Order this if you need food now. It's like bar nuts, they always have it on hand. 
* Fermented edamame: I've never met a pickle that I didn't like, and these edamames were also soft, with the right amount of crunch. 
* Fried Cauliflower: It was like hitting the jackpot when you got the extra crispy parts! The flavors were on point! 
* Japanese tator tots: Its cubes of celery root perfectly fried and seasoned. 
* Tartine toast: I love the bread! and the carrot hummus on it was magical. I do wish the kale on top of it was chopped a little smaller so that when I took my bite, I didn't take all the kale off at once too. 
* Roasted carrots: just say yes. 
* Pork tacos: The pork and pickled cabbage on it was amazing. 

This meal was a pretty amazing low carb meal without even trying. I'm definitely coming back to try the rest of the menu!
author: Vicky L.

description:
I came here on a Wednesday night around 7 pm. 

I really like the waitress with the short hair. She was so nice! She thought I didn't like my drink since I was drinking pretty slowly (I was just trying to not be drunk). She offered to get me another drink. 

I ordered a vodka based drink with tarragon. It was great, I just didn't expect it to be green!
author: Alicia W.

description: Came here to celebrate a birthday. Bar had a very relaxed, but lively feel throughout the night. Our party was 10+, so it was nice being able to hear ourselves while having conversations. Enjoyed the dark atmosphere and bartenders were on point with their wide selection of drinks. Cocktails were creative and had a great balance of sweetness and bitterness. Recommend coming back for a chill laid back night.
author: Ronald M.

description: I've been here more than 15 times so this is long overdue. This is the best gem in the city. It gets really crowded on weekends and you are likely going to wait to get in but worth the wait. Their drinks are great and creative, my favorite is the gin and celery, MUST try. Best drink on the menu and one of the only bars that can make the drink. Would not suggest this place to anyone that goes to a bar to get "wasted" or doesn't know the rules of bar etiquette. Bartenders know their stuff here so if you are that group that comes in with 10 people and tries to split the tab between all 10 people at a full capacity bar, probably not the place for you.
author: Melissa V.

description:
The owner of this establishment made a faux line outside to create false demand while the inside was barely busy. He was then misogynistic and completely incompetent as an owner. My female friend requested a drink and the owner demanded her to "look me in the eyes when you order". Nobody should ever be belittled like this. We gave the man some constructive feedback upon departure, because things can always be interpreted in several different ways. Not surprisingly, he told us to fuck off. The Donald Trump of bar owners.

Also, found out after leaving that my friend was told "you're welcome" after he spoke to the bartender about being overcharged for a drink. 

Safe to say that the crafty cocktails will never make this place palatable.
author: James S.

description:
Fact: The owner told our sister to "look me in the eyes when you order" then took the menu from her without allowing her to actually order...

Opinion: The over-priced cocktails were not good enough to override the bad taste in our mouth from the pretentious negative attitudes of the staff.
author: Jackie S.

description:
ABV is one of those bars that you want to tell everyone is terrible JUST so folks don't go and overrun the place while in actuality it is one of the best places in the Mission.

Between their accommodating and friendly staff, on point original cocktails, inexpensive beers and amazing food there is nothing I don't love about coming here. 

I have never had a bad experience and it is always on my list of go-to places for out of town friends.
author: Liz K.

description:
THIS IS A SOLID BAR!!! 

A couple friends and I went here just for drinks. 
We came a bit early around 8pm on a Saturday night, we got in right away. An hour later, people had to wait in line to get in.

One thing I liked about this bar was they had tables for sitting down and eat but you could also hang around the bars and just casually get drinks. But even if you just hang around the bars or standing tables, servers will come to you to take your drink orders very attentively. So you don't have to worry about fighting to order your drinks like most other bars. They keep coming back to check on you and refilling water and everything. 

Their drink prices are pretty reasonable. Cocktails price are around $12-$15 or so. They're pretty strong too. Their drink menu are also very extensive. Not those basic long island mixed drinks..they actually have some really creative mixes. 

I would definitely come back next time to try their food.
author: Veronica N.

description:
My friend and I came here for Birthday drinks and I was so impressed!

First, the place had a cool vibe and the staff were very friendly. I would totally do a date night here or bring friends here to enjoy drinks. I heard that it gets really busy, but luckily at 430 on a Thursday in December we didn't have to deal with any crazy crowds ( though there were quite a few people). 

I got the mule and it was indeed yummy. I may have a slight bias because I'm indian, but I love the spices of turmeric and cardamom that paired with the ginger and vodka.

My only regret? I didn't get the octopus on fries!! For now I'll just keep kicking myself until I come back... hopefully soon!
author: Gita r.

description:
Extremely well balanced and delicious. I ordered a gin cocktail and my friends all ordered whiskey cocktails, but we taste tested each others.  The response was all around positive, wanting to switch drinks and order more.  My favorite ended up being The Drifter.  That's a drink I'd like to have at the end of every work day, good or bad.  

Super cool bartenders btw.  They obviously know their stuff.  Come early on a nice day and snag the window seats by the bar.
author: Jessica F.

description: The best burger in SF. For real. Recommend this place a million times over. The drinks are great too.
author: Will M.

description:
A group of us came here on a Saturday night at around 10pm and the place had a line due to at capacity. No one left, but we were allowed inside. Since the place was not crowded, we were all puzzled by the line...

Then one guy in our group went up to the bar to order a drink but was told they don't serve drinks at the bar and we have to order drinks from servers who are walking around the floor...

So we order drinks from this guy and he asks for a credit card to open a tab. This was totally fine until he decides to charge everyone's drink orders to this one card without asking if it was okay. Not only that, he also charged this other group of friends' drinks to this card. By the end of the night, we had this crazy bill where no one was clear who ordered what and how much to pay. A nightmare!

Also the server guy made us feel like we were clueless about ordering drinks. Why all the arrogance and unfriendliness?

I used to like this place but now I'm not so sure. We will probably not come here, or at least for a while :(
author: Alice L.

description:
I've had two extremely negative experiences here all involving rude bartenders. 

First experience: we weren't served because "they don't serve drunk people." As someone who gets maybe 2-3 drinks when I go out (usually beers) I am shocked that someone said I was "too drunk to be served" before even placing an order. We had just asked for water initially and were denied it. Absolutely ridiculous.

The most recent experience happened yesterday. My friend and I wanted to sit at the bar and every time a spot opened up, other people were super quick to snag the spots. So when two seats finally opened up across from where we were sitting, my friend ran over and sat down. I grabbed our stuff to sit down and the bartender snaps at us and says, "I need to clean this up can you wait a second?" My friend started to help him gather the glasses because she's a bartender herself and wanted to help and he said, "Can you stop? You don't even know where they go so what you're doing is useless." I came back and started to sit down and he snaps again and says, "No seriously can you stop?" My friend and I backed off and when he was done we finally sat down.

His attitude was so unwarranted. We were excited to have a seat at the bar, were trying to help this guy out of basic etiquette, and he was an ass about it. 

Honestly this guy made our experience extremely unpleasant and HE needed to back off. He continuously reached over the counter to take away any napkin or tray I had in front of me without asking. I literally had one napkin and tray for my food. He didn't have to be so anal about it.

I won't be coming back here because the service is consistently bad and the bartenders need to get off their high horse and have some respect for their customers.
author: Zoe M.

description:
Are the drinks delicious and deliciously over-priced? Yes. Is the food kinda good? A little. Was there one decent server who wasn't a complete jack off? Yeah! But the service a girlfriend and I received on a Tuesday and Sunday night was outright appalling. It was the first time ever have I received such bad service that made me and my friend sooo u-n-c-o-m-f-o-r-t-a-b-l-e. 

The first time we came in after having a few drinks, we sat at the bar for no more than a few minutes, had a bartender give us menus and mumbled very loudly to himself "I don't want to serve drunk people tonight." We didn't even talk to the guy yet. SO we just left. 


After reading the "rave reviews," I decide to try this place out again in hopes of my first time being a rare experience and I don't know maybe this dude's cat died and he had just found out right before giving us menus. Fast forward to us snagging seats at the bar after waiting for awhile. We were so juiced, and as we merely stand next to our spot and gather our drinks, the bartender snaps and tells us to wait for him to clean our spot. It came out of NOWHERE as we were being very polite!, so I thought he was kidding maybe? And then, after helping him gather the glasses and put it in one spot (because I'm a bartender as well so I understand the struggle is real), this guy straight up raises his voice and snaps saying to "stop moving the glasses because you don't know where they go."

.....


I have never felt so uncomfortable and disrespected at a bar, OMG. We were right in front of his station too and how awkward was it to have to him flirt with the girl next to us, take shots with all the other patrons, but treat us like freaking degenerates. I could not enjoy my cocktail and neither could my friend after such bad service.
author: Darlene O.

description:
Busy, medium noise level, but not too crowded on a Tuesday night at 9:30pm. 

Our group of 7 easily found a corner with a few bar stools where we could hang out on our own. 

I tried:
* Mumbai Mule (gin-based) - 3.5 stars
Refreshing and light, but there was some flavor reminiscent of Indian food that overwhelmed the flavor. As a result, the drink wasn't quite spicy but tasted almost savory to me. I don't think this flavor was the saffron vodka, as I've had dishes with saffron before and it don't mind that flavor. I still finished this drink!

* La Botana (mezcal-based) - 4.5 stars
Also refreshing and light, but with a fantastic little kick that I loved.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
I've come here now a few times after first being introduced to it from a friend. It's quickly become my favorite bar in the Mission.

The place is clean with industrial style decor. The bar definitely has a chill vibe to it but also I see it as a romantic hot spot. The crowd is a mixed bag which is nice. I've seen people dressed like they're going out clubbing afterward and others just wearing more casual clothing.

I love the style of having bartenders walking around the floor. Especially on my first night, my bartender was extremely attentive to me and my friend's needs. The drink menu is extensive and I liked that there were a lot of different avenues I can take with different alcohol choices.

Haven't grabbed a bite to eat quite yet, so I'll definitely keep coming back.
author: Stephen P.

description:
Came here with a group of friends for a few drinks and shareable munchies before hitting the town.

Great vibe inside.  Clean and comfortable.  Defiantly the late 20's -late 30's crowd.  We were immediately greeted and offered drink menus by a server as we wandered to one of the back community tables. 

The server was friendly, professional and offered suggestions.  We ordered a round of drinks, carrot hummus, Celery root tots, and fried cauliflower.

By far the carrot hummus was our favorite. It was a slightly toasted / grilled toast with carrot hummus spread topped with fried kale and pepitas.  We loved this so much we ordered a second. 

The cauliflower had interesting flavor.  It was liked by all but I'm not sure I would order it again. 

The celery root "tots" were fun and tasty.  They came in "steamed" cubes drizzle with a Sriracha sauce and green onions.  The first bite I thought it was possibly cubes potato.  The texture is soft and smooth like a baked potato and was perfect share appetizer. 

We ordered a round of drinks- solid pour and nice combination of flavors.  My wife had the rum, lemon and raspberry- I have to admit it was tasty. 

Defiantly will be coming back.
author: marc j.

description:
If you're in the mission district and fancy some cocktails, I highly recommend this place! Every cocktail was delicious and our waitress knew her sh*t. Plus this place has bomb tapas to enjoy with your drinks. I wish I didn't have dinner before so I could've ate more!

Me and a coworker came in for 2 drinks and ended up getting 4-5 each because they were so good! I'll definitely be back when I'm in SF
author: CJ R.

description:
Best cocktails in San Francisco.
Their food is also very good, more like snacks but my all time favorite is the cauliflower and the mushrooms.

For meat lovers, their burgers and octopus are what people rave about.
author: JC M.

description: Looking for a cool late night spot with food and drinks?!?! Come here!!!! While checking out the menu, don't overlook the mushrooms. They are hands down one of the BEST things in the house!!! Burgers are pretty big. So if you're really hungry, that should fill you up quite a bit!!! The drink menu is HUGE, however if you're looking for wine, there's only one red and one white lol. Luckily I was happy with what I ordered. Overall, I like this place a whole lot and will be back!!!
author: Ali R.

description: My friends and I grabbed a drink here when my husband and I got into San Francisco. The atmosphere inside is pretty modern and kind of fancy! We sat outside and had some wine and cocktails. It was such a lovely day and we loved sitting outside and doing this here. The staff were super friendly and attentive and they had a nice range of cocktails and wines. Great spot for a drink!
author: Joanna V.

description: ABV is the best. The cocktails are interesting and delicious (try the Late Checkout). The food is consistently amazing. All of the staff treats us so well every time we stop in, whether we're 2 people or a group of 7 having a birthday party. Even the lighting and decor are great. The only downside is that the cocktails are a little expensive. If I could give this place 10 stars, I would.
author: Carmen W.

description:
After a few weeks of being off booze, I wanted my first and only drink that night to be something special, something I can really enjoy. ABV delivered on just that: since gin based cocktails are my favorite, I ordered a Mumbai Mule, with a light spicy twist. Not too sweet, not too spicy. At $12 I thought it was still reasonably priced (unlike the $9 tequila shot from a few weeks ago at a different, definitely less cool bar). The interior is nice, not too noisy, so you can still have a conversation. Service this time around was friendly and attentive and kept filling up those water glasses. By the way, the water is delicious here.

So why 3 stars? Well, it was not the first time I came here. A couple of weeks, we wanted to give it a try, but didn't make it past the door. The doorman for whatever reason decided to keep us waiting, apparently because it was too crowded. But even after several guests had left, he wouldn't let our party of four in, for no reason other than 'I decide when you can go in'. I mean, come on, aren't we a little too old for these kind of games? We eventually gave up and went somewhere else.
author: Katja S.

description:
ABV is one of my favorites in SF! I'd come more often but it's always packed. The drinks are pretty simple since they have 3-4 Ingredients but are really well done. They have this iberico mezcal which smells like BBQ.

We were a bit indecisive on food and ended up passing last call, but we are going to have to be back to try the food.

The staff is so kind and helpful and took really good care of me and my friends. Thank you for a great night!
author: Tina X.

description:
First time here, and it was a very good experience. There is the normal bar and a side bar, so plenty of seats (at least on a Wednesday night; I could see how it could get crowded on a weekend). I believe the back was open seating as well. Nice attentive and friendly service without hovering. Decent cocktail menu. I had the Lake Checkout (gin, lemon, passionfruit, campari, manzanilla) - sounded sweet, but definitely more tart, although still very fruity. 

We tried some snacks: 

Foie gras stuffed olives - Yum! Great little snack. The foie gras on the inside is in smooth mousse format and the savory/salty combo is perfect. 

Ceviche aquachile with watermelon radish and lime - This was a little bit of a miss for me. Very spicy, to the point of not being able to taste the actual fish and covering up any other flavor. The watermelon radish did bring it down a tiny bit and brought a nice crunch to the dish, but still, I would skip this one. 

Grilled duck heart and cucumber with ufra chili adobo and spring onion - WOW!! Definitely the best of the night. The cucumbers were grilled or something and had an awesome flavor. The duck hearts were plump and meaty. The chilis did bring a bit of spice to the dish, but it combined with the other elements in a natural way. The onions were slightly charred to perfection. Will definitely be back to have this again. 

While the spirits menu is quite extensive, the beer and wine menu is somewhat limited (esp wines by the glass), but you can find something you like. Prices seem mostly in line with other SF places, maybe some things (like draft beer) maybe a dollar or two too expensive. 

As an offal and weird food fan, this entire menu has a lot of appeal, and I can't wait to try the rest.
author: Rebecca S.

description: Drinks were ok and staff extra sassy. Buzz kill. I feel like the drinks on the menu are more on the sweet side than complex and flavorful. I expect a lot from SF especially if the staff is going to try to act cool they better be able to back it up.
author: Veronica R.

description: This place is great!  Went here with a friend on a Tuesday night around 8pm. The place was really crowded but not super loud.  We found a couple stools by the wall and sat down there.  Our server, Ocho, was excellent...very friendly and knowledgeable and checked in on us regularly.  Would definitely recommend checking this place out.
author: Ramesh K.

description:
This review is purely about the ABV burger, for the purpose of my SF burger quest. Prolly not gonna be long (for anyone that's ever said my Yelp reviews r too long... ur welcome and also u prolly have no sense of humor ya i said it)

This was the first burger I've had without ketchup in my entire life. I wasn't even mad about it bc this way I was able to fully immerse myself in the essence of the burger itself. 

The ABV burger was incredibly juicy, like prolly the juiciest I've ever had in my life? I was shooketh but like in a good way, truly amazed in fact. The garnish is simple yet exceeded expectations - shredded lettuce, onion, pickles (astounding), white cheddar (spectacular), and some sauce (magnificent). So why 4 stars then? The jalapeño chips on the side *thumbs down* not necessary... I would've much rather had fries (wonder if I could've just asked for that?) I'm not a chips hater but like... I'm also not a chips lover. I am, however, a fries lover.

I had a drink here and it was good too, but like I said the review was purely for the burger so y'all can figure that one out on ur own :-) :-) :-)
author: Minal A.

description:
Came to ABV for the first time to ring in the new year. It's been on my list for a while and it certainly did not disappoint. To start, there was no cover!! On New Year's Eve!

As far as drinks go, I had two: the Jackel and the Gin + Celery. The jackel wasn't great. It was the single most tart drink I've ever had. Tasted like straight lemon juice with a splash of whiskey. Could've done with a more alcohol-forward drink. 

Now you may be asking yourself, "if one of the two drinks wasn't very good, how did this place get 5 stars?" Let me tell you...the gin and celery is something special. It has a perfect balance of flavors and their house-made celery bitters are perfect. Not overpowering but also not underwhelming. 

On top of this, I had the tartine toast, which had Brussels sprouts (the best I've ever had) and morita on top. This place is really something special. 

Come here and get yourself a gin + celery and some tartine toast!
author: Nick D.

description: I recently saw ABV on a list of best bars so while on town my friend and I decided to check it out. We walked in on a Tuesday around 8pm and the place was packed. We sat down and my friend ordered the Mumbai Mule and I got The Jackel. We must have only been sitting there like 7-10 minutes or so and our server came up to us and apologized for the long wait and offered us a glass of their house-made sherry. I was super impressed with their level of service and the drinks themselves were awesome too. We only had the two drinks here but overall this place was an excellent find!
author: Courtney D.

description: I racked up quite the bill here, but it was well worth. I had about 4 drinks, and all of them tasted amazing! I also ordered about half of the food menu (it's all finger foods), and everything was pretty much on point. The bartender accidentally messed up one of my food orders, but she gave it to me on the house!
author: Vina V.

description:
Dinner review. Return visit following change of chef.

'New fucking burger' - 2/5 - Average at best

(-1) Removing pimento cheeseburger. 

The prior chef's version was famous and one of the best burgers in the city. Adding the new chef's version as an alternative option to the old one would be acceptable. Simply removing the old version is unacceptable. 

Overall, "I think not."
author: Mark O.

description:
After a day at Delores Park, we were on a trek to find a happy hour, after a few misfires, we happened upon ABV, no HH, but it was pleasantly surprising:
-great service and ambiance
-two water closets
-purse hooks 
-excellent strong cocktails, LOVED the Mumbai mule, super savory with the saffron and the Tarragon Collins was a close second, fresh and light
-snacks are all finger foods, no utensils are provided other than tiny steel coaster sized 'plates' and a wet nap, quite good, check out the Brussels with XO, olives with foie, lamb corn dogs and the grilled octopus

A word of caution, they are very strict with 'no outside food or drinks', we had bottled water and were told to put them away.  

Improvement: they need to filter their water or get a better device

Gets really busy weekdays after 5PM, come early and claim your spot.
author: Cynthia C.

description: Service was really nice and attentive.  Had two drinks, one was a miss and the other a hit.  My pork tacos was nothing to write home about but my husband's burger was delicious!  Foie gras stuffed olives are creative. I'd come back.
author: Bailey N.

description: Three and a half stars. What a chill neighborhood watering hole. No silverware, so brace yourself to eat all the bar snacks with your hands. The gem salad is extra sloppy, but the salt n' pepper softshell crab really hit the spot and was filling enough that I stopped craving a beef tongue reuben or grilled octopus. Cocktails were moderately balanced; surprisingly, I'd recommend the Jackal over the Whisky in Church, and my bartender steered me away from the Dunmore Cobbler. Service was a little aloof despite a slow afternoon, but having outlets under the bar allowed my hardware to keep me company at this post-airport pit stop. Not particularly compelled to come back.
author: Ruth C.

description:
Excuse me Yelp, I think you're broken again. 

I can't rate for 6 stars. What's up?

Josh aka aggressive water pourer.
Ocho aka Eric why you lying to my girl about your name? But yo man that penicillen should just be called a panty wetter. 
Irene aka I'll never need to go over the menu because you got some Jedi mind reading tricks to know EXACTLY what we love to drink.

Craftsmen/women that needs a statue molded of themselves to be set in the heart of downtown SF. True fucking artists. 

The drinks draw you into their personalities and that's what a bar environment should be/feel like. The era of tech today clouds people's minds of how to interact to each other. Thank fucking you to all you guys for doing what you're best at and putting in work every damn day.
author: Geoffrey G.

description:
Did the food + cocktail pairing at ABV (called Overproof) recently and absolutely loved it!

They rotate through a different alcohol every quarter; I went for the last night of the rum cocktails pairing on April 21. They have two seatings per night, one at 7 and one at 9 pm. You have to make a reservation in advance through RESY (check their website), where you also pay upfront for the whole experience. For the rum pairing, it was $66 per person all inclusive of food, drinks, tax and tip, which I thought was a fantastic deal.

Our 5 drinks were:
Sippin rum - plantation pineapple dark rum
"Cuba Libre" - aged rum, bubbles, vermouth, lime
Pink flamingo - rhum, lime, pineapple gum, tiki-apertif, absinthe
Hurricane sandy - rum, passionfruit, lemon
Pineapple bum - pineapple rum, cappelletti, rancio

And our 5 foods were:
Rum ham musubi - house spam, furikaki, rum-hoisin sauce
Clam "stuffies" - andouille, cherry stone clam, lemon
Smoked lamb curry - puffed rice, fried plantain
Jerked chicken wings - coriander, pineapple
Trini chow mein - broccoli, braised cabbage, green onion

I loved the whole experience from start to finish. Right from the start, our server came over and gave us a rundown of how the evening would go. I love that he made it clear it was a pretty casual affair and that it was completely fine to go at your own pace.

As for the pacing, they bring out each round of food and drinks at a brisk pace, since you only have two hours for everything. I never felt rushed except for at the very end with the last drink, which I had to take with me and slowly sip at downstairs in the bar area. With each dish/cocktail, they'll do a great job of introducing it--where it's from, how it's prepared, etc.--but in a very unpretentious manner.

The amount of food was just right for me. I left feeling very satisfied, especially after finishing the yummy chow mein noodles you get at the very end.

Seating is at communal high tops with some bar seats as well, but my friend and I mostly chatted between ourselves after the initial introduction to our neighbors.

I really appreciate that ABV is really close to the 16th St Mission BART station. It made for an easy BART ride from my office downtown.
author: Dianna H.

description:
Came here to try the kimchee fritter but it's no longer available! Whaaaaaaaaaa, iSad. Visiting a restaurant and hearing that a dish is no longer served brings great disappointment so I scanned through the menu and ordered the next dish that sounded appetizing

Octopus w/ Fries - I like octopus; maybe its a texture thing but if cooked wrong, it can be rubbery and difficult to chew and swallow.... :P  The octopus had the right amount of flavor and the texture was on point.  The herbs on the bed of fries were a nice touch

Who goes to a cocktail bar and doesn't order a drink? ( slowly hides in shame).  I will definitely come back to try the other items

Good service
author: Linda N.

description:
Last time I reviewed ABV, I didn't get to try their food menu, let alone their famous burger.  So I finally went back, only to find that they changed their whole menu, including the burger.  Regardless of that, I went ahead and ordered the New Fuckin Burger and it was fuckin good!! 

New Fuckin Burger w/ Spicy Ass Chips -- http://bit.ly/2mluFve
1/3 lbs grass fed beef patty, white cheddar, red onion, lettuce, pickles, house sauce, Japanese sweet potato bun.  Served with spicy jalapeño chips.
It's not exactly the original pimiento cheese burger that they had on their menu before which was a bummer because I really wanted to try that.  But this new burger is really good!  The burger was cooked to a perfect medium rare and the house sauce gave it a nice zesty flavor.  I actually think this is one of the best burgers in all of SF.  

For dessert I tried their Ice Cream Sandwich and it was okay.  It had a weird taste to me like a mix between licorice and figs, but it was still good enough for me to enjoy.

Their drinks are still well crafted.  I had the Dunmore Cobbler with amontillado, pineapple, scotch, lemon, bitters and it was very refreshing (http://bit.ly/2mlx60R).

Overall, I'm glad that I finally went back to ABV to try their burger.  Although it wasn't the burger that I came for, the New Fuckin Burger was worth the visit.  I hope to come back to ABV again to try more of their other menu items and drinks.  And also to try their new cocktail pairing menu in the private area in their loft section.  Looking forward to my next visit!
author: Rodney H.

description:
A consistently excellent place for drinks, good food, and a great time. I love stopping by this place for drinks in the evening and appreciate that there's a high quality drink and food option open so late in the night. 

I love the fried cauliflower and the lengua tacos and many of the drinks. The vibe here is always great and the place tends to be packed, but the staff is great about serving you even if you're standing at the counter top away from the bar. I appreciate that they have staff taking orders since the bar itself can kind of be a mess and hard to get to. 

Great food, chill music, and awesome vibe. They also have seats in the back and longer tables if you get there early and manage to find a spot.
author: Jasmine X.

description:
Is this a restaurant or bar? I'm still not sure. Basically, you grab a seat or table and a server will come get your order of drinks and/or food. SO much better than trying to get the bartender's attention at another crowded hipster bar in the Mission.

We had already ate somewhere else, so I did not try any of the food items. I thought it was funny that they had "beef tongue reuben" on their menu. It sounds weird when they name it like that. Might as well just call it lengua since we're in the Mission and call it a day.

Drinks were good too! I felt nothing but good vibes here and service was great. Strongly recommend trying it out at least one!
author: Karen R.

description: Food was sooooooo good! Best burger I've had in a long time and the Tots were delicious! Also now a celery gin convert!
author: Sammy E.

description:
A trendy bar featuring everything from beer and wine to pretty cocktails made from high end spirits. 
The crowd is fun but classy, loud but not rowdy. The food is not typical bar food either- a selection of charcuterie is available or if you're more adventurous, there's grilled octopus and beef cheek on the menu.

I recommend the burger and a Quicksand cocktail made with mezcal.
author: Mitzi G.

description: Another great cocktail bar in a town with a bunch of them. Came here on a Sunday afternoon not to busy.  Our servers were real nice, and gave some great recommendations  Got a couple drinks and then left. The place is not that big, but the drinks are pretty good, and vibe is chill. Wish I got to try some of the food though, maybe next time.
author: AJ M.

description:
DO NOT COME HERE! Stay away. Terrible, terrible, terrible service, staff including the manager is so rude and derogatory. 

We came to this bar as it was highly recommended by a friend. 

Friends and I were sitting at one of the long tables inside the bar for a good half an hour, having a good time. We ordered drinks too. 

Waiter comes up and tells our friend he has to get off his stool because the stool he was sitting on belonged to the other table and they were not allowed to move furniture around. Don't think this is  how anyone would treat a paying customer. 

We asked to speak to the manager who claimed his name is John. Manager gave a half-arsed answer and was also incredibly rude and did not do anything to help resolve the situation. 

We would have stayed longer and ordered more drinks if not for their attitude. The arrogance was a huge turn off.
author: Lynn C.

description:
DO NOT COME HERE! DISRESPECTFUL, RUDE BARTENDERS AND VERY UNCOMFORTABLE!!! 

Came here to enjoy a late drink after a concert Sunday night 7/29/2018 with a friend and received the most horrible & rude service I have experienced in the mission district of SF. The two bartenders I dealt with were John & Collin (those were the names I was given when as I introduced myself before I walked out the door).

Came in to ABV with my friend and sat at the bar, it was really chilly and cold as there was heavy fog and a lovely 50 degrees outside - normal SF weather. I asked Collin if i could shut the door, he rudely told me no, and walked away. When he came back I asked why? He said bc he didn't want it shut and that this bar keeps its doors open all night. Untrue, bc I've been there 2 times previous, even on a hot day and the door was shut. I found this odd. 

My friend and I waited about 10 mins before Collin came back and asked if we wanted any drinks - there were only 4 other ppl sitting at the bar ... between that time I ran into another friend I hadn't seen in awhile and she sat next to me. We decided to order shots together ... my random friend took her shot and left.... *** side note: we asked what kind of reposado tequila they had and he said he only had one. When i looked on the menu there were at least 3/4*** when Collin came back I wanted to order another drink but he told me and my remaining friend we couldn't have anymore. Asked why And he said bc the other friend who left was too drunk. Not sure what that has to do with us but we were shocked. Told Collin the other girl clearly left & then John comes up and shouts we weren't going to be served anymore drinks and if we didn't like it we could leave. As two Latina women being yelled at by a Caucasian white male was disturbing and disgusting, especially in the mission district of SF. How dare he think it's ok to feel the need to yell at a women who's asking a simple question, trying to get better understanding. The power trip and the egotistic attitude was unwarranted and very scary to say the least. 

My friend and I decided to take our money elsewhere and go around the corners to Blondies where we received welcoming and great service. From one bartender to another - that's not how you treat your customers especially when you're working for tips. This bar deserves zero stars.
author: Priscilla P.

description:
Everything on the menu at ABV, whether the food or the drinks, might be a tad spendy - plus the place can get quite crowded on weekend nights - but there's no denying that you're going to have a quality experience if you can get in. 

While the beer, cider, and wine program is a bit modest, one of ABV's strengths is in its cocktail offerings - all solidly crafted, tasty drinks. The Sutro Swizzle (armagnac, lemon, grapefruit shrub, maraschino) and Mumbai Mule (saffron vodka, lemon, ginger, mint, soda) were particularly memorable. 

The food offerings, while again a bit spendy, are also reasonably solid, and draw from global inspirations, whether jerk chicken wings, tacos, or ribs. I even remember that they once had a nibble-sized "banh mi" plate that, while a bit tiny, was an interesting fusion take on Asian fare.

Service is reasonably engaging and attentive no matter how crowded it gets. Worth a try.
author: Vincent L.

description:
I'm so enraged by the comments of the rude waitress we met here that I felt compelled to write this review.

We came into ABV hoping to find a nice place to get together with some old friends and were waiting to order at the bar when one of the waitresses came by and mumbled under her breathe "move to the back and order, people....where there's room so I can actually get through." I get it, it's a full house. We didn't mind moving towards the back room but as everyone knows, it's all in the tone and delivery of the message...and was the last half of that comment really necessary?? We had JUST walked in. With this type of customer service, I'm certain I will NOT be back and I will be sure to let all of my friends know this is the type of treatment you get here. 

Didn't get her name but she's the waitress on the heavier side who wore a red cardigan, red scarf, black tshirt, black pants, black boots and glasses.
author: Vickie T.

description:
ABV is one of the most well renowned cocktail bars in SF and for good reason. Starting with the ambiance- though usually pretty crowded, ABV still somehow maintains a dark and intimate vibe. Good music (when you can hear it), and edgy but simple decor.

The cocktails are great, my favorite being The Jackel. I've tried most on their list and some I personally feel are a little too boozy but perhaps they're trying to give you the most bang for your buck. ;) 

What pleasantly surprised me the most was the food! Typically bars like this sell you overpriced, exotic peanuts or popcorn but ABV has delicious and affordable bites.
author: Marisa R.

description:
Definitely a nice SF bar. Classy, hipster, mixologists, wid selection of cocktails and liquor. Hard to find since I walked past it three times. Not necessarily because of the location but because of the bar front. 

I went at a pretty light traffic time but I can see that they would get busy very quickly in the evenings. 

Food is a little bit exotic than most bars, but it's there if you want to be adventurous.  I do like the meats and cheese boards that pairs with your choice of drink. 

Drinks are organized in a way that it is easily navigatable. I had a smoky drink but my personal taste preference, I thought if it as too smoky. 

Nice spot for after work drinks
author: Jeremy B.

description: A good bar w some great bar snacks. A chill space for a good cocktail. There is a good selection of booze but don't expect large tables. Most of the bar is tall bar seats.
author: Ian C.

description:
I don't know what's up with this place but the staff here are so rude! Yes, we understand that it's crowded and that we should stand to the side but there's no need to push us out of the way or talk down to us, we are perfectly capable of understanding what you're saying. 

There was a big group of us and we were all ordering cocktails but the person who took our orders just seemed super impatient and just wanted our credit card. 

Only saving grace here is that the whisky cocktails are good. Good enough for the attitude, probably not. But enough so it warrants a decent ish review. I probably won't be back because the service is a shit show and I didn't feel welcome here but if you go on a slower day then you'll probably get a good drink and better service than I got.
author: Eunah T.

description:
I came around 5pm on a Friday with a few coworkers, and there were already a bunch of people in the bar. There weren't any communal tables left, but the venue has two of their walls lined with stools and a small shelf-like table. It's great if you come with one other person but not super good for a larger group. The servers were really nice though - once the noticed another party leaving, they offered to seat us at the edge of the communal table which was way better for a group of 6. By the time we left, it was pretty packed, with basically all of the seating taken, and many people standing around in the open spaces.

The bar itself is pretty dark, but not too loud. I enjoyed having a conversation without feeling like I was yelling the entire time.

ABV is known for their cocktails, but they also serve wine and beer, and I have to say it lived up to my expectations. I tried a Mumbai mule (it had saffron in it I believe) and it was so refreshing and just gingery enough. My coworkers enjoyed their drinks as well!

We shared the fries (which come with octopus on top - this was delicious!), the summer tartine, and the fried cauliflower (you should get this if nothing else). Everything was served in small paper containers (similar to what you'd expect from a food truck) and they give you small plates but no silverware. Get ready to use your hands! I also shared the burger (which they kindly cut in half for you) and that was REALLY amazing. So juicy, flavourful, but a bit too salty. Still good though.

There's also apparently a reservation only bar/restaurant on the second floor called overproof, which I'm excited to try someday!
author: Theresa L.

description:
A more upscale place in mission that serves alcoholic drinks as the name implies and finger food. Decent drinks and place to chill. 

They have several tables in the back, a bar, and a small outside area. 

Place is quiet enough to chat if you raise your voice a bit.
author: Sean W.

description:
One of the best cocktail places in SF.

If I were to review just drinks, service, and vibe, it would be an easy 5 stars. But I ordered the octopus which knocks it a half star. The octopus was really, really tasty -- including the tangy mayo dip that went with it but it was bedded on too many fries so I felt like they skimped on the octopus. The fries were really great too though, mainly because they were super crispy and well seasoned! All food portions look small and therefore, their food menu is way overpriced.

Drinks: I tried the Tarragon collins, jackel, mumbai mule, apple brandy. All were phenomenal in terms of strength and taste. The fusion of flavors isn't only done exceptionally, but it's also done boldly. They really perfected complementary flavors in their drinks! I think their drinks are interesting and unique!

Service is great! They come check on you enough, not too often. It's all open seating and mostly bar stools which isn't the most comfortable but I didn't hate it
author: Jeanie N.

description:
Are you fucking kidding me?

Let's just get to the business. Came here on a date night right before I saw the amazing Rhett Miller at the Chapel. Had to get some Whiskey. Would be disrespectful to the man if I didn't. But even moreso, I had to get some grub too!!

Me and my girl got every Whiskey drink on the 1st page. All had a solid amount of booze and varied in flavors. All were good except for one which was the Baker's Highball. I didn't think it was necessarily bad but was for a different kind of person. It had very interesting semi sweet taste in the beginning but then ends with a very bitter after taste which tastes almost like licorice. It was very interesting. But enough about drinks, lets get to the food.

We got the wings and the Fucking Burger. *Note* That is literally what it was called. I had guy behind me smell our food and was like, "Sorry to bother you but what is that?" In which I reply, "It's the Fucking Burger." He looked at me and was like lolwut? But I told him. That's what it was called and it really was fucking amazing. Why? Well for one, I hate pickles. HATE pickles. The burger had pickles on it. I ate the WHOLE thing. That's how good it was. The patty was cooked to a perfect medium rare. Very juicy. It came with this 1000 island, In and Out looking spread and tasty buns. The burger had so much overall flavor. Man o man. Oh and the wings? Eh. They were ok. I forgot the name of them but they were supposed to be like a carribean jerk chicken. They were definitely spicy but I feel like they could of used a tad bit of flavor. Or maybe some kind of dipping sauce? Iunno. They just felt like they were missing something.

Overall, this place was awesome though. Me and my girlfriend loved the drinks, food and the vibes! Everyone here just looked like they were having an great time. Great music too!! They were playing some nice hip hop I've never heard of before. And most of all the people here we're extremely friendly. I would love to come back again just to get to know some of these people better! :D
author: Anthony W.

description: The burger is seriously "fuckin" good. All the components were perfectly proportioned. My friends who happen to dislike pickles said it worked for them here. ABV won't let you choose the doneness of the patty (I ask for rare or medium-rare when I can) but that didn't matter for me this time. We could have finished another if that wasn't too gluttonous.
author: Huey N.

description: You're at capacity but I've never seen a hostess shoo customers away from the door like they're parasites. Not very welcoming.
author: Sam R.

description:
Love ABV! The drinks are delicious and stiff, and the bartenders and servers are SO friendly, you'll forget you're in SF.

Can't wait to go back~
author: Jennifer K.

description:
ABV is one of my favorite bars in the city, hands down. I've had it tagged as somewhere vaguely in the Mission, and put off visiting for years because parking there can be such a nightmare. The joke is on me, though, and now I need to make up for lost time!

THE OVERVIEW.
+ Day drinking is one of the greatest things to do on a sunny Saturday. Bless these folks for recognizing that and being open!
~ Prices are stiff, but so are their drinks (ba dummmm tishhhh)
+ Seriously quality cocktails with unique mix-ins (celery bitters ftw)
+ Their bar snacks are some of the best I've ever had (foie-stuffed olives! roasted octopus with aioli!)

4 drinks and 2 snacks ran us ~$80, but it was well worth it. Come early to guarantee a seat outside or spot at the bar, otherwise you're stuck in the back (better for groups).
author: Claire S.

description: Just came here for drinks with friends. Good selection, average prices, I wish they had more seating. They're particular about where you can and cannot have stools. They have some interesting bites on the menu, I'd come back to try it.
author: Annie J.

description: Great non-alcoholic cocktails. The olives are amazing. Could do without the lecture from the waiter but the food and drinks made up for this.
author: Maz B.

description: Cool spot for cocktails and bar bites. Cocktail menu was organized by alcohol type, which is pretty cool, and foods were excellent too. All foods were served with no utensils. They will give you a wet towelette, which can be very messy if you order the wrong thing! Place can be very pack... it's a popular spot!
author: Sam M.

description:
30.00 for a Yamazaki 12 my friends.

It ain't rare. It ain't special. 

I would rate it as drinkable.

This place preys on the unknowing and unwary.

I won't be back.

Enough said.
author: E R.

description:
Great Service, Great place to hang out, the only thing is that They have WiFi but bartenders won't give it out because of too many People on their Network haha...
This San Francisco and the Silicon Valley right around the Corner. I find it very strange and disappointing!
Just my own experience, I'll still go back and get a drink.
Salud!
I truly enjoy this place.........
author: Carlos D.

description: This was an excellent bar. I had a gin and cucumber. It was an interesting and good drink. The hostess was so nice. I will return to this location with haste!
author: Trevor B.

description: Pretty garbage service from the owner. I thought this place seemed like a good option but ordering a drink was an absolute struggle. Garbage spot and I won't be back.
author: Jonathan O.

description:
Excellent drinks. Super fast
and friendly service ! Tonight they showcase the hazelnut chocolate blood orange mousse (ball) and it was delicious.  Imagine a blood orange marmalade chocolate snowball that is like a creamy sophisticated-need-2-have another-roller coaster in your mouth !
author: Tanny M.

description:
This place is awesome, great drinks, friendly bartenders, interesting stories.

Ask about the t-shirt hanging up on display!

Hope to try the food next time.

Love that they do a saffron infused vodka, made in house!
author: Kimia M.

description: I've only had drinks here so no opinion on the food. But based on my experience drinking here, I think ABV is a bit overhyped. The decor is cool and the vibe is great, but it's always insanely crowded. I also think the drinks are a bit too creative. Like, celery should only be allowed in Bloody Marys. Still a cool spot, but I won't go out of my way to go to ABV again.
author: Nana L.

description:
Day drinking is my favorite.

1) ABV open as early as 2pm on weekdays and 11am on weekend. 
2) Must get the lamb corn dogs. It's legit.
3) Tasty cocktails $10-$12 (Yes, the have Mezcal)
4) Easy going staff.
5) Mostly stool seating style around the bar and communal tables.


Overall, I like this place and I hope you give it a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description:
Food is not bad but everyone that works here (that I've experienced) is an asshole. Also if you eat here don't expect to be able to see anything or eat with a fork. They have a strict no fork policy. I'm not joking.

You can see from my profile I typically leave good reviews, I know it's hard to be in the service industry and I try to reward those that are generally nice humans. 

Fork this place.
author: Farah W.

description:
The food was delicious, the drink selection superb, and the service was phenomenal. Not to mention that I had some awesome company; I guess I can't give ABV credit for everything. My cousins, Daly City natives, brought my wife and me here for a great meal.

ABV, as the name suggests, does cocktails right. There are about 4-5 cocktails for each spirit. I didn't care for my first cocktail (too smoky), but the waiter, eager to please, took it from me and let me get a different whiskey drink at no additional charge! The other cocktails we had were all stellar.

I could drop a pretty penny here just ordering plate after plate of this great food! The foie gras stuffed olives were good, but definitely share them with others; they're very rich. The blistered hot peppers are tasty shishito peppers - spicy enough, but not murder to the tongue. The cheese plate was full of delectable dairy goodness. The most memorable item for me, however, was the octopus a la plancha with herbs. Nice char and lemon flavor on top; would totally get this again. The ice cream oloroso sandwhich was a good but I think I'd rather just drink some oloroso sherry to end my meal.

Not the cheapest place, but worth every red cent you spend. Definitely recommended.
author: Adam K.

description: Heard about this place through Thrillist and its list of the best burgers in SF. Went with my two best friends and we were surprised on how cool this little bar is. Would would have thought they have the best burger? We sat outside because there were no tables inside (it is first come first serve), but it wasn't a problem, the service was fast and great. We were really hungry and because it was bar food (smaller than usual) we ended up ordering two appetizers and a burger each. We ordered the olives stuffed with foi grass and the pulpo a la parrilla which were jaw dropping delicious. And the burgers are hands down the best i've tried. It is definitely a must if you're in the mission area.
author: Sophie E.

description:
I remember hearing about ABV a couple years ago after they won the James beard award for "best cocktail program" in the USA and immediately went down to check it out. Was I that impressed, not really. So, I rarely ever visited ABV and that was a huge mistake on my part. My most recent visit this past weekend was nothing short of amazing and I take back everything I might have thought before. 

I popped in with a friend in the early afternoon on Saturday because I've been on a mescal kick since coming home from a recent Mexico vacation. I wanted to see what ABV would do with mescal in some craft cocktails and they were magical. I trust most bartenders at places like this and my "spiritual guide" (Cecily) on Saturday whipped up some amazing drinks. I started with a variation of "The Martinez" with mescal instead of gin, fabulous! Next up was a drink called "Leftys Fizz". Basically, it was mescal, grapefruit, bitters and egg white. So, it was like a late breakfast/brunch. :)

Btw, did you get my reference above "SPIRITual guide"? I thought it was creative :) 

The service was great, the brunch menu looked amazing (I didn't eat but really wanted to), and all in all was super happy with the early afternoon. I'll be back to ABV next weekend for brunch and some serious mescal cocktails.
author: Benjamin F.

description: I had been wanting to try this place. We wandered in before dinner and had some drinks. A large menu of inventive cocktails and drinks. I chose the gin and celery, loved it! They also have some small bites on the menu and the food looked really good not your typical bar food def a step above. It was crowded on a weekday night so I can imagine what its like on the weekends. There is a bar in front and some communal tables in the back. The waiters were very nice and friendly.The crowd was a good mix seemed to be there because they wanted to be there not be scene.  There is a unique reservation only area upstairs called Over Proof....oooh how I want to try that next time.
author: Karen R.

description:
I really like ABV and almost  don't want to write this review because I don't want it to get more crowded. 

I've been to ABV twice and enjoyed myself both times. It's a small place- some tables in the back but mostly bar and counter seating. Regardless of where you sit, waiters will come to take your order which is nice. 

The menu has mostly some interesting smaller items (think snacks with a little twist or creative touch) along with cheese, charcuterie, and a few slightly bigger things like a burger and sandwich. The menu seems to change somewhat often as it was different the two times I came here. 

They used to have an amazing pimento cheese burger which is very sadly no longer on the menu. I definitely recommend the cheese and the pate was pretty enjoyable also. Octopus with fries was good though I would probably opt for other stuff in the future- just wish it had a tad more flavor. The foie gras stuffed olives are pretty good but obviously pretty rich; I would suggest sharing them and pairing with a drink that compliments their saltiness.  The menu isn't huge so take a look at it online first to make sure it has something you like. 

They have a pretty extensive cocktail list along with some wine and beer. I was disappointed they only had 3 wines on tap (1 red 1 white and 1 rosé) but the red I had was pretty good and a generous pour. Beer selection (on tap but overall really) was also kind of small and disappointing. The cocktails are well made and thought out. Not the strongest but well balanced. One nice touch is they have a few non alcoholic beverage options for mocktails in case someone isn't drinking. 

Overall I would probably give ABV a 4.25 or even 4.5 out of 5 stars. The food was generally good but did vary from dish to dish and it tended to be on the heavier and kind of one note side. I round up to 5 because it was definitely on of the best bars I have been to in San Francisco based on the menu, drinks, service and atmosphere.
author: Seema U.

description: Great place to grab a drink and a bite to eat. The cocktails are great and the wings, octopus and cauliflower were excellent. We were lucky to nab a couple seats at the bar... just took some friendly hovering and keeping and eye out for openings.
author: Debbie L.

description:
Service was great! ABV had a good amount of bar snacks and cocktails. My boyfriend arrived before I did to find us a table. Arriving around 7pm is the prime crowd hour. They don't do reservations and the place is pretty tiny. One of the staff members was nice enough to help him find seats for us. Finally around 9-10p the place started to clear out a little. This place is a great pit stop for any late dinner plans. The snack food came out fast and delicious. 
Food: octopus fries and the fried cauliflower were my favorite. We also ordered the New fuckn burger with spicy chips. The chips were more on the sweet side than spicy, but the burger was great. Also the corn dog is a must try for all you Greek food lovers.  
Cocktails: we tried the Mumbai mule it was really refreshing, the Jackle good whisky drink, a lil on the sour side but not bad. Lastly we also ordered la Botana, a mezcal drink. The menu said spicy but wasn't. 
Great place and definitely see myself coming back and having more cocktails and octopus fries!
author: Abby C.

description:
Damn, ABV. You good. 

This has been on my radar for months and every time I am in the mission I forget to check it out. ABV is located right on 16th street but you could walk by 100 times and miss it. There is a small sign out front with two little tables and big bay windows to let some nice fresh air inside. My boyfriend and I were celebrating yesterday and came here to enjoy some snacks and good drinks. ABV did not disappoint. 

On a Saturday afternoon it was surprisingly not too busy in here so we scored some bar seats right by the front windows. The bartenders greeted us immediately and gave us some menus to look over. We are both Mezcal login drinkers so we got a cocktail (forgot the name :( ) with Mezcal and citrus. A nice smokey blend, strong, but great to sip on with some food. The bartender also made me a off-menu Mezcal cocktail that was amazing. Mezcal, strawberry shrub, basil, citrus. Oh, so great for a beautiful sunny Saturday afternoon buzz. 

For food, we started with the toast (how SF) which was fantastic. Crispy toast with cauliflower hummus, and dried fruit, yum! Next, we went for the fried cauliflower bites. Crispy and tossed in harissa these little spicy fritters were addicting, salty, and perfect. My meat eater bf got the kansas city ribs with Mezcal bbq sauce (notice a theme here?) and said they were perfect (as he licked his fingers clean). 

In all a fantastic experience. The bartenders were attentive, friendly, and knowledgable about drinks. The food paired perfect with the drinks. The portions are small, but I like this so you can try a lot of different bites and not commit to one huge meal. It seems the food and drink menu rotates a lot so I can't wait to go back and try some new items!
author: Kelsey B.

description:
I'm a huge fan of dive bars. They all have such personality with character's who frequent them. So, that being said, and me being in the Mission Disrict at cocktail hour, I had my choice of many.

But much to my surprise, I chose ABV to settle in on my bar stool with my wife and son. This is hardly a dive bar. This was actually a really nice bar with millennials mixed in with us old folks to make interesting people watching. 

The pours are generous and our bartender was this very nice kicked back guy who knew a lot about tending bar.

We didn't have any food here and it was not because it didn't look great or smell great, cuz it did. We were on our way to an Omakase dinner and didn't want to sabotage it.

But.....our next trip to ABV we will certainly jump into both food and drink!
author: Sidney Z.

description: (09/02/17) Popped in after shopping nearby and it was a nice experience aside from the heat. Most places don't have AC in the city bc they don't get 100°+ heat like in the valley lol. I almost ordered my whiskey sour with egg whites for the first time but the bartender suggested I don't since it was so hot. The whiskey sour was good but I enjoyed the ones from Third Rail and Burritt Room a little better. The bartenders were cool and the prices were decent. Next time I may have to try "The Fucking Burger" which replaced their popular pimento cheese burger.
author: D B.

description: Great cocktail menu with a little bit of something for everyone! Super organized by alcohol type and they make some really awesome gin drinks! I would highly recommend this place for a night out in the Mission
author: Helen F.

description: Came here for a quick drink and maybe s a bite  to eat. Was told after one shot that they would not serve us any more alcohol. Bull shit. Will not be back.
author: Nicole D.

description: Went here early on a Wednesday evening.  Not packed but definitely busy. Wasn't too impressed walking in.  But certainly was walking out.  Service was phenomenal    Good selection of unique drinks.    Very cool music playing.   Had the pork tacos which were really good.  Saw some of the other food coming out and it all looked good.   Food menu isn't huge but a good variety.
author: Kevin K.

description:
ABV = Average Bar Verified

It's alright, nothing really stood out to me. Drinks were the usual. Nothing really special about the design or inside. It was super packed for a Thirsty Thursday, don't these people got work the next day? The back area had horrible spot lights and there's a weird wall that protrudes out in the middle.
author: Steve C.

description:
This may have been the best burger I've ever had in my life. WOW

I honestly don't even know what was in it but let me tell ya, it is un-freaking-real. Not too big either, so it's perfect if you aren't terribly hungry. 

If the burger was THIS good, I can't even imagine how good everything else on the menu is. I will definitely be coming back to find out for myself.
author: Ilana B.

description:
