Yep, this place is as good as advertised.  Met a few co-workers here and the decor was setup perfectly.

Great beers on tap and the food was great!  We had the chicken tacos, grilled octopus and fried cauliflower and they all were great.  Octopus was really tender and sitting atop of great seasoned french fries.

The employees were great also.  They hit the perfect balance of attentive but not overbearing.

Give this place a try for an after-work drink or appetizer.
author: Mark W.

description:
Went with some friends and snagged a table outside to enjoy some sunshine, snacks, and cocktails.  This was one of the rare times I felt like I ACTUALLY got a $12 cocktail.  I forget the names of the drinks but my tarragon gin cocktail was so delicious and refreshing.  My friend ordered a whiskey sour, it came out shaken foamy and beautiful - I've never seen a basic drink like that so transformed. He claimed it was the best whiskey sour he'd ever had, still $12 but again, a worthy $12. 

On the food, I tried a few of my friends foie gras olives, they were a little mushy inside but not bad.  The lamb falafel corn dogs were everything I was hoping for, such an delicious take on a corn dog!  We were all talking about them throughout the day afterwards!  The burger was also very good, I tried a couple bites of my boyfriend's.  

We all left feeling happy and satisfied, you definitely get what you pay for here and more :)
author: Katie L.

description:
I brought a large group of clients here for a happy hour, and ABV exceeded my expectations with terrific and attentive staff, amazing craft cocktails and interesting bar bites. Gotta try the Japanese Tater Tots, octopus and mushrooms

It's my new favorite neighborhood bar in Mission. Thank you to Max, Erik and Irene, y'all are fabulous.
author: Kristine S.

description: This is one of my favorite cocktail bars in San Francisco. Anytime I have visitors from out of town, or people just visiting the mission area for the first time, I always take them to ABV. Their cocktails are amazing - my favorite being the Mumbai Mule. In fact, the Mumbai Mule is so good that the first three times I went there, I refused to try anything else on the menu. Since then have tried several other cocktails, none of which have disappointed. The fried cauliflower is my favorite snack off the food menu. Excellent place for small groups or first dates!
author: Sunny S.

description: Manager is a jerk and very arrogant. Was told he would not take a picture of us in a rude manner. Then I went to walk outside to company my friend to smoke a cigarette and the manager came out of no where put his hand on the door and told me I couldn't walk outside with the cup WTF. Yet their were little bistro tables outside were others were able to have their drinks there. Went to experience on of the worlds 50 best bars but definitely not a top bar or management.
author: Robert P.

description:
Really good spot for cocktails in the city! The service is good and the bartenders are extremely knowledgeable. It can get crowded on weekends but generally you should be able to find a spot to sit in a few minutes if your group isn't very large.

I've been here a couple of times and tries most of the whiskey cocktails, and they've all been on point. 

They also have food which I've heard is pretty good, though I haven't tried it yet.
author: Tanay J.

description:
When you open a bar for bartenders by bartenders, you leave no room for mediocrity. 

Because they KNOW Industry people are the hardest critics to please, but then ABV is no novice to those they serve.

What does that mean for you?

You get nothing but the GOOD stuff. I mean, GOOOOOD.

The excitement was pumping in my veins as soon as we sat down. There were SO many cocktails to choose from! Take for instance the ODB cocktail: blanc rhum, fino sherry, banana liquer and coffee bitters. It's a brisk drink! I say that because it's not a typical drink you'd order for brunch, but it really cuts through the fattiness of the bar foods that we ordered. If your style is more fruity/agave, the Pina Verde with tequila, pineapple and genepy will do it for you. Or for non-drinkers, a mocktail like the Pineapple Basil lime soda is tops.

Naturally, all this drinking will get you hungry. The Pimento burger was recommended by my fave bartender and boy, was he right on the money! This thing will add another inch to your waistline but you'll be so happy eating it, you just won't give a damn. It's 1/4 lb. grass fed beef patty combined with 12% aged beef fat. (weird huh!) It's a compact burger but the MMMeat is thick and works with the pimento cheese, pickle slices and caramelized onions. I'm drooling just typing the description! It's a really, really great burger. I just wish they offered french fries on the menu, it felt incomplete without my fried potato sticks!

Their chicken karaage is amazing. Just how amazing you ask? it's served with mini bacon cheddar biscuits. A Japanese/Southern fusion dish that totally works. And you need to order the kimchee fritter which is basically an okonomiyaki topped with bonito flakes. Doesn't boozing make you crave Korean food? ;)

The time to come is after hours because they're open til 2am and even serve food until 1am. Since I've changed my vampire ways (i.e. need my beauty sleep!) brunch is now my thing. I'm just glad San Francisco is a big drinking town that it doesn't really matter whether you get wasted at 12 noon or at midnight.

ABV you just rock! 

Vesper approved.
author: Janice C.

description:
All the people who gave this place good reviews are not from San Francisco and have never talked to the asshole server for more than 5 seconds. 

$13 for a pink drink that's literally sugar water. I could pay $4 to get powdered hummingbird nectar and add vodka to it and have a better drink. 

They're uptight, rude, and everyone here looks like they'd take part in an annual purge party. 

This is the definition of gentrification. 

I'd rather swim in a flooded sewer than use their stinky ass bathrooms. 

Tip: don't stand near the kitchen unless you wanna be asked 20 questions about who you are and who hired you to spy on their chefs. 

Gestalts is literally right across the street, friend. 
And Blondies is right around the corner.
author: Lindsay L.

description: Very cool place. Very good Martini and finger food was grubbing. Be sure to order the ceviche.
author: Marty E.

description: I like this place! It suits my vibe of mid 20s-30s crowd, not trashy, not uppity, good cocktail list and bar bites! Music varies- one time they played Vincent's Fernandez main hits. Kinda weird for the scene but I liked it. Anyways, there's always a server and they're actually quite nice! WOAH. Sometimes there's a line but it keeps the place from getting overcrowded and never being able to get service. Food is actually good and nicer then the standard bar fare. Ceviche was on point. I'm not quite a regular, but I have found myself there more than once :))
author: Joana Z.

description:
Probably one of my favorites in the mission. Its not as loud as other places (Bond Bar) and the vibe is that of a quiet and cozy bar. the drinks are good -not very cheap but hey they take credit cards!

The seating is really fucking limited so if you're a group bigger than 4 then its going to be a pain. I went there with 3 other friends and we were still standing at the bar. 

Also since this place is small, they don't let everyone in, so we did see a line outside in the cold. Since folks can also get snacks here, I can imagine the wait in the lines would be long.

Service is pretty good - they served us water and refilled repeatedly - unlike anything I've seen in SF.

This place is perfect to go for a chill time to talk to friends and get a drink. If you're a few drinks down then it probably makes sense to actually go to the louder bars in the area (Bong Bar)
author: Arjan N.

description: The fusion tapas are great and the cocktails are excellent. The only downside is how crowded it gets!
author: Shir K.

description:
3 Years ago me and a friend went to ABV hoping to grab drinks and bites. We ordered the cannoli and after one bite, realized the dairy was spoiled. When we alerted the waiter he apologized and suggested the cheesecake instead. My friend told him she was concerned and wanted to shy away from any other dairy dishes. We ordered a meat dish instead but when she requested silverware he said that they were a silverware free establishment. 

How do you eat cheesecake without silverware? 
Haven' been back since.
author: Cara H.

description: The bartender sucked but the atmosphere was amazing! I will come back for the atmosphere'
author: Mary N.

description:
Such a hipster bar :)

Came here over the weekend with some friends to grab a few drinks. I had champagne, but the mixed drinks looked amazing! My friend really enjoyed hers. We also ordered some abalone mushrooms and grilled octopus w/ fries. Both were DELICIOUS! If this place wasn't so smaller and crammed, I'd come back. It's just so hard to get seating.. and you NEED a seat/bartop to order food.

Reaches capacity easily.
author: Anna M.

description:
I agree with one other review of this place. The drinks are good the food is good, except not having to eat it without silverware. However the staff is filled with arrogance and assholeness.  

I came with 3 other friends and our waitor gave us such an attitude about splitting up the bill. Which is totally weird cause one of the friends that was here with me had just came here with a bigger group another time of 10 people and the staff that day automatically split the bill for them.   
Our waitor; a short stubbiyish guy with glasses had such a fit about giving me his name so I doubt he gave us his real name; His exact words where "oh it'll take me like 20min to split the bill so I can't do that" Being the nice person I am I asked for a pen and offered to organize the bill for him, yet he still kept repeating himself how it would take him to long. Imo, isn't that what your paid for? this is his only job. Yet on his possible hourly wage plus tips or however he gets compensated here, he didn't think he should spend in his words an exaggerated "20 min" to split our tab. After frustratingly told him to split he finally agrees to let us organize the bill for him. And Omg you could feel the weird anger coming from him as he shakingly handed us his pen. Lol what an effing joke.   Even as we organized the bill and took it to him he started to become more difficult and looking for excuse to prolong closing our tab.  Idk what his problem was. He seemed so nice and helpful at first too.
author: Lindsay J.

description:
Have been coming to this bar for a long time, since it first opened, have spent thousands of dollars here, done interviews here, through all the incarnations of bartenders and drinks and menus. Remember having great convos with the barstaff. They've all turned over by now. 

It was a nice cocktail bar with interesting bar bites.

This is a review of their bouncer. The angry guy with the red framed hipster glasses, red jump suit, and power trip. 

A friend and I arrived around 9:30pm after dinner with friends on Friday. Not busy, no one in line. I walked up with my ID in hand and said hello.  He looked at me and nodded, then looked at my friend behind me, who said hi. I stood there for a moment, and he did nothing...

So I took 1 step forward to walk in. Which apparently set him off into an explicative-filled tirade about how I was going to have to go somewhere else and was banned for the night because I... who fucking knows, we're still confused. My ID was still in hand and I said sorry and tried to show him my ID. But my extreme act of ... disrespect(?)... was too much.

We were both incredibly confused, but we left. Didn't really care. He's having a bad day or something. Went to Elixir across the street and had a great time with a few friends, and started to walk home... and we happened to pass by ABV on the way.

He had left his post at the door and was smoking outside by the street. Didn't even see him until he barked at us through his cigarette. 

"Keep walking bitch," he barked. We turned around confused and saw him shaking with tension (we were still so fucking confused). 

My friend thought it would be funny to go into ABV since there was no one at the door. So he went in and I followed. (It was funny, if a bit immature). I mainly wanted to talk to someone about the doorman.

The door man.... obviously not at the door... finished his cigarette and a few minutes later came inside and went to a bartender to get him to tell us to leave. 

5-6 people came in unnoticed while he was smoking. Great stuff.

The blonde-haired guy bartender who has always been kind in the past tried to remedy the situation; he was put in a bad situation by his very interesting doorman.

I was just glad I got to explain the situation to him. I'm sure he was confused as well but he handled it well. Of course he has to stick with his crazed co-worker(ish). Trying to find someone willing to sit at a door and check IDs all night is hard and he didn't want him leaving middle of the night on Friday.

We're still so confused about this entire situation. I thought writing this out might allow me to make some sense of it. Alas, still makes no fucking sense :). 

Guessing he was having a bad day or something but for whatever reason he dissuaded us from spending $100 there last night and we will never be spending there again.

Realize hiring doormen is hard since you know... not many people dream of being a doorman when they grow up... but sucks that such a great place we loved going to has now been ruined.

Good luck in life angry red framed hipster glasses man.
author: Dan R.

description: Bartenders are personable, knowledgeable,  and super talented (esp. Irene)! Friendly and fun too! Irene introduced me to a celery martini, and a delicious pineapple sherry cocktail... whoa!, just what my virgin tastebuds were craving! Had a lovely time this Sunday afternoon, and can't wait for my next visit.
author: Color C.

description: Best bar I've ever been to -- absolutely incredible mushrooms, ceviche, and a burger that was spot on. Service was also pretty good and the overall vibe of the bar was really nice
author: Kunal M.

description:
Two tables of outdoor seating here; you sit and get served right away.  The cocktails are fantastic.

Whiskey in Church - smokey and strong

Mumbai Mule - tastes like Indian food with not a strong alcohol taste, topped with mint

Tarragon Collins - very herby, great if you like tarragon

Octopus a la plancha was well seasoned, but the texture was slightly off (drier than I was expecting).  The fries were fantastic. $10

Charred brussel sprouts with xo sauce was very greasy and the sauce was just ok for me - not too flavorful, but it had a good kick to it.  It was more the puddle of grease at the bottom and the grease that dripped from each brussel sprout as I lifted it off the plate that turned me off.  $9

The snacks were a tad pricey, but they did the trick at keeping our hunger at bay before dinner.  Service was great and our waitress was knowledgeable about the liquors.
author: Christina G.

description: Am a neighbor and come here sometimes. Don't usually write reviews but had one bartender that was very rude. A place with this high of class should not have a bartender that is rude to a couple. A bartender (Asian male with glasses and gelled back hair) made a rude remark to me (the man) and then winked at my girlfriend. Right away we asked for a check and left. Only reason we left a tip is because of the quality of the drinks and food and the other bartenders. A place this good should not hire bartenders of this level...
author: Matan S.

description:
Cool spot with a large selection of drinks! My friends and I got here for a friend's birthday at 9pm on a Saturday and it was packed to the brim. After we got in the bouncer said it was officially at capacity. 

We were super lucky to find a small table area and were served relatively quickly. They mostly have hard and mixed drinks, but also offer beers, ciders, and small bites. 

It's a small joint, but there is standing room if you can't find a place to sit.
author: Emma W.

description: One staff member was rude, but another was fabulous so let's call that even. Drinks were nice, liked them but didn't love them - especially the mule with the saffron in it. The drink tasted like a curry, which my friend and I weren't super into. They did give us a delicious shot of a pineapple liquor each as we left though, which we loved. I'd go back.
author: Peita D.

description: Came here on a Saturday night. The staff was very attentive in giving us menus and taking our orders. It took awhile to get our check, but this is a bar after all. They are able to accommodate a large number of people because they have multiple areas for patrons, including counters, tables, and outside seating areas too. They actually had freshly squeezed orange juice. I'd never been to a bar with that!
author: Sean A.

description:
love this place. has a bit if a hipster vibe (well it's Mission, duh) but the bartenders and servers are super friendly, not obnoxious as is often the case. they have a great cocktail menu, weighted toward tequila drinks, which is not a problem ha!

really love the vibe here and will definitely be back for more food and drinks
author: Bob U.

description:
Limited food choices, but pretty good.

Older crowd? Professionals, I would say, for the most part. 

I tried the Mumbai Mule, and sorry to say, but I hated it.  Don't get me wrong I love Indian food, but this drink didn't do it for me.

I love the octopus appetizer, but it was in the saltier side. So if you don't mind retaining some fluid the following day, then this is a must-try.

Fish tacos were okay, nothing exceptional. If you order this and you are hungry, beware, these are tiny tacos. Like size good for a little 10 year old girl.

Ribs were good for a bar food.

Ice cream is like a sandwich ice cream and for me, it has an alcohol taste. Not your typical ice cream.

I like that this bar has community table. So if you like to mingle and don't mind strangers sitting in front of you or next to you (listening to your convo) then you'll like this place.
author: Sarah L.

description: Best Burger I have ever tasted!! This may be because of the fantastic pre-burger drinks but people- try. This. Burger.
author: Lauren T.

description: Disrespectful bouncers. Could handle entrances more cordially rather than using obscene language and judgement to ward away individuals.
author: Alejandra H.

description: Went there for drinks on a Friday night. Not too packed, just the right amount of people, and we got lucky and found some seats at the bar. Good music, good mixed crowd and the drinks were on point. Very friendly and attentive staff as well.
author: P S.

description: The cocktails and the tacos will knock your socks off! Small tapas portions for most entrees, but a great ambiance in the afternoon before it's too crowded!
author: Leah F.

description: Returned for the second time and it was no fluke.  Food was once again on point combining speedy service.  We had the burger (good), moouse Crackers, Japanese Tots and ceviche.... really no complaints here.  Will be back soon!  Drinks were very good (try the jackel)
author: Patrick C.

description: The burger was decent but obnoxiously salty, to the point where I couldn't taste anything else. Also would've been nice to have a bigger patty for $15.
author: Dan B.

description: Get "the fucking burger" you will not regret it, my mouth is watering just thinking about it. A girlfriend and i stopped for a snack and much needed cocktails after a rough work day. The bartenders were nice, and even checked on us after we left the bar area for a table. A great place all around!
author: Monica S.

description:
Came here for the pimento burger. Worth it!!  A word to the wise: their menu changes so don't assume they will have all the items you see on yelp. The pimento burger brought me here and I was eager to try a chicken pot pie empanada I saw on yelp, only to find that they didn't have it. 

Anyways, ABV is a really cool spot with awesome staff that was really easy to talk to. The sign is just a little discret sign next to the menu outside and you can easily miss it when walking by if you aren't familiar with the area. I could definitely see why the pimento burger made it to the big eat list. You have to try it for yourself. It has a certain mix of flavors that distinguishes it from other burgers, but I can't quite put my finger on it. It is rather small and definitely not a meal by itself (or maybe I just eat a lot).  It is bar fare afterall, Just REALLY well executed bar food.  Also got the mumbai mule. it was good but I probably wouldn't get it again. Everyone around me had really interesting cocktails though.
author: Thielson D.

description:
Great bar with lots of alcohol. 
This is heaven for people who loves spicy food but not for me. My "not spicy" ribs were sooooo spicy that I can't decide how to fix my burning stomach.
author: Olya H.

description:
More like 4.5 stars. :)

So I'm 5.5 months pregnant and still felt welcome and comfortable at this place. :)

Eats:
- lamb corn dog: unique/have not found it elsewhere during my travels. Adult/foodie version of the corn dog and loved it! (5/5)
- pimento cheeseburger: nice pickled vegetables and big enough to share. Patty was not over-worked and you can taste the beef. Nopa's burger is still my favorite, but this is a close runner up! Pimento cheese was well spread on the patty! (5/5)

Drinks:
Do you know they make an amazing sparkling water with lime!?!? So when I'm pregnant, all I want is sparkling water with lime...and it was the most exquisitely made sparkling water I ever had in my life! My husband had a cocktail and he said it was exquisite too. :) 

Vibes:
Nice crowd, not pretentious, down to earth, great bartenders and wait staff, music not too loud 

Extra touch:
So standing with my baby bump really gets tiring. Thanks to the nice waiter and other staff that pointed out a vacant seat! Super nice! 

Repeat business?: fo sure! :)
author: Mary H.

description: The only good thing about the date I had here. Servers are attentive, ambiance is romantic, drinks were excellent and fairly priced.
author: Radha S.

description: Came here for the burger, but it was just ok, the meat's got a weird non-meat-like texture. But all the finger foods were delish! I recommend the cauliflower and mushrooms!
author: Jin Z.

description: Great place if you want well crafted drinks, good service and want someplace where they manage the in flow of people so it doesn't get too crowded and you can actually hear your friends speak!
author: serena n.

description: Amazing Burgers!   My family and I found the table near the back of the restaurant.  We had the cauliflower and burgers.   I've never had a better burgers!
author: James L.

description:
This is a great cocktail bar but the secret is out. You won't find a seat here anymore which is disappointing. We'd love to see you open another bar in the Mission.

Pretty pretty please!
author: Robin K.

description:
photoging & blogging foodmetic
all the branches of the eating tree
but listen without the foods of brunch every day girl

author: Dan B.

description: Very inhospitable, left without eating/drinking. From the doorman to each person we met working inside, they could not have cared less about serving us or helping get us seats. Basics.
author: Phil M.

description:
The food is a little overpriced in my opinion, but the octopus and s'mores are delicious. Boiled peanuts are also an interested option, if you're into damp nuts. 

Can't speak on any of the specialty drinks, but they seem to have lots of options. Also, the space is nice. They have a small upstairs seating area (ok, it's just one table with ~10 chairs) for groups and it's open until 10pm on weekdays (not sure about weekends?). It was cool for our group of 9 to have a place to ourselves that wasn't too crowded.
author: Vasiliy M.

description: After an art show, I came here to have a cocktail with my girlfriend. The waitress served my girlfriend a drink but refused to serve me a drink, because she said the door man thinks I am wasted. My girlfriend and I each had only one beer before arriving. The watress also said I was slurring my words. The reality was,  I'm a brown man with an accent and English is my second language. My girlfriend is blonde and white. I think I was discriminated as a person of color with my accent to order a drink at this place. All my friends were offended for me, and they said as a white male I wouldn't have had that problem. This may be an implicit bias. The waitress apologized after we talked to her about it but  regardless it was very disrespectful and embarrassing. Staff should not be so quick to judge people. I don't recommend going to ABV if you're a person of color!!
author: Ali L.

description:
Every once in a while you eat or drink something that resonates harmoniously on  your palate. The flavors and textures are so remarkable that they become ingrained in your memory and the experience of enjoying said item simply cannot fade. These are the menu items and experiences food and drink lovers seek out, and I can say confidently that ABV has many of them to offer.

We came to ABV by another awesome recommendation from the best bartender in Seattle, future husband of Yelper Katy H, the one and only Jim, who has no initial because he isn't on Yelp.

Katy H suggested we make our way here after enjoying a beautifully hot, spicy, sticky and sweaty meal at nearby Mission Chinese. So, with the promise of AC and great drinks, off we went!

This is a sexy bar. Combining accents of industrial concrete and metal with organic elements like warm woods and dim candles, the ambiance kind of wraps you up in it and makes you forget about what lies beyond the doors or who's tweeting, texting or Facebooking you for the duration of your visit. 

The menu alone could keep a cocktail lover entranced and entertained for hours. Divided by base spirit, there are some very interesting drinks here. In my old age I've begun to appreciate the simpler things, so I tend to stick to those with the fewest ingredients, but I also enjoy exploring the broad spectrum of each type of spirit, and lately I'm all about Mezcal and gin.

Being the first night in SF I thought I'd saddle up to something a little smokey and spicy and settled on a mezcal cocktail that is a riff on the classic Blood and Sand. From the first sip to the last, I savored each and wished the glass would never go empty. I fell so head over heels for this drink that I began to proudly parade it down the bar offering friends a taste, which in hindsight was a bad idea because I got less :( oh well! I even went so far as to snap a shot of the menu and texted it to my bartender buddy in Reno hoping he'd perfect it by the time I got home (he hasn't). 

Oh how I wish I could just have another, or maybe one of their other clever concoctions. Either way I know I couldn't go wrong here. This is my kinda bar. Great drinks, educated staff that can explain the nuances of the many spirits that line their shelves, and a killer atmosphere that just may make you feel too comfortable! 

Run, don't walk to check this place out. You won't be sorry.
author: Michael T.

description: Found this little gem walking on 16th street. Let's just say the snacks on the menu are the best I ever had at a bar. This place is so yummy! Awesome cocktails and beer selections! Amazing staff. Can wait to come back!!
author: Izzy A.

description:
Specialty cocktails galore!  I got their Highball, which was a spritzer with a slice of lemon exterior layer and Japanese dark liquor.  It was pleasant for the whiskey, cocktail lovers with a hint of refreshing zest from the lemon! 

They have other cocktail varieties, so if whiskey isn't your cup of tea, there are others that will suit your style. 

Service was splendid and ABV offers industrial decor to bar dining as well as upping their bar bites.

I really like their bar bites!  Their grilled octopus with snazzy squid ink ranch on top of spiced up and nicely crisp, diced potatoes, was like a gourmet gastropub dish.  Too bad it is served up in petite portions. I could have ate 3 of those orders and that would have cost me a mighty 30.  That would have been a mighty meal somewhere else.  They offer other delights, such as kimchi fritters and mapo sloppy joe, that caught my eye.

I will definitely be back for more tries on drinks and bar bites.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Come here for the Mumbai Mule. I've travelled Mumbai and this is a wicked drink that captures the flavors of the city in this sweet, spicy and highly potent drink. 

Sweet vibes, good looking crowd and friendly staff.
author: Janice K.

description: Love these guys. That spicy fucking burger whatever it's called fucking rocks. Service cool. Seriously try the dam burger.
author: Abdul C.

description: I love ABV!  And so do other people that's why it's super packed!  Probably my only downfall.  It wasn't too big inside, felt narrow.  Vibe was cool.  Playing some old school hip hop jams.  Diverse crowd, but so loud inside.  After having my piña verde at Forgery I was hooked on it.  It wasn't on the menu, but Marco knew what I was talking about.  Made me a couple of those drinks and I was good.  Will come here and check out their new bar Overproof upstairs for those special events....
author: KB B.

description: Excellent place for cocktails! After spending the day in the city my friends wanted a cocktail. We first went to Delfina but it was crowded and only served wine and beer. Thanks to the hostess recommendation and yelp users we walked up to ABV. Two of us ordered vodka martinis that were perfectly dry. However the bar does not use olives packed in brine, so they are not capable of making a dirty martini. My other friend ordered a tarragon gin cocktail that was colorful and refreshing. I appreciate the atmosphere of ABV. Bartender and servers were friendly and accommodating. I'd definitely going back next time I'm in the Mission.
author: Erin J.

description: Awesome burger. Amazing Negroni. This place has become a tradition for me. Usually crowded in the evenings, but perfect for day drinking. Knowledgeable bartenders and a quality selection of liquors. Truly no complaints.
author: A J.

description: Nathan is the man! He makes a mean drink with a sweet smile. Can't wait to go back!!!
author: Aly C.

description:
Casual/nice bar in Mission District.

Dropped by around 3PM and was pleasantly surprised. 

- Extensive drink menu/great cocktail menu
- Super nice bartender
- Grilled abalone mushrooms were so simple yet amazing

Would love to come back at night when I'm up in SF again.
author: Erick M.

description:
ABV is a swanky little bar. Tall and long, with a bar on the right and the kitchen in the back, ABV is slender with plenty of seating in the back, at the bar, and space to stand on the left against the wall. There are a few seats outside as well but alcoholic beverages are cutoff at a certain time at night.

A line did form on a Saturday night so take this into consideration. This place is popular and they don't want people stumbling over each other just to get as many people in as possible. 

The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We had a party that wasn't all there at the same time. They helped us find a spot to sit once they all arrived. I had a few highballs and the night was fun.

This is a chill bar with dim lighting. We didn't order any food but the options seemed legit. Come here to get a good cocktail, not a regular watered down beer.
author: Rawlins R.

description:
Really solid high end high ceilinged bar with an occasionally stellar tapas menu. For drinks the famous Jackal and Mumbai Mule deserve their accolades. The best tapas are the ribs and the squid with aioli (which is served over a side of fantastic fries - slightly crunchy and sometimes loaded with olive oil). The more well known fried kimchi was disappointing (and thinner than in the recent past) while the fried cauliflower were consistently tasty and the foie gras stuffed olives a delicious bargain at $6 a serving.

Arrive before 9 for the best shot at bar space and much earlier for a table.
author: Aaron M.

description:
+ Good drinks
+ Some seating in the back
+ Appreciate the ledges along the wall to place drink down even if there's no seats available
author: Margaret R.

description: Cool spot for a date or drinks with friends. I stopped in solo, mid-week to grab a drink & a quick bite. Like the simple, upscale menu. Service was fast and friendly. My suggestion is to avoid the weekend crowd unless you come in early.
author: Joe F.

description: 0 stars if I could. Absolutely awful. Started our night here and strongly regret it. Horrible service. Rude staff. These positive views cannot be legit. No silverware, forced to have your burger bloody. Everyone at my table was ordering their food and the waiter walked away before I could speak. So so disappointed. Walked out as soon as possible and when walking by later on heard them yelling at their customers to smoke farther from the bar, which I get because it's the law but you shouldn't hear the bartenders yelling at their customers from down the road. The owner of this place must not come around much and if they do... shame on them for allowing their customers this type of expierence.
author: Brianna S.

description:
Awesome spot. Food is amazing: we've tried the cauliflower and the tacos. The chicken tacos are to DIE for. Perfect place for a good dinner with drinks and a bar vibe. 

Great cocktail list. I love the jackal and gf is a fan of the tarragon Collins. Lots of choices and good mixology.

Ambiance is solid - dimly lit with loud music but easy to lounge and talk also. 

Big fan and highly recommended!
author: Farid V.

description: Favorite bar on 16th street! It's a precious gem. The servers are well trained on the menu and so knowledgeable about drinks. Food is unique, haven't tried the entire menu but the Japanese tater tots were OK. Drinks are fabulous though!
author: Stephanie J.

description:
I dragged my boyfriend here for some ill-advised drinks on a random Tuesday night. 

Actually, my intentions were to drag him to ill-advised drinks at Hog and Rocks, but after walking by, we decided the scene was a bit too much for us, so we walked down Mission (which actually transforms into a dangerous crack den after 8) to ABV--an excellent alternative. 

The cocktails are impressive, but even more impressive is the bartenders who are making them. These kids know what they are doing, and not in a holier than thou bartender-beard-vest kind of way (vexing and tiresome, especially in the Mission), or a Tom Cruise re "Cocktail" kind of way (which still beats self-righteous steam punk), but in the refreshing "I know what I'm doing and I'm the best at it but I'm still humble and friendly" type of way. 

Our bartender was the master of multitasking - no small feat in a fully packed house with a complex cocktail list.  Even though our bartender was clearly busy, he greeted us and gave us menus right away.  I was appreciative, because that almost never happens. After perusing the cocktail menu, which divides cocktails by type of alcohol (I.e., vodka/gin, agave, whiskey etc.) I started with the Transamerica Punch, and for my boyfriend, the Tarragon Collins. Both drinks were tasty, but the Tarragon Collins was the winner of the evening for me - with only gin, lemon, tarragon and soda, it was clean and refreshing, and the tarragon worked nicely with that simple combo. 

For the next round, which we were able to order with  relative ease following our first round due to our attentive bartender, I ordered the Mumbai Mule, and the boyfriend ordered the Lefty's Fizz. I loved the Mumbai Mule (just wish it were served in a copper cup), and my boyfriend's Fizz was also good but smoky, so keep that in mind if you aren't a mezcal drinker. I really love egg whites in a drink you know? It's so enjoyable. 

My only regret (even though my motto is "no ragrets") is that we didn't order snacks, especially considering our dining experience later that evening, which I will refrain from addressing until I give a certain unnamed establishment a bona fide second chance. But my boyfriend had been to ABV before, and he quite enjoyed the falafel lamb dog. After all, how could that be bad?

All in all, I advise that you have all of your ill-advised cocktail needs met at ABV on Tuesday nights, Wednesday nights - or hell - all of the nights. Normal Mission crowd: hipsters straight up with a twist of douche. Typical San Francisco cocktail prices, but remember that ATMs in the Mission are on lockdown after 8, but ABV accepts cards. Service is outstanding. Bathrooms are clean. Walking after 8? Skip Mission and use Valencia, unless you need crack. And cheers!
author: Sunny S.

description: Came to ABV for drinks before going to Tawla for dinner. We were only able to stay for one drink and one snack, but we really liked what we had and the vibes in the bar. I had a Mumbai Mule (vodka, lemon, ginger, mint and soda) and we all shared the fried cauliflower with harissa and aioli. Great, tasty bar snack. It was pleasantly crowded at 6pm on a Saturday, but we were able to snag 4 seats at the bar. The tables in the back were also full and it got progressively more busy as we sat there. Will definitely keep ABV in mind when out in the Mission or seeing a movie at the Roxie.
author: Zoe P.

description:
What's the opposite of "tragically" hip?? Optimally? Perfectly?  I don't know; consult a thesaurus next time Lee.  But what ever the adjective might be,  ABV is hipster Goldie Locks;  Pimms Cups and Biggie.  Falafel Lamb Dogs and Bombay by the Boat IPA.  No silverware and low lighting.  Brunch at the bar with Micheledas.  
We want ABV like we wanted that high school crush; more than we knew what to do about it.
author: Lee S.

description: My favorite bar in SF! They make the best cocktails IMO and have the kindest staff working there. My friends and I bought our drinks at the bar and then walked them to a table at the back of the place. A bartender stopped by and poured each of us a glass of water, which I thought was so nice :)
author: Moez K.

description:
Hey, man. Any place that pays attention to the non-drinkers like me gets love. Not that that is automatic qualification for full stars, but it was the icing on the cake. I'm usually sipping water when I'm at a watering hole, so the "0% ABV" section of their menu is pretty attractive, if not a simple way to take care of the teetotalers.

Add in the not-aloof bartenders (the cooler-than-thou barkeep has their place, but ABV isn't one of them) who was willing to talk about the drinks, a pretty snazzy bar (that pressure activated cup washer was hypnotic) and a location with plenty happening around you, and you've got a recipe for the W.

The place has a few small seats, but we sat right at the bar. I chose a pineapple basil concoction from the mocktail menu, and it was fresh and lovely. Not too sweet, pretty simple, and enjoyable enough to nurse for the evening.

Lest you think they're about the mocktails, I can report that that part of the menu is but a teeny weeny part; they have lots and lots (and LOTS) of booze on hand and can pour many kinds of full-spirited beverages.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
I would give this place more stars because the drinks were very good but there was an obvious lack of seating so most of the patrons had to stand by the bar and that blocked the walk way so people were bumping into each other. 

I came with a bunch of friends and we were bar hopping in the SF area. I decided to try their version of the moscow mule which turned out to be absolutely interesting. It tasted like an indian cuisine and the flavor was very deep and it had a nice spicy kick to it. I really enjoyed my drink and it was decently strong but nothing crazy. The menu of food looks very interesting and I would come back and try their asian fusion food items.
author: Anna Z.

description:
TL;DR - My go-to bar in the Mission.

If its cold out, and I mean too cold for El Techo, I'll be at ABV. 

Every drink here is phenomenal and while I am not usually a fan of bar bites, ABV has me sold on almost all of their tasty treats. 

Come in the down time (does that even exist here?) or be prepared to stand/wait. It gets SUPER crowded, but for good reason!
author: Crystal Z.

description:
This place is one of the best cocktail bars that I've ever been to.  We had to wait a little in line in a Friday night but it's totally worth it. They are able to keep the balance of the amount of people inside the bar (not too many were you can't enjoy your drink, not too little we're you can't meet people). 

The cocktails are so good. I had an apple bum and a Paloma. They were both great. The apple bum was not as fruity as I thought it would be but it's far from a complaint.
author: Mariana V.

description:
Checked out ABV for the first time on a Saturday night. I've heard plenty about the cocktails (and the famous ABV burger). The drinks didn't disappoint. My favorite was the gin & celery. It was a great balance of savory, salty and lightly sweet. The casa bonita was also very good.

We were stopping for drinks before dinner so only tried one food item -- the fried cauliflower with harissa and ailoi -- and DAMN it made us wish we were staying for more. The harissa was perfectly spicy and the cauliflower florets impossibly tender. Served as finger food, complete with hand wipes as a thoughtful touch.

Service was prompt and friendly despite it being incredibly crowded. I'm eager to go back for more drinks and a full meal.
author: Elena K.

description: Excellent drinks and food. Octopus was amazing and so was the fried  cauliflower.  Eric, our bartender was super cool.
author: Candy H.

description:
After leaving a horrible bar down the street, my son and I were fortunate to enjoy a quality establishment. We stopped in for just one drink, but it was well worth it. 

The atmosphere is chill and mellow, but not sleepy. The servers are friendly and helpful. The drinks are top notch quality. 

I you are in town and in the Mission District, I suggest seeking out this bar. You cannot miss on this choice.
author: Nancy L.

description: Very expensive but I think the octopus fries are one of the most amazing things I have tried in the city in a long long time. The octopus has so much flavor that I wish I had a basket of fries and 15x more of octopus than they put on. Great atmosphere and local to all the mission bars.
author: Günter L.

description: ABV opens at 2pm Monday thru Sunday and cocktails are thoughtfully made! It is great to not have to wait til 4 or 5pm to go get a well made cocktail during the day out. This is a neighborhood bar that is very welcoming and relaxing. The bar food is a step above what you would get at other places (see pictures). You can easily make a meal by ordering 2 to 3 dishes. Prices for cocktails and food are reasonable.
author: Van T.

description:
An overview of ABV: a slightly pretentious, artesian bar with an upscale vibe in the mission district. 

We came at midnight on a Friday night. There is no signage at all, I didn't know if we were in the right place until I looked at the menu. I ordered a vodka red bull and a cherry coke, but the bar tender was not down for that. They did not have red bull or flavored coke. He was kind of pretentious with his big beard. Instead, we ordered a Mumbai Mule and a Coca-Cola (of course a glass bottle) with grenadine (a cherry coke). The Mumbai Mule had saffron vodka, mint, and other fun mixings which I've forgotten. He made the drinks very artistically, which was nice and pretty but resulted in him being the slowest bar tender I've ever had. The Mumbai Mule, thankfully, was worth the wait and was a fancier, more artesian, take on a Moscow Mule. For straight liquors, they had big, clear ice cubes which is always a good sign. 

We settled at some of the nice tables in the back. The lighting was nice and music was good. The waitress was very attentive and checked in on us a couple times. 

ABV would be a great date spot with its awesome vibe, fun drinks, and new menu choices (like octopus and potatoes with squid ink ranch!!).
author: Alec T.

description: We hated the service so much that we left a couple hundred dollars worth of food and drinks untouched. We paid and just left. Sorry but your food isn't good enough to warrant your atrocious service. Teach your bartenders and servers some manners.
author: nikkita l.

description:
A rather small yet cozy bar in the Mission district, ABV offers an extensive selection of their house cocktails as well as several small bites.

The Mumbai Mule (saffron vodka, lime, ginger, mint, and soda) is a different take on the Moscow Mule. It's deliciously light, savory, and refreshing. It's strange, yet very interesting. Definitely give it a try!

The kimchi fritter is a cross between a fritter (texture) and an okonomiyaki (style): spicy kimchi battered and fried until crispy, then topped with a savory, possibly mayonnaise-based sauce, green onion, and bonito flakes. It's a little too heavy for one person to finish, as it's very oily.

Although I'm not a huge fan of lamb, I thought ABV's falafel lamb dogs were quite tasty too! Juicy and spicy lamb sausages coated in a cornmeal batter and fried paired nicely with the accompanying light yogurt sauce.

Service was great, and given our large group, we were attended well. Background music isn't too loud, so you can actually hear and hold a conversation without screaming. Although ABV is a little hipster-y and discreet from the outside, their cocktails and small bites surely aren't to be missed.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
I live in the neighborhood so ABV is within walking distance, and ends up as a place for meeting with friends.  Most of my visits are drinks oriented, but in my most recent visit, I ordered the Octopus a la Plancha, a dish I really liked when I ordered it months ago.  This time around, the price seems the same but the food portion has shrunk to 1/3 the size of before.  What happened??  Did management change?  It's a great disappointment to see the bar decrease the portion size significantly without much of a difference in price. 

Also, their norm is no silverware, that's fine, I can understand that for cost cutting purposes they don't want to deal with having to wash the silverware, but at least with the octopus a la plancha, give a couple toothpicks so people don't need to be holding octopus with their fingers. 

ABV - I'll be back when you provide better value on your food items.
author: Mary X.

description: Tribble! Rude bar tenders! Terrible service! I asked for baileys and he said no and I asked for similar drink he gave me a bitter drink, dont go there unless u are desperate!
author: Leila K.

description: Probably one of my favorite bars I've discovered in the city so far. Love everything about this place. Great vibes, great drinks, and even better food! The Octopus a la Plancha gives me life.
author: Nikki I.

description:
ABV has some great reviews, so maybe I came here on a bad night, but I was pretty disappointed...

Service: We were at a table in the back, there were 9 of us. We had a difficult time flagging our server down... then when someone did get his attention, he'd take the one order and walk away so we'd have to wait until that one drink came out to order the rest of them. Or, when we ordered drinks, some would never come out.

Food: The burger was good, but it wasn't a burger. It was a $10 slider. I could've eaten 3 of them. They came out on tiny plates (I think to help offset the small size), but they were so small. 

Drinks: Actual drinks once we got them were good and they had a decent selection. Heard they were known for their mumbai mules. I'd get it again.
author: Mandi W.

description: Incredibly hospitable staff, good food and strong mixed drinks. This hole in the wall is AMAZING! I can't believe I've never heard of it.
author: Julie G.

description: Great atmosphere, service, food and drinks! I ordered the Burger and Spicy Chips! It was freaking great!
author: Billy N.

description: All the bartenders here seem great and I love the crowd. The prices definitely aren't cheap but the quality is there. The food is great as it should be for a place like this.
author: Jensen D.

description:
ABV is the place to be in the Mission! 

This discrete cocktail bar has no sign out front, yet everyone seems to know about their killer cocktails and bar bites. I came here with a few friends on a Friday night and the place was packed! The only seating we could find was a communal table upstairs on the balcony, which we shared with another group. 

I have to admit the cocktails are worth the hype. Order the Tarragon Collins and thank me later. I also enjoyed a taste of my friends Mumbai Mule. The saffron is very prominant in the Mumbai Mule, so if you're not into the spice I would skip it. We did not have the chance to order any food, but the charred padron peppers and collard green dolmas sounded especially tasty. The service, drinks and ambiance at ABV were all excellent and I look forward to returning soon!
author: Rachel S.

description: Their burger was pretty good and the staff were cool. The food was better than expected for a bar. The bar itself is quite fun on a Friday or Saturday night
author: Sam S.

description:
Drinks. Lots and lots of drinks!

This was our second and last stop of the evening. Granted it was a Wednesday night, so we only had one round. (Well, I may have snuck off and had a couple more, but I didn't take any pix of those.)

*Dartmoor ($10): apple brandy, lemon, juniper infused honey, basil
*Old fashioned
*House Gibson ($11): gin, dry vermouth, orange bitters, house pickled onion
*Whisky in church ($14): smoky scotch, oloroso, maple, smoked pear bitters
*Fogerty ($11): rye, campari, cacao, orange bitters

I wanted scotch and I don't mind some smokiness in my drinks, so I ordered the Whisky in church. This is definitely an end of the night drink. The smokiness of it may be too strong to start the night off. Perfect for me since I wanted some strong and bold in flavor. Especially having had several rounds at the bar prior.

I'd love to come back and try some bar bites. And of course, more cocktails as well!
author: Elena N.

description:
It's hard to find a classy spot with good drinks and food and ABV is exactly that.

It wasn't too crowded for a Sunday date night and we easily found seats at the bar. I had several Mumbai Mules, which were a tasty twist on my favorite Moscow Mules. He asked for whiskey recommendations and the bartender clearly knew his stuff. I was very impressed.

We tried the Octopus a la Plancha, which was served with delicious fries and a chimichurri-like sauce. The octopus was cooked perfectly and had a great flavor. We also ordered fish tacos and they were small but delicious. I would definitely come back again and recommend ABV to others.
author: Yi Z.

description:
ABV is now one of those gems that has been slowly found by the yuppies and hipsters of the Mission. I love this place and wish that it could be my little secret, but I guess writing a raving yelp review isn't helping me cause, is it? Coming here after showing people around the city of SF and coming from Dolores, ABV was definitely a place that we used to sit, relax, get a refresher, and some good cocktails to quench our thirst. 

DRINKS: Among many drink options that are changing, I got the Casa Bonita. I am a huge fan of agave based drinks (mezcal, tequila, so much yum in my favorite type of hard liquor) and the bartender (didn't catch her name, but she was superb) was fast, precise, and great with a shaker. I found my drink to be of the perfect strength and worth the $11 for my drink. 

Overall, I would hope that ABV keeps to its charm and relaxed setting unlike other Mission bars (of which I do love). I like the fact that it is not crowded and the drinks are delicious and the service is great.
author: Albert H.

description:
You guyzzzzz: I've found a bar who serves up fantastic cocktails and equally fantastic bar food (which isn't easy to find... usually the drinks trump the bar food). Enter: ABV. 

A friend from New York was in town and wanted to meet up for some giggles and good bites. Knowing she'd enjoy somewhere trendy-but-not-pretentious, I figured ABV would be the spot. I'd never been before, but hoped for the best. *Ding ding ding!* We have a winner. Upon entering, you'll notice it's buzzing. Bodies are pressed up against the window and walls (*cue song* "to the windowwwww, to the wallssss!!!"), people are laughing, music is playing, glasses are clinking... Happily, I was able to grab a seat at the bar. It was around 8:30 PM on a Thursday night so it's relatively busy. 

My friend told me she was running late so I decided to start without her (she insisted in her texts). I ordered a falafel lamb dog. Wow. Now, this is definitely not your ordinary bar food. It was supremely good; battered just right, fried to perfection, and the lamb was on point. When my friend showed up, we ordered more drinks. I had a Mumbai Mule (saffron vodka, lemon, ginger, mint, soda) and later, a Tarragon Collins (gin, tarragon, soda, lemon). Both were refreshing. 

As the night carried on (and as the topics got more provocative and real), we ordered more food. I mean, story-telling and laughter make you hungry right? Next up on the menu: grilled little gems (I love the sweetness of little gems and ABV's was also charred beautifully!) and pulled pork tacos (great for eating with drinks). Another star of the night was their meat and cheese platters. For the meat platter: Virginia speck, sweet coppa, sopressa veneta. For the cheese platter: cottonwood cheddar, sui generis, moolicious blue. Charcuterie at its finest! Did I mention the buttery, grilled bread that comes with? Hello! Oh, and also the various mustards, mostardas, and spreads. I... I can't even... right now. 

Our bartender was attentive and was surprisingly calm despite the volume of drink requests. The woman running out the food also did a nice job of explaining what we were eating (and she spoke loudly which was necessary since it was definitely poppin' towards the 10 o'clock hour). Our catch-up time at ABV helped convince a true-blue New Yorker that there's a magic in San Francisco quite indescribable. While there are dozens more reasons to explain that feeling, good food and good drinks in a fun atmosphere certainly play a role. ;) Check out this spot. ABV is totally worth a try.
author: James Z.

description: Deeeelicious cocktails. Food is good. Kinda pricey though I appreciated the disaster relief shots, a nice thought.
author: Porter N.

description: Terrible service especially on my birthday! Very surprised. My girlfriend and loved coming here and brought our friends this time. This was our first stop. We ordered one round of shots and after that was cut off. Seriously! We did nothing crazy or out there to deserve this. The bartender was rude as hell. Definitely not coming back and making sure my friends aren't either!  02/24/2018
author: Eric S.

description: Interesting cocktail bar in the mission. We went there for food and drinks. Be careful that there isn't a lot of seats, so you'll either have to stand or arrive early to get one of the tables in the back. The cocktail list is not long but original, like a mezcal cocktail with pickle brine. Overall good and unique cocktails, and the food was also quite tasty, particularly the octopus and fries. The main issue was the difficulty to get hold on our waiter when we actually wanted to order something, but they seemed to come all the time when we didn't need them. They were however mostly really nice. All in all a good place to go with a small group of friends. It might not be the best place for a date.
author: Helene P.

description:
Definitely overrated and overpriced, but a pretty good atmosphere for the most part. Me and some co-workers checked out this place after failing to find anything else that had the kitchen open past 10pm (I mean seriously, how are the bars open until like 1 or 2 but the kitchen closed before midnight on a weeknight of all nights come on. I could see them closing the kitchen early on weekends but geesh). 

Actually, we REALLY came because supposedly they had fish 'n chips here, but lo and behold we were told that was from an old menu. Which sucks because the old menu is better than this new, hipster-ville menu they have now.  Like Who tf eats grilled octopus in a BAR? I feel like Bar Rescue has been through here or something LOL.

Drink: I ordered something called a Tarragon Collins, which I thought would have more of a berry-like taste, but after some research realized it's an herb, resulting in the drink being kinda minty and almost cough medicine-like, but still drinkable. $11 for a medium sized tall glass.

Food: Three of us kept it safe and stuck with the only sane-sounding thing on the menu: The Fish tacos. Of course the last of our party had to be persuaded by the upselling server and get the octopus, and falafel dogs hahaha, and luckily he liked it. 

So to get to why this review has to be two stars: you only get TWO small fish tacos. for a whopping EIGHT (8) dollars. That's like 4 dollars a taco. NO BUENO. Granted they are very good, fish battered and garnished with red cabbage and this creamy sauce, but dang this is a Mission bar not some upscale fancy restaurant. Not sure why you only get two tacos for 8 dollars. I could probably see 5 or 6 dollars for two but even that's a bit much for a Mission bar. Shows you just how much gentrification is taking over, and it's a very sad thing, people.
author: Marquis A.

description:
All the bartenders here seem great and I love the crowd.
The prices definitely aren't cheap but the quality is there.
The food is unique as it should be for a place  like this. 
They have outdoor and indoor seating.
THey make a great Mule here, I'll definitely give them that. 
Met  a great girl at the bar, she's pretty scorching hot.
author: Luke S.

description:
Cute, tasty cocktails. Place also has a sexy vibe that's good for pre-dinner drinks. Minus a star because seating is pretty limited. 

Haven't tried the food here yet but I'd definitely come back to check it out. 

Try the Mumbai Mule.
author: Roxy J.

description:
Been wanting to try this place for a minute! Swung by after dinner at 8PM on a Saturday with a group of 5 and managed to snag a table!

Mumbai Mule: saffron vodka, lemon, ginger, mint, soda. I love how light and refreshing this drink is. If you like ginger, I highly recommend this one.

Gin & Celery: old tom gin, lemon, tonic, celery bitters, salt. The celery flavor really comes through. Delicious!

Land's End: jamaican rum, lemon, dry curacao, honey. Looks can be deceiving. This unassuming pink drink that comes in a champagne coupe really packs a punch. Surprisingly it was the strongest drink of the bunch! Not my type of cocktail but if you want the most bang for your buck, I say go with this one.

I wish I wasn't so full from dinner bc the food looked so interesting! The menu theme is definitely fusion. Ex: Kimchi fritter, mapo sloppy joes, chicken pot pie empanadas.

Service was helpful and attentive. I'll definitely be back to try the food.

Tip: Come early if you want a place to sit and chill. The bar was so crowded by the time we left at 9:30.
author: Lucy N.

description:
Came here for drinks and it has such a cool drink menu! 

The menu is easily organized into different types of alcohol (vodka, gin, rum, etc) which made it easier to narrow down our order! The bartenders were also great at giving suggestions! 

I ordered the Moscow mule and it was unlike any mule I've had before. Rather than the sugary ginger beer commonly used they used actual ginger!! Tasted very pure and natural. 

Not to mention their menu and decor changes every 3 months making this place a different experience every time you go!
author: Megan S.

description: Love love love all the different snacks. My german shepherd was greeted with a bowl of water. LOVE thats it's across from the theatre.
author: Dawn A.

description:
Very rude and disrespectful personnel. Bad and overpriced cocktails. 
NEEDS TO BE AVOIDED
author: Vasilis K.

description:
Big fan of this place-- it's laid back, the bartenders are nice and the drink menu just can't miss. 

I came here for happy hour on a thursday (well a late happy hour, I think it was around 8PM), but it was pretty busy! They have little bites I think? But we didn't partake. Sitting at the bar is nice, because people watching is best there, but it's pretty tight. If you can, try to move to the back area where there is a little bit more space (along the wall) away from the bar.
author: Lai-Nin W.

description:
In a city with a seemingly endless amount of cocktail spots, ABV stands above the crowd! Bourbon & Branch still sets the standard against which I measure other cocktail bars, in terms of both the quality and the breadth of drinks offered, but ABV manages to offer great drink options in a more casual atmosphere. The place gets packed on Friday and Saturday nights, but I can usually walk in at most times and find a seat at the bar in short order. Sometimes you just don't want to make a reservation to go to your favorite bar, right? Add in chill background music and a large menu of bar bites, which is available even late, and you get a combination that is unbeatable in my opinion.

I'll echo the consensus and say that you absolutely must try the pimento cheeseburger! It has on multiple occasions hit the spot after a night of barhopping. In terms of drinks, there are many options from which to choose, and I recommend exploring the full menu, but a few of my favorites are the Mumbai Mule, The Jackel, and Whiskey in Church. Oh, and be sure to check out the bottom side of your coaster for some potential amusement.
author: Rodney G.

description: Rude staff at the bar.  Aggressive waitstaff that was augmentative and confrontation upon greeting us. Not a relaxing or fun atmosphere.
author: Kandi H.

description:
Really cool spot in the mission on 16th and Guerrero. Went to dinner across the street with some friends at Les Ros Thai and then came here after for a drink. 

Admittedly, I'm not much of a cocktail person. I was leaning towards my staple of a vodka soda or perhaps a scotch (neat), but when everyone else in my group ordered a Mumbai Mule I was convinced to give it a try. 

Glad I did! The art of there cocktail making is fun to watch (always the best part of any cocktail bar, IMO), and the outcome was quite tasty. And also larger and stronger than I expected. At $12 a cocktail this place is definitely posh, especially for the location, but at least the drink was tasty and strong. 

They also have a bar snacks menu. I didn't pay too much attention since we'd just come from dinner, but looked like you could get some decent snacks there along with your drinks. 

Also like the decor and vibe. We snagged a table in the back when another group left so we got lucky. The upstairs looked fun to hang out in but it was pretty packed so didn't make it up there. Maybe next time.
author: Krista S.

description: Drinks were strong! Food was amazing. We ordered the octopus, chicken wings, the fuckin burger with spicy ass chips, fried cauliflower and cheese plate. The cheese plate comes with bread and it's delicious! Our server was so friendly and attentive. He hinted that a group was leaving so we didn't have to stand. There was a drink menu in my friend's hand as soon as she took her last sip. And he also hooked it up with more bread! Definitely a chill place.
author: Maia D.

description: This is a very dark and quaint bar. To be honest, it made me a little claustrophobic, but it's San Francisco, when don't I feel claustrophobic? The drinks were great and the bartenders were friendly. The food left a little to be desired, but that is typical of a place that focuses on craft cocktails. I would recommend to anyone who wants a "hipster" experience in the Mission. It's very convenient to grab some Bi-Rite after.
author: Kaitlyn F.

description: Severely delayed review (dropped by ABV 2 weeks back) but I just had to post this on yelp - ABV WAS THE , IF NOT D BOMB.  What an awesome awesome establishment with delicious drinks, dynamic crowd and I repeat, fantastic drinks (beers and cocktails)! Didn't get to try their tapas but I am pretty sure it would not disappoint. One of the cocktail I ordered was not strong enough to my liking and one of the owner of the place (can't remember his name right now) immediately made another new drink for me. I had such an amazing night there and I wouldn't think twice Travelling back to San Francisco (from where I am - 16 hours flight) just for this joint.
author: YaQi W.

description: When it's not super crowded, ABV is a great place to hang out for great drinks. If you can snag a table in the back, then you have a bit more breathing room and can order some of their amazing food.
author: Erik P.

description:
Go on a Wednesday night! Think about it -- it's hump day and you need a drink. That's why ABV is THE perfect solution for this -- because the drinks at ABV are NOT just drinks, they are actually very well crafted cocktails. The mixologists behind the bar pride themselves with knowing what alcoholic flavors can be mixed to produce wonderfully concocted elixirs that will satisfy. You take a sip, and you immediately feel, "yes, I so needed this drink." and the night seems much more merrier. 
The food menu is also excellent for a bite to go with your merry cocktails! The Whiskey and Church was the winning cocktail for myself! With just enough peatiness from the scotch and a hint of sweetness. The Dunmore Cobbler receives the second win. Ah, I cannot say enough good things about this place! You just have to try it yourself.
author: Belle V.

description:
It was the 'Cocktail Queen' herself, Rohini Moradi, who introduced me to one of my new favorite bars in the Mission - ABV. Her drink of choice (and mine now too) is the Gin & Celery - Old Tom Gin, Lemon, Tonic, Celery Bitters & Salt. Beyond this regal beverage is an entire menu of artisan cocktails all given royal treatment when prepared by ABV's talented mixologists. Go for one cocktail and stay for another... or a few more (like myself).
Raise a glass with me... to well crafted cocktails.

Cheers,
Allie

http://www.theallieway.org/spirits--cocktails/gin-celery-abv
author: Allie M.

description:
Nice long table in the back for ~20 people. Nice casual, yuppie bar in the mission. They only have food-truck-style items that come in little paper plates. We ordered the meat & cheese boards and they were (thumbs up emoji). Not huge portions, but the large was good for about 6 of us.

I was tryna be alc-free the day I came, so just had the raspberry lemonade which was delicious. Very extensive drink menu; don't remember what music was playing; service was okkaaay - the waiter actually forgot my brussels sprout order but our party was also pretty big.
author: Juliana P.

description:
When Thrillist hooks you up with a burger recommendation.

The Pimento cheeseburger is really yummy - a quarter pound grass fed beef patty that is thick and juicy. Together with the pimento cheese, pickle slices and caramelized onions, it's simple but absolutely droolworthy. The fact that it's listed as bar food should inform you of the portion more than the price. We split the $10 burger between two people and it barely would have been filling for one. But it's worth the price tag and the several drinks you'll probably end up ordering with the super friendly bartenders! 

The octopus and fried potatoes in squid ink ranch is a must-try. This is the side that'll fill you up. They have about five or seven octopus legs and a small heap of potatoes chunks, covered in glops of black squid ink ranch - a very distinctive taste! A rare combination of flavors and ingredients that work quite well together. The bar food menu has a lot of fun options so even if these two don't appeal to your tastebuds, there are plenty other choices that people around us seemed to like. Or maybe they were all drunk - after all, we were at a bar.
author: Celestine A.

description:
After seeing the rave reviews, I chose ABV to be the start of our bar crawl in the mission. As soon as we found seats, we were given a glass of water and they were constantly refilled. What service!

I tried the Mumbai Mule (literally TASTES like India...sounds weird but it's true. Loved it!) and the Tarragon Collins (super refreshing). I thought both of my drinks were fruity and light. Where as the guys got the darker tasting liquor drinks and those were more bold and tasted strong, a bit too much for my tastes. I'm a clear alcohol gal anways =)

We didn't try any food but the bites that they had looked and smelled delicious!

Excellent and friendly service!
author: Noelle H.

description:
Great bar that embodies what I like about SF: good food and drinks with no attitude in a casual environment.

Drinks: 4, Snacks: 4, Service: 3, Atmosphere: 3.5
Cost to worth it rating: 3 (Cocktails: ~12 Snacks $7-10)
Return worthiness: yes

Highlights:
- Cauliflower: Unexpected pre-dinner snack highlight. It was a fried harissa version that was crunchy and well seasoned. 5 stars
- Octopus: grilled with chunks of potatoes and a squid ink sauce. 4 stars
- Menu on the wall: changes based on what they have
- Mumbai mule: I love mules but they are getting pretty overdone so it was nice to see one with a twist of Indian spices

Lowlights:
- Wait for drinks: since there was only one bartender and cocktails are pretty involved, after a while (over 10 minutes), we needed to cancel an order to make our dinner reservations
- No pot pie empanadas: saw them in reviews and sounded so great, but they didn't have them the day i was there

We only had an hour or so before dinner but I'd come back for more.
author: Eve K.

description:
Generally, the Mission is more of the dive bar scene, but this place is also a chill place to hang out with light bites and good drinks where you can have a conversation without yelling, and not have to deal with a rowdy crowd. Simply put, ABV is one of my favorite bars in SF. 

Drinks here are strong (mostly mezcal, whisky, and gin based drinks) but tasty, and average out to about $10-12 per drink. Bartenders here are helpful with drink recommendations, but not overly and obviously friendly just to get tips. I've switched up which drinks I've ordered, as they are either unique or they put a spin on a classic (e.g. Mumbai mule).

Don't just come here for the drinks - the food here is also awesome! Two items between two people is a good amount. The snacks are on the pricier side given the portion size so prepare to pay up. If I'm looking for a meal out here, I'll order their pimento  cheeseburger ($10), which is a full portion (none of that slider business). If I had to choose one item to order, it would be the kimchi fritter ($7). The batter is similar to takoyaki batter, but shaped like a seafood pancake.  

Sometimes "crowded" is a better word to describe this place rather than "cozy", which is understandable given their solid bar bites and drinks menu. The person who checks your ID outside is usually good about letting the right amount of people. There is seating all the way inside, at the bar, or sometimes I've stood opposite of the bar with a small counter space by the wall.
author: Aimee K.

description:
ABV definitely lives up to the hype. I love that it's more than just a Cocktail bar- you can eat flavors from all around the world here, served in unique and fusion type snacks/light bites that are fun to share. Find things like the kimchee Fritter, Bunh Mi, or a Falafel Lamb Dog on their menu!

We had a few drinks each and loved each one- there isn't a bad cocktail here.

The space isn't all that glam - it's a straight up bar which takes up the majority of the space at the front, but there are some tables along the room as well as in the back/upstairs area. Nothing fancy schmancy. If you want that sort of cool, glitzy ambiance, opt for Novela or Whitechapel SF in Soma or TenderNob.

Unfortunately, on weekends, ABV gets crowded! Get there early or go on off nights. Perfect spot to start the night with delish drinks and bites.
author: Veronica S.

description:
True or False:

The service friggin rocks.
True.

The cocktails are stellar.
True.

The food is exceptional.
True.

The pimento cheese burger is all kinds of juicy & delicious.
True & True.

The pulled pork is smoky, tender, & tasty.
True, True, & True.

The service is angry.
False.

You knew that last one was false, right?

Seriously, the service was refreshingly attentive.  And pleasant.  And quick.  I had to remind myself I was actually in the mission.  It was even Saturday night for chrisake.  But it was early.  Before 7:00.

We both loved our drinks.  Gin & tonic for him.  It's made w their special gin of course.  I had the Eastwood.  Just as crisp, smooth, & intoxicating as the man himself.  What would have been mad sick is if the song Clint Eastwood had come on, too, right?  But I thought of the song, so it's kinda the same thing.  

Speaking of music...
What was played crushed it.  I don't know if it was a personal playlist, pandora, or what; but I was compelled to Shazam two songs while we were there.  Music gets 5 stars.

You're going to want to order 2 burgers.  After trying mine, the man actually said "they know how to make a burger."  

That's the best endorsement they could get.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Mr. NSS: "Where are we going tonight?"
Me: "Let's check out ABV that softly opened last week."

Mr. NSS: "What does ABV stand for?"
Me:  "[A] [B]eezie's [V]ajayjay"

Mr. NSS: "You're going to let me look at ABV?!?"
Me: "Umm yah, sure."

*Arrive at ABV*

Mr. NSS: "Hey, this is no 'ABV'!"
Me: "Ummm, yes it is. It's a new bar called [A]lcohol [B]y [V]olume." 

Mr. NSS: "Not funny...."
Me: "DRINKS ON ME!!!"

Admittedly, I felt bad for tricking him into going to a bar when he doesn't even drink. Hey, but I made sure to pick a bar that also serves food. I get my drank on and he gets his grub on. It's a win-win situation.

Softly opened last Tuesday, ABV took over the old Tokyo Go-Go space and has transformed into a sleek bar serving cocktails from a Bourbon & Branch and Beretta alum with bar bites from a St. Vincent and Bar Tartine alum. They're currently open daily from 2 pm - 2 am. Kitchen closes at 1 am. 

The drink menu is separated into alkie categories: agave, gin/vodka, whiskey, rum/brandy, beer & wine, and no abv (non-alcoholic drinks). Cocktails are $10-$13. And for all you fernet lovers, they have four kinds available!

I shamefully admit that I broke my 2 drink max rule here. I had four. In celebration of Hump Day. Of course. 

(1) Mumbai Mule: saffron, vodka, lime, ginger, mint & soda ($10): http://bit.ly/1l88QDZ
(2) Dartmoor: calvados, lemon, juniper infused honey, basil  ($11): http://bit.ly/1l89eCk
(3) The Jackal: rye, lemon, pineapple gum, cardamom & egg white ($10): http://bit.ly/1r6sO7R (2 rounds)

Loved all the creativity and fresh ingredients that went into making each artisan cocktail. They were all well-balanced but my favorite was The Jackal. It was nice and stiff just the way I like it so another round was justified. 

Bar food is usually an afterthought but the bar bites here are not to be missed. Just like the cocktails, the menu is inventive and not anything I've seen at other bars: http://bit.ly/1qKqcKV. We sampled about 1/3rd of the menu and plan to come back for that pimento burger on a housemade sweet potato bun and dolmas made with collard greens and dirty rice. 

(1) Kimchee Fritter ($8): http://bit.ly/1nOF6Re
(2) Falafel Battered Lamb Dog w/ tzatziki sauce ($8): http://bit.ly/1tVR6oL
(3) Tiny Fish & Chips w/ malt tartar ($8): http://bit.ly/1neQXZV
(4) Chicken Pot Pie Empanadas ($8): http://bit.ly/1mkBIsf

If you like pajeon and okonomiyaki, then you will enjoy the kimchee fritter which was a deliciously savory pancake topped with bonito flakes. We really enjoyed the Med-American fusion lamb corndogs which was battered with a falafel corn mixture and fried to a golden brown. Dip it into the deliciously creamy tzatziki sauce and enjoy! I wish there was more of them though. 

Mr. NSS loved fish & chips so he thoroughly enjoyed his tiny fish & chips (there were 4 pieces of fried dish hidden under the chips). I had a bite of the fish which was perfectly crunchy with a light, airy batter. The chips were nice, thick, and very crunchy. 

I really liked the empanada crust which was wonderfully buttery and flaky but I wish the filling embodied more of a "pot pie" filling with a savory gravy or maybe as a dipping sauce?

Awesome cocktails and food aside, the staff was fantastic. All the bartenders were very friendly and attentive (hopefully they stay this way as they get busier), and the bar backs kept our water glasses filled. Shout out to Ben, the nicest, and most knowledgeable bartender I've met. Not only did he make my awesome cocktails but he went through the entire food menu with us explaining how each item is made and with what. I also overheard him explaining different types of alkies to the guy next to us. It's clear that the owners did a great and thorough job training the staff. 

ABV has an industrial warehouse meets contemporary artistic sheekness to it. It's one long bar with two communal tables in the back and another one in the mezzanine. It was already pretty busy by 5 pm so I can imagine how pack this place will be when they grand open. 

Needless to say, I woke up with a hangover this morning. No surprise. That's what I get for breaking my 2 drink max rule. 

Well that's what Fernet is for! Yes, it was only 5 am as I was typing this...Fernet, Breakfast of Champions. *hits chest with fist*
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Wonderful drinks, the bar tenders are so on it. The service is efficient and we were seated pretty quickly in spite of the crowd. Highly recommend. Great classic cocktails.
author: Sora A.

description:
Finally! It was my first night out, full of libations and light bites. I got introduced to a bunch of new people through friends in LA and took this opportunity to get to know them a little bit more. They also mentioned a new place opening up a few months ago that served great drinks and awesome food. I was so down! 

Heads up, this place does not have a business sign on the outside. We walked a little ways up and couldn't see it, so we went by the address numbers on the buildings. We eventually found it, packed with people inside. We should have known! The joint is a first come first serve seating situation, bar and table tops. There's two levels, however the second level only has 8 seats max. There are also table top seating outside, which we ended up taking for our visit. The staff was super friendly and nice. We had a server and a server's assistant who cleaned our table between meals and refilled our drinks.
