The server was super nice, recommending drinks and food for our party, even recommending how many food items as to accommodate for the size of our party. I thought that really helped to make this experience awesome!! Here's what we had and here's what I thought:

Drinks:
-The Jackel for $10. Rye whiskey, lemon juice, pineapple gum, cardamom & egg white. Man, I LOVED this drink! The whiskey was definitely the star of the show but didn't overpower the flavors. There's a lot of citrus in this cocktail. There's also a cool ABV design on the froth of the drink. Definitely a highly recommended cocktail!

Food (from favorite to least favorite):
-Falafel Lamb Dogs for $8. THE BEST! The lamb dog was thick and full of flavor. The falafel outer shell brought a true Mediterranean flavor, along with the tzatziki dipping sauce. Such a great dish!

-Chicken pot pie empanadas for $8. I LOVED the outer empanada shell. So flaky and buttery. The chicken pot pie was oozing out and super creamy packed with filler. Another great dish.

-Kim chee fritter for $8. For me, the star of the show were the shaved bonito pieces on top. Nice fishy flavor to compliment the kim chee. Great dish!

-Mapo sloppy joes steamed bun for $7. Although I liked the steamed bao buns, I thought the beef was too rich in flavor, tangy and a bit salty. It was good, but just strong in flavor.

-Pulled pork corn tortilla for $8. Definitely not a crowd pleaser for us that evening. The pork had a nice smokey flavor, but I didn't think the pickled onions complimented it as much and the homemade tortillas, although appreciated, kind of thick for the bite. 

All in all, though, this place was on point! I will definitely return just for the lamb dogs and the Jackel drink. It's a new lounge stirring up a lot of talk within the Mission district. If you're in the area, come by and check it out for yourself!
author: Rockne H.

description: Solid bar bites. Ordered everything on the menu. Favorites: kimchee fritter and the potatoes with squid ink and grilled octopus
author: Grace V.

description:
Dropped in this afternoon since my alcoholic friends and I wanted to find a craft cocktail bar open at 2pm.  We grabbed seats at the bar and the bartenders and barback were all very friendly and attentive.  I have never had my water refilled as religiously as they were doing here, and it was greatly appreciated!

I ordered the Whiskey in Church ($12): smoky scotch, olorosso, maple, smoked pear bitters. Served on a large rock.  Sure enough, they used a very peaty scotch, and I was pleased that the maple and sherry were not overpowering and that the cocktail was not sweet.  That said, the maple and pear notes were not particularly noticeable.  A decent drink, but no wow factor.

My friends tried:
Mumbai Mule ($11): saffron vodka, lime, ginger, mint, soda.  Served in a highball.  This was a nice twist on a Moscow Mule, with a slightly savory and strong gingery kick to it.  It is unique so I can see why it's popular, but it's too girly a drink for me personally.

Lefty's Fizz ($13): mezcal, lime, grapefruit shrub, dry curacao, egg white.  Served in a lowball glass (no ice).  A bit bitter from the grapefruit and soda.  My friend liked this drink but I'm personally not into fizzy drinks and think it dilutes the intensity of the spirit.  

For food, we ordered the lamb falafel dog ($8) and the pimento burger ($9) and I was a big fan of the lamb corn dog!  It was boldly seasoned and complemented by a crisp, refreshing tzatziki dip.  The Inside Scoop SF mentioned pimento burger was good as well - I especially enjoyed the sweet potato bun and the crunch from the homemade pickle.  Since they're small plates, portion sizes are small, but since they use fresh ingredients and the food is well-executed, at least the price is justified.

Overall, I had a positive experience at ABV and would be interested in returning and trying more cocktails and bar bites.  On our way out, our bartender hollered "Thank you!" as we walked out the door.  That warm acknowledgement makes me even more inclined to return.
author: Beatrice W.

description:
*** In Short ***

Small, cozy bar with friendly staff and tasty craft cocktails.

*** In Depth ***

Not having tried the food yet, there's actually not much more in-depth writing to do. Finally made it out to ABV several months back, and, with all that I'd heard about how small the place was, I was actually pleasantly surprised to find it larger than expected.

Ended up trying their Celery & Gin, as well as a Mumbai Mule, both of which were fairly tasty.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - It's been a while since I last went, but I recall a combination of traditional bar high top seating and lower not-quite-dinner-height seating. As expected with any packed bar, getting around on a busy night can be a little difficult, but that's solely due to the crush of people, rather than the venue itself.

Bathroom - Didn't try.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Decent amount of seating. Straight forward venue and well-made cocktails. Whiskey in church is beautiful and smoky and delicious and generously poured. 

I had one or three then went across the street to Monk's Kettle for a burger and beer. Great night.
author: Jonathan Y.

description:
Neat spot, my Manhattan was solid, and it adds another option to this 16th street stretch of bars when it's not a Kilowatt or Double Dutch night. (though really every night should be a kilowatt night)

I really want to try the food here, and when I do, I'll update this.
author: Misha T.

description: Drinks are overpriced and come with giant blocks of ice so that you barely get any.  Its a bit crowded most days too, but overall not a bad place to hang out for a bit.  Though thr shared tables make it a tad impersonal for dates.  The server also seemed annoyed to be doing his job of bringing drinks.
author: Andrew L.

description: I went here after the movies Sunday night. Interesting menu choices and great food. Problem with a smug, supercilious and insipid bartender though.  He was very rude to me. He seemed to have a problem with the way I talked and decided it was ok to mimic my words repeatedly over and over, from wanting to get the check to not needing more water.  I finally had enough and when I confronted him he feigned innocence.  I was told he was one of the owners. If your having a bad day keep it to yourself instead of trying to bait your customers.
author: Linda M.

description:
While I've had wonderful experiences at the bar (very personable lady bartenders!) I had a horrible experience at one of the tables in back.

I had arrived early and ordered a gin cocktail (super strong, for all you gin lovers) and my friends arrived shortly afterward. We had a group of five and took a table in the back.

We each ordered a cocktail and had the large cheese plate and some roasted veggies to share.

Fun fact about the cheese plate - the large cheese plate was about the same portion size as the individual cheese plates, if not with less bread... And even though we had a party of five, we had about 3 pieces of bread. ...what? We asked about more bread, and our waiter said he would bring more out. Great, right?

Well we later learned that every time we asked for more bread, we were charged for it. That would have been fine if he had notified us...but he didn't.

Before some of us even got their drinks, this same waiter started a couple rounds of "I'm going to try to clear up your table and give you the bill," before we finally noted that we were still waiting for things to come out.

To sum it up:
Don't rush your customers for no reason - ESPECIALLY if there are empty tables and seats everwhere! 
My group and I were incredibly offended, and will not be coming back.
author: Colleen M.

description:
**OVERALL 3.5 STARS**
Excellent drinks. Great service. Good (but pricey) inventive food. Chill atmosphere.

Dark and sexy cocktail bar in the Mission. Came here around 6 PM on a weeknight at about 1/3 full but unbeknownst to me, filled up at about 7 when we left! Good place to bring a date.
Good drinks. Interesting and adventurous tapas/small plates. Good to chat and nibble while sipping.

Decided to come here after reading about the pimento cheeseburger and how currently have a new chef that *MAY* be changing the menu and taking the cheeseburger off so I wanted to try it before it was gone.

ABV, is, first & foremost, a cocktail bar. I like how their cocktails are organized by type of alchy (gin? rum?) Something for everyone. I forgot what I opted for but it tasted high quality and well balanced. (sorry I'm not good with describing alcohols.. I just know when it's good or bad or too sweet.. lol) 

I'm more of a food gal so we opted for:

Pimento cheeseburger - $10 it was smaller than I expected, serving size for one and came with no sides :( pretty pricey for what it was. It was a delicious and savory burger, with a good balance of toppings, cheese & meat and brioche bun (LOVE ME MY BUNS).. I liked that they knew to help us cut the burger between two of us without even asking!!

Octopus & fried potatoes w/ squid ink ranch - $10 - we knew this was a must get because.. how often do you hear of octopus and fried potatoes and squid ink in one dish?! This was pretty fairly priced, I think there were 6-8 HUGE pieces of octopus that were chewy and tender but not overcooked. Super savory with the squid ink sauce. Some pieces were pretty salty but it went well with the fried potatoes.. which were perfectly crispy and delicious. This would be AWESOME with beer.

Overall I would be down to return to try some of their other items but maybe only if I'm in the area.
author: Emily C.

description:
The service was good. Our servers were really nice and the drinks were great. Ambiance was nice too. Reminds me a bit like MUA in Oakland. 

BUT, the food was lacking unlike MUA in Oakland. I ordered the burger and it is prepared rare-medium rare. I didn't know that and the server didn't mention it. When I took a bite and asked to get it to medium well, they said that they only prepare it one way. The soft shell crab and shrimp weren't to my liking but my companion liked it. Their chips and french fries are good, but I'm not going back just for that. 

Also, no cutlery which makes eating their shrimp and crab difficult and little pay off. 

Good place to come for drinks AFTER dinner and no sooner.
author: Alicia S.

description:
Super rad, low key cocktail bar in the Mission.

Swung by with some coworkers on a Sunday night and there was a good chunk of bar available for us to belly up to. The goal for the night was to do "just one drink" and it was perfect for that (although you could easily stay for a while and work your way through their expertly curated cocktail menu). Drinks are grouped by spirit type and they are about 4 cocktails under each. I tend to be a bit of a gin girl myself but decided to mix things up and went for a rum option instead-- the Land's End (Jamaican rum, lemon, dry curacao, honey). It was excellent and packed quite a punch. I've been a bit dry lately so I definitely walked out of there a bit wobbly! 

Prices are a bit steep but that's par for the course for a craft cocktail joint and to be expected. The spot is quiet enough to have some good conversation, delicious drinks, and approachable and friendly bartenders made this a place I'd definitely return to in the future.
author: Annette J.

description: We came here for a late lunch, had drinks and ordered four dishes.  The drinks were fantastic and the food was a pleasant surprise.  All the dishes were super flavorful and delicious.  I am curious about the Over Proof experience, will need to check that out.
author: ML ..

description:
Excellent service and delicious drinks in the heart of the mission district. Drinks are some what pricey costing between $11 - $15. I had the Mumbai Mule, which is saffron vodka, lemon, ginger, mint, soda, and St. George California Agricole Rum as a Daiquiri. 

It's a dimly lit clean environment with fast, talkative servers and bar tenders. I went on a Wednesday and had a great time and experience, I can't speak for the other days. But, I've been told it's a popular bar that's packed all week long especially on the weekends.

Overall, great place to hang out and I'll be back soon!
author: Christopher L.

description: Really enjoyed myself at this bar. The all around experience was great - friendly bartenders, making yummy cocktails, surrounded by a nice vibe of young professionals. I do wish they had more places to sit though. Next time I'll try some of their food - everything sounded delish!
author: Adriana G.

description:
I stopped into ABV on a Wednesday evening with a friend who was visiting from New York. We easily got seats at the bar, but it filled up quickly. We each had two gin and tonics ($10 each). The fish tacos we started with were fairly priced at $8 for two, and had a healthy 4oz of fish but were on the dry side. Our order of salami ($6) was reasonably-sized, but came plated with our order of cheddar ($6), which was tiny. The portion should have been twice as big, or the price half that. But, this is a cocktail bar. 

Because we had our cards ready, our bartender didn't give us a guest check; when we asked for one to see how it added up, he didn't say anything and turned, begrudgingly, to his supervisor. It's understandable to be frustrated, but it's easy to reopen a guest tab on Aloha, especially when the bar is not very busy and a $20 tip is on the line. In any case, we mostly enjoyed our visit to ABV. If I come back, it will be for a craft cocktail rather than a light dinner.
author: Brian C.

description: Outstanding food, attentive and competent bar staff with attention to service and a smile.  It's packed, a wee bit loud but the experience is a perfect mix of unpretentious food and drink with thorough attention to the product!  Refreshing.
author: Kashif M.

description:
Good place to get a drink after work. 
They have a fun cocktail menu; I got Mumbai Mule (saffron vodka, lemon, ginger, mint, and soda) and Land's End (jamaican rum, lemon, dry curacao, honey). They were both decent. 
I will try the food next time. I had a great night with a friend. Good spot!
author: Christina L.

description: So, the atmosphere is good. Staff is friendly. Food is eclectic but the most expensive item on the cocktail menu..tastes like acidically melted IKEA furniture...like vapor rub...I can't get the taste out of my mouth. I guess the shirts were cool too.
author: Erik A.

description: Great beer, cocktails, and most importantly, micheladas. The falafel dogs are also amazing (very similar to a corn dog). Great aura, lots of space, and courteous staff. A must stop-by for a drink/cocktail!
author: Albert K.

description:
ABV is quite close to my house, and also one of my favorite cocktail bars in the city. This place is very popular, and is crowded on any day of the week. However, they have waiters who are very aware of who's looking to order, and are quick to take your order, and get your drink. The bar area is long and narrow so you might be cramped for space in a big group, but they do have a bigger seating space at the back.

Irrespective, their cocktails are very good. I'm a big fan of mezcal cocktails, and their 'La Botana' - a spicy mezcal cocktail - is always my starter for the night. I'm also a big fan of their 'Big Ghost' (rum cocktail). I can't remember which rum they use in it, but it's smoky and smooth, and also quite strong (which is always good). When I asked the bartender about it, he was glad to show me the bottle, and also offer me a shot of the rum.

If you're hungry, they've got great bar snacks. I usually go for the Foie gras stuffed olives, but they have several other options if you're looking for something heavier.

ABV is one of my top bars to start the night at, and if you're into well-made cocktails (who isn't?), give it a try. As an added bonus, you'll probably bump into me.
author: Pradyumn S.

description:
Delicious cocktails, inventive appetizers and an energetic scene.  Nice addition overall to the Mission mosaic.

I had the lamb corn dogs and something else made of delicious, both were quite good and very creative spins. Their Whiskey in Church (smoky scotch, oloroso, maple, smoked pear bitters) was quite good as well.  Service was a bit hectic because its so crowded but if you're patient and just kickin' it with your peeps, you won't really notice or mind.
author: Saminda W.

description:
There are some places that I bookmark that take me a little while to get to and ABV was one of them. Does that happen to you? A "To Do List" of good things that you just can't seem cross off. Ugh, just me? Well, for how often I am in San Francisco, it is a little ridiculous that I just went to ABV (acronym meaning: alcohol by volume) for the first time not because of how long it took me to get there, but because of how enjoyable that time first time was.

I got to ABV earlier in the day than I thought I was going to, which was actually before they opened, so I went across the street to Cary Lane and dropped a small fortune on some sample sizes that are a-m-a-z-i-n-g. All in, the block ABV is on is relatively straight-forward with some construction, some older shops, some newer hipster dives, a cigar shop, and (of course) ABV. The Mission District is so fun and blendy that way.

Although, if I didn't have the exact address, I would have walked right by this place because the outside is totally unassuming. The front is black with tan woodwork and no extraordinary sign hanging at 90 degrees from the building- just the discreet one on the wall. This reminded me of the time that I walked by the front entrance of The Violet Hour in Chicago seven times before realizing that I was already there. I do not experience shame remembering this story; I'm just saying it happens to everybody (or I am just saying that it happens to me repeatedly).

Anyway, maybe it was serendipitous that I was delayed in my first visit to ABV because I went on a Perfect Weather Day. There was a nice breeze at the bar because they kept the front door open. Happy Hour + a breeze are my two favorite things in San Francisco and even middle-of-the-block-and-not-on-the-water ABV can make that happen.

Carried by the wind, I was greeted immediately and told about specials. The staff was fantastic the entire time I was there- quick and friendly. Obviously, I am a wine girl, so cocktails regularly intimidate me. But, the descriptions in the menu were clear and the very nice bartender made me feel at ease. You could, basically, close your eyes, point at the menu, and order something good. There aren't any failures here. (Well, you know there are probably a few failures at life drinking in the afternoon on a Friday, but there aren't ordering failures happening. You feel me?)

For my first cocktail, I had the Mumbai Mule, which was spicy and bright yellow; the Mule is made from Saffron, Vodka, Lemon, Ginger, Mint, and Soda. It tasted like curry blended with a Moscow Mule, which likely sounds absolutely disgusting to you, but it was actually very good. What is not to love? It is a beautiful, spicy, tall, and yellow drink with a huge mint sprig on top. Perfect!

For a little nosh, I ordered the Falafel Lamb Dogs and the Matzo Ball special. The Falafel Dogs were spicy and super hot, which made for an ideal pairing with the mule. They come with a tzatziki sauce and are, basically, a faultless bar food. The Matzo Ball special was completely decent and a nice little side. If I had room for it, I would have absolutely gotten the cheese plate, if only because it comes with Tartine Bread. Tartine is my soulmate in bakery form.

My next drink (because there was always going to be a next drink) was a Tarragon Collins made with Gin, Lemon, Tarragon, and Soda; it was refreshing and calming after the Mumbai Mule. Excellent cocktail-sequence-ordering for a girl routinely frightened by liquor.

ABV has one long bar on the right in the first room and two large tables in the back room. The gorgeous bar has a sensational selection of upscale liquors. It is the kind of bar that I would have designed. Meaning that my imaginary dream bar has books and nice alcohol on it. Obviously.

If you can, this is a place that I would recommend going to right after it opens or during happy hour because all reports are that it gets VERY busy on weekend evenings. Wait until that perfect blustery, but warm afternoon to head over and enjoy!
author: Erica G.

description:
Hung here with a girlfriend for some opening night cocktails but no food, so this is just for the atmosphere and cocktails.

Cocktails are creative and fun.  There were some unusual combinations that I wouldn't have expected to work together, but they were beautiful to look at and tasty indeed. 

One note, they are not very strong, so more for the enjoyment and experience of the drink, not for getting your buzz on. 

Prices were a bit high, but that seems standard for the area. 

Staff were super friendly and chill. The overall atmosphere was very laid back, with great lighting. 

Get there early or prepare to wait in line to get in, the place was packed. 

Will def be returning in the future as a kick off spot or just happy hour.
author: Karina B.

description:
Drinks = delicious. I only tried the Mumbai Mule (saffron vodka, lime, ginger & mint) which was quite unique and refreshing. $12.00. 

Food = okay. They serve food from 2 p.m. to 1 a.m.  

Grilled Little Gems = disappointment. I wish I hadn't ordered this, as it did not live up to the hype. It was way too dry as it was way too difficult to consume them after two bites. $6.00. (Friend seemed to enjoy the fish tacos though.)   

They do not have silverware, so don't ask. We tried and were told that they don't offer silverware. Bar bites. Use your fingers.  

Service = friendly at the bar. And it's fun to watch the cocktails being crafted.  

Seating = sat at the bar.  There are tables inside, and two tables outside.  

Prices = moderate.
author: Fannie S.

description: This place is small but a great place to add within your list of bar-hopping. I did enjoy the dark atmosphere as well as their food. I enjoyed their lamb corn dogs which is one of the most unique bites I've ever had. Their cocktail menu is nice and has lots to offer! I recommend coming with friends and just taking down a few mixes while chatting it up. People like to come here so the noise level is about medium-high.
author: Allister D.

description: my cocktail was good, but i think the food was even better.  my friend and i shared fried cauliflower, grilled octopus w/ fries, grilled mushrooms and the roasted carrots.  i would have never thought the food would be as fancy and tasty at a bar as they were at abv.  i would come back just to eat!
author: Helen T.

description:
Fabulous cocktail bar.  There are 2 main reasons ABV is 5 stars; 1. they meter entry in an effort to not let the bar get overcrowded.  This made our visit SO MUCH more enjoyable than a typically jam packed bar on Saturday night out.   2. The tarragon gin cocktail aka my new favorite drink - delicious.   

Service was solid and friendly and the few apps we tried were also good - will definitely be back!
author: Kim U.

description:
A very good craft cocktail bar with a couple of things particularly worth noting.  

One is a gin and celery cocktail that was perfectly balanced with a heavy dash of salt, which kept it refreshing and dry without *quite* crossing that dark and desperate line towards savory cocktails.  

The other is an appetizer of "grilled little gems" which were firm enough to eat by hand (!), delicious, and dressed with a nice slick of guacamole and watermelon radishes.  It's not an auspicious category -- indeed, I was recently debating with a friend whether the category has any justification for existing -- but this was definitely the best thing in the "grilled lettuce" category I've ever had.
author: William B.

description:
If you are looking for drinks with a kick, look no further. This is not a typical dive bar that I imagined in the Mission. It's more a upscale hole in the wall, if that makes sense. 
Saturday afternoon was not crowded at all, and my group of friends were able to easily find a table and settle in. I got myself "The Jackel" and it was a bit stronger than I expected, not that I'm complaining. My friends got some whiskey based drinks and were very happy with theirs 
They have some food, a saw a huge menu against the wall. If I was in the area, I would come by here again.
author: Sarika S.

description: Solid drinks, fast service, reasonable prices for the quality of drinks. I've been here several times and always enjoy it. The place gets quite packed, but you can normally work your way to the bar eventually.
author: Jonah K.

description:
Some of my friends love this place so I decided to check it out. Also, you know, on the list. 


Came here on a Saturday about half an hour after they opened. Place was mostly empty. Looked like a few regulars and it was a great vibe. 

They have a great selection of cocktails on their menu with a few craft ones for most of the types of alcohol. I ended up getting the Mumbai Mule since everyone on yelp  basically said it was different and delicious. And...it was! It was a little spicier and had a slightly different taste than a regular Moscow Mule but it was a good experience. I also ordered the Pimento Cheeseburger. Really good but kind of a small sized burger for the price. Not too many complaints there though. They actually comped it because it came out so untimely. Very nice of them! 

Overall great neighborhood bar that can be enjoyed by everyone. Perhaps a bit pretentious but that's how I like my bars. Not sure what's the scene is like at night but during the day it's pretty awesome. 

Protip: get there early and you should have no issues finding a spot and talk to the bartenders and regulars. Definitely a fun spot.
author: Nina Y.

description: Very good cocktails normally, but my party recently had a negative service experience with the bartenders and poorly made cocktails, so we won't be returning again. Great drinks and food as well.
author: Luka N.

description:
Solid place to catchup with friends or take a date. Cozy ambiance, good lighting, music not too loud, though the crowd can be. 

Tried a few different cocktails but my favorite was Mumbai Mule -- it straight up tasted like Indian food. Um yes, please. Most cocktails range from $11 to $15.

The food was excellent as well and reasonably priced (all below $10). My table shared the charred broccolini and kimchi fritters. Both were delicious.
author: Michelle K.

description: Mumbai mule was amazing!  Vodka infused with saffron and cumin added the perfect spice combo to enhance the ginger and lemon!  Old fashioned was very smooth, not my choice when there are so many others.  Piña verde with tequila and pineapple was sweet and tart and tasty but not as interesting as the mule.  The long tables with stools make for excellent opportunities to meet new people or chill with old friends.  Our waiter was incredibly attentive and helpful in making our beverage selections.  I loved the dark wood decor and low lighting which felt romantic and a little dreamy but maybe it was just the company or maybe the mule...
author: Christina R.

description:
"You know you're an alcoholic when you've unintentionally memorized the ABV of the majority of beers and spirits in existence", said my brooding friend during happy hour.

Hmm, that'd be a great name for a bar, I thought. Fast forward a month and I'm thirsty in the Mission... what do I see but a new gastropub with the catchy name!

Their Mumbai mule is my go-to drink. With vodka, lime, ginger, mint, soda, + saffron, it's very refreshing with the perfect amount of bite. It went well with the hearty lamb dogs by balancing out the spice of the meat. The kimchi fritter did not disappoint either and reminded me of okonomoyaki. The bartender also let me sample some of their beers on tap since I was curious about a few.

I skip this place on weekends since it's sardines in a can status but I'm glad to see that they're doing so well. Say no to mediocre bar food, utensils, and pretension; come check out this chill izakaya-style hangout if you haven't already.
author: Jenny Q.

description:
Cool vibe, great atmosphere, delicious drinks!! I tried the Mumbai Mule even though I was a bit skeptical of the saffron vodka. I was pleasantly surprised. I could drink them all night! My husband got a couple whiskey drinks (one with egg white...I forgot the name) - he loved both of them. Apparently, you can't go wrong. We also sat outside as it was super warm out and it was great! Good people watching. 

We didn't try any of the food, but the menu looked good. A lot of small plates, which makes me feel like this place would be good just to hang out and grab drinks. Don't come here if you're super hungry. I wish they had a happy hour special but sadly, no. Otherwise, this place would be perfect.
author: Christina C.

description: amazing drinks, food, and vibes. and AWESOME MUSIC (chill electronic hip hop)
author: Andrea H.

description:
I'm an East Bay girl, so I always kind of dread drinking in the Mission. The scene! The crowds! The prices! The doormen! The waitlists! It's all too much for me to handle. But ABV started our night off right, and didn't fulfill any of those Mission stereotypes, thankfully. 

We arrived at 5:30pm on a Saturday and snagged one of the communal tables in back. They also have a happening bar area, and upstairs balcony seating. The vibe is standard cocktail bar, not trying too hard to be anything. A perfect blank slate for clinking glasses with friends. Service was on-point, we were never without something in our cup, and they very ceremoniously poured the bottle of bubbly we ordered, with proper flutes and all. 

Yes, it's first and foremost a cocktail bar, but even the wine & beer lovers out there can find something on the small menu to appreciate. The fact that they offer 4 sparkling wines by the bottle was a nice bonus for our bachelorette gathering. 

Modern cocktail bar, without all the obnoxious hype. Thanks for keeping it simple, ABV!
author: Nique F.

description: We decided to go to ABV quite late since our body clocks hadn't quite adapted yet from traveling, and we were  wanting dinner at about 10. We found out ABV sold food until 1 am, so we decided to give it a shot and grab some drinks and dinner. Good service and efficiency does not go unnoticed in my eyes. And this place KILLED it. The doorman checking ID's was very nice and explained how everything worked as soon as we walked in (there's seating in the back for food orders, first come first serve. Upstairs takes reservations but they were booked a week out.) We were approached by friendly wait staff/bartender and our drink orders were swiftly taken and filled (and very good). We couldn't manage to get a table in the back, but we did spot one out front and decided to snag it. The doorman, again, asked the group that was sitting at the table to come inside since they weren't eating and quickly got us set up outside as a server met us at the table. I'm telling you, this service was impeccable! And the burger was really great. I highly recommend this place for drinks (although pricey) and late night food. Awesome.
author: Lauren W.

description:
ABV is in the Mission, so yes, it's VFH (very fucking hispster), but it's also RFG (really fucking great). The service is excellent, the food is awesome, and the drink I had, their Mumbai Mule, was almost too good.

I recommend splitting 4 or 5 of the small plates between friends, enjoying cocktail or two, and then taking a nice stroll down Valencia for a sweet treat. So it's a little pricey....It's San Francisco. What else is new?
author: Caddy M.

description: Exceptional drinks from these mixologists with awesome bar food, in a great location not far from Dolores Park. Not at all pretentious and has a good neighborhood vibe.
author: James T.

description:
A diamond in the ruffery of the skeezy 16th street Mission.  I need a DRANK! 

Now don't get the wrong idea!  Me LOVES the Mission - still my favorite 'hood of SF.  But 16th street has always been a little rough-and-sleezy-fa-sheezy ever since I've lived in San Francisco.

It all started when some of my colleagues were looking for a nice place in the Mish for happy hour. They recommended this spot (thank you - cha ching!) and to my surprise...Ahhh, what do we have?!  A fantastic gem of a bar that I would easily bring a date, a group or a business-casual type of crowd.  Sit at the bar, in the front area, or walk to the back to find a generous space for groups and then there's upstairs. So many choices!

It's my kinda place especially for the friendly service. House cocktails are super alchemy, but since I was sans alcohol (my new thing for a spring cleaning), I had to go with the Thyme soda [At least I think it's sans alcohol but don't quote me on that].  Delish!  ABV does have bar bites on the menu that I couldn't try - but once I do - you can bet that I'd be willing to bump up to a 5-star rating :)

They get a solid four for service, ambiance, dranks.
author: Angella S.

description: They have some amazing cocktails and tasty apps. The decor too is unique. We had to wait in line to get in on a Saturday eve.. overall was a bit expensive and crowded so 4 stars. Might try them again for happy hour!
author: Devshree G.

description: Great service. Great drinks. Yummy finger food.
author: Lauren P.

description: If you want silicon valley mediocrity then come. The lack of creativity in drinks is only matched by the rudeness and arrogance of the staff.
author: Michael W.

description:
When people ask for a place to drink in the Mission, this place never comes to my mind. But, I do come here if I remember that can I grab a refreshing cocktail while I wait for the rest of my night to start...or when my friends make me go.

*The Experience*:
Walk straight to the back unless you like to be in a mosh pit at the bar. The staff are good about asking for drink and food orders if you make your way back there so I think it is worth it to muscle your way through the crowd. The back has stools along the wall, at communal tables, and smaller tables for different size parties. There used to be an upstairs that had seating, but the last few times I've been there the upstairs have not been open. 

*The Food*"
My friends go ga-ga over the food here. The kimchi fritter! The lamb corndogs (falafel lamb dogs)! Sounds really good on paper...but not so much in the mouth. I find the food overly salty and not consistent in quality. Sometimes the lamb corndogs are the BOMB and fried to perfection. And other times it is a gooey mess with burnt falafel lamb in the middle) Maybe it's the kitchens way to get you to drink more? And the drinks are good and refreshing...but I find the cocktails a bit on the sweet side so my tastebuds are on a roller-coaster when I'm here. 

*Would I Eat Here Again?*:
Only because my friends like it. I let them order whatever they want and then take a bite and let them eat the rest. The portions are small so my friends don't feel like gluttons for eating my portion...haha.
author: Patricia S.

description: 3rd and best experience on our Saturday evening eat-a-thon, they had some real nice cocktails to choose from along with local beers. The bouncer Andre was a lot of fun to chat with and he kept the crowd in check so as to have some room inside. We wish we had tried their food, but this was our stop to get drunk and boy we did! Prompt attention by bartenders and reasonable prices on beers, cocktails are bit pricey.
author: Sid W.

description: Extremely disappointed in a recent visit to ABV! Will definitely not be returning as well as informing others of my negative experience. My boyfriend and I loved this place before our last visit.  We have visited a handful of times and always had good drinks. In terms of customer service ABV is by far the worst I have ever experienced. We brought our friends here in hopes of showing them a great place in the city to relax and enjoy a quality cocktail. Unfortunately, the bartender was unnecessarily rude and arrogant. When inquiring about the issue we were informed that were cut off. We had JUST walked in and order ONE round of shots, as we were celebrating a birthday, and for some reason they felt as tho we were too intoxicated.  It is beyond me how they came to this conclusion. Only after we ordered and paid for a round of shots did they feel that we needed to be cut off. The arrogant ambiance is displayed thought the entire place, from servers to the menu items. I will not be spending my money at this place anymore. There are plenty of other craft cocktail places in the city that have an understanding of how to offer quality customer service.
author: Brooke T.

description:
WOWEE. 

After my flight into SF was delayed by 3 hours, I needed a pick-me-up. ABV did the job AND MORE. I arrived around 11pm on a Friday night, expecting to wait hours only to be told that the kitchen was closing in 5 min. But instead, I was pleasantly greeted by a dimly lit, not overly-crowded room filled with late 20s to early 30s young professionals. 

The drinks listed on the menu were creatively delicious. I tried my friend's Mumbai mule. It had just the right amount of spice and kick. Even better, the bartenders, who I referred to as mixologists, humbly said "no, no, bartender," as he proceeded to concoct an herbal gin-based libation per my request. It was liquid perfection. Even the homemade shots were delectable.

The bar snacks are well beyond what you'd hope for and oh yeah, the kitchen closes at 2AM!!! The falafel lamb dogs were perfectly seasoned, not too gamey. The banh mi is an absolute MUST (we got a second order, they were so good). Fried cauliflower - hallelujah!

Needless to say, despite the airline trouble, my friends and I ended up staying out into the wee hours of the evening, thanks to ABV!
author: Christine Y.

description:
Great cocktail bar! Stopped by here after a cooking class and enjoyed some drinks before moving on to other places in the Mission. 

The bartender was very nice, and when he forgot to make my wife's drink during the 2nd round, he comped it before we left. Very fast service, and although you have to wait in line for a bit, it is worth it.
author: Mike H.

description: Very good. Mumbai mule is everything at ABV. MUST TRY. Beer selection looked pretty good. And bartenders can mix up most cocktails pretty deliciously. Definitely stop by if in the mission.
author: Carla R.

description:
I came in here for an after-work drink and snack to unwind and had a great time. The service was friendly and professional and the quality of their food and drink was top notch.

The pimento cheese burger was one pretty damn good burger! It was definitely on the small side (almost slider-sized), but the patty was delicious and I loved the small, soft bun. This burger was simple and delicious! My Fogerty cocktail was also neatly made and well balanced.
author: Vicente G.

description:
I love this little spot so much. Props to the bartender who convinced me to try something I never would. I told her I wanted pineapple and refreshing and she explained that "The Jackel" was the cocktail for me (Pineapple, Cardamom, Lemon and Rye). I never ever do Whiskey and Rye (that's the husband's thing) but she told me if I didn't like this drink I was crazy. Fair enough. I liked it. I liked Rye, you guys!

The husband goes crazy for the Transamerica Punch (Pisco, Lemon, Pineapple and SF's favorite: Fernet). They have so many unusual liquors and flavors, you certainly won't be bored at ABV.

The chicken pot pie empanadas, little gems, and cheese/meat boards never disappoint.
author: Nikki M.

description:
If you're looking for a cool, casual bar this is the place for you. What is great about it :
-"normal", nice, and attentive bartenders that seem to genuinely care 
-really unique yet actually delicious food
-extensive drink menu
-cool atmosphere 
We've only been there once but would definitely return. We shared their "New Fuckin Burger" and it was honestly the best burger I've ever had in my life. The flavor was out of this world. They seemed pretty busy when we were there yet the staff was still prompt and super friendly.
author: Cassidy F.

description: Hands down one of the best burgers I have ever had. I'm comparing to steak house burgers as well as typical burger joints. Cocktails were top notch as well- we had the mumbai mule and the jackel, both refreshing and not too sweet.
author: Lida T.

description: All I've had to drink is the Tarragon Collins. Off the GD charts! If you like gin & want a blast of refreshment, can't recommend it enough. So good I'm not interested in anything else-- unfortunately? Tried several of the snacks, everything was tasty--rich alcohol-soaking-up drinking food. The octopus & fries stood out. Service has been great--bar or seated.
author: Joel M.

description:
There was a bit of a line to get in at 8pm on a Friday night. But the door guy was hilarious so that helped the time go by faster. 
So yeah, it's a busy bar, don't count on being able to get actual seats. You'll be lucky if you get a corner of a bar so you can lean you elbow on it, which definitely helps after a few cocktails.
 Speaking of cocktails, they'll make everything from The Jackel to Mumbai Mule. I only order off their agave drink list and they never disappoint. 
Food is just awesome. Get the octopus. 

Bon appetit! Cheers!
author: Dejana B.

description: Best cocktails and service! And chicken tacos  THE BEST!! Coming back Sunday for the burger and five more cocktails.
author: Kim S.

description:
Teeter-tottering between four and five stars, frankly. The location is great, the aesthetic is spot-on. The layout is good and the place is stylish yet comfortable. 

Our server was friendly, though less attentive than some. When we were ready for our check, we didn't see him for almost ten minutes, and it took another five to pay and get out... and 15-20 minutes from the time you're ready to leave until you're out the door is a bit much. The food was tasty, though the portions, as we were warned, were rather small for tapas in the $8-15 range. Definitely dropped $30 and still went to bed hungry that night.

A cute place, if you have means, to have a snack with a friend when you're not in a hurry. Not a great choice if you have to get on your way to a theater curtain time or a Uber pickup outside.
author: Sean B.

description:
I can't believe I've already been living in the Bay for a few months and didn't discover this place earlier. I think I found my new favorite bar for cocktails in the Mission!

I came here with two friends on a Friday night, and surprisingly it was crowded but not uncomfortably packed... or maybe we just got super lucky. The waitress that took care of us was super friendly and attentive. She constantly refilled our water, even though there was a bottle to do it ourselves. 

The drink menu is separated by the base liquor (i.e. tequila, rum, vodka) which is kinda awesome. They also list the spirits on the adjacent page, all of which are listed on their website if you ever want to do your research ahead of time. All the drinks I tried were excellent.

As for food, my friends and I ordered the Kimchee Fritters and the Chicken Pot Pie Empanadas. The fritters were interesting... I didn't know what to expect, but there were delicious nonetheless. The empanadas were amazing! Both were incredibly fresh, right out of the... whatever they use to make these. 

Great place for a date or just one of many stops on a bar hopping escapade with your friends. ABV has such an upbeat vibe, which of course makes all the drinks and food taste even better.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Dear yelpers! 

This is cool hang out spot for sharing finger foods and drinks. Its a small space that gets very packed on weekends. The servers are very nice and even the body guard at the door was friendly! I'm not a big celery fan but decided to try the gin and celery and loved it! I recommend the falafel lamb dog, roasted cauliflower, and brussel sprouts!
author: Sophia T.

description: If you have a refreshing Mumbai Mule in one hand and spam-like sausage steamed buns in the other, you will have yourself the makings of a good night at ABV.
author: Amy C.

description:
Love this place!  A great vibe and a nice spot for a cocktail on a warm spring afternoon. Mostly locals inside during the day and the bartenders couldn't have been nicer. 

A great and inventive drink menu and we both had the Mumbai Mule made with saffron vodka and fresh mint. Ridiculously good and so refreshing. 

We wanted a snack and the bartender suggested a great one: pumpkin churros with chocolate mole dipping sauce. WOW!  So delicious. A great choice. 

Great bar that I hear gets packed after dark. A Mission hipster bar!
author: Steve W.

description: I love this spot.  Awesome spot for a first date.  Great small plates and great cocktails with an amazing atmosphere.  Highly recommend.
author: Seema S.

description:
I've always passed by the place but never quite knew what it was. Wow, I've been missing out! I stopped by the other night for a quick drink and thought the place had a really good vibe.  

Place was on the more posh side for the mission. Their drink menu was organized by spirit featuring both mixed drinks and shots. Good drinks and good service. 4 stars b/c I need to go back and try the food.. :)
author: James S.

description: ABV is such a great addition to the Mission bar scene. I've been a few times now with groups of friends and had such a great time. They have quality cocktails that arent too pricey. The Mumbai Mule has got to be one of my favs. I havent been able to try any food but I plan to go back for a HH soon! The space in the back is pretty big if youre going with a group and they also have tables outside which is perfect on a warm day
author: Hetal P.

description:
ABV is very mellow bar that one goes to for high quality spirits. I can say wholeheartedly that they make a very good Toms Collins, and a moscow mule (but without the copper cup) but that's not enough for me to forget the fact that some of the waitresses here are really snooty. 

I was here for a friend's birthday. Being in our early 20s, of course she wanted to go bar hopping. It was a fine idea, and everyone was really excited. She had never gone bar hopping in SF before, so she didn't really know what to expect. She asked a waitress here for a long island (I thought that was a standard drink) but apparently it isn't in a place like this. She instead got scolded about how it would cost well over $50 because the quality of spirits here were so high. Clearly, this left a sour taste in everyone's mouth. 

Final thoughts: This place makes some really good versions of my favorite drinks, but service here is seriously lacking; I could go to a lot of other bars that would gladly take my money and give me great drinks as well.
author: Thuy T.

description: I was unhappy with the service, complained briefly and service improved dramatically.  That was impressive.    I usually don't order squid, but this dish has me fantasizing about coming back.  Everyone liked their dishes.  great big group environment
author: Andrea S.

description:
This place is awesome... I bring friends here every chance I get great spot to get that cocktail after a nice dinner with a lady friend.
I would argue the "Gin and Celery" is one of the best cocktails in the city. I have not met one person who doesn't like that drink. Perfect savory cocktail with great celery flavor that goes fantastic with the gin. Additionally the soft shell crap was tender and delicious, friend cauliflower was crispy and delicious and would say the small bites were fairly priced at $9 and the cocktails also are fairly priced. All in all I give this 5 star review based on the gin and celery cocktail and the exceptional service  provided by abv. Sexy interior great drinks, great food, I do believe this spot is doing a fantastic job!
author: Nathan B.

description:
I love this place! The cocktails are really good and so is the food. We got fritters and chicken pie empanadas. Both came out piping hot and perfectly crispy. It was a perfect end to a night of bar hopping. 

I love the giant tables in the back. It's a casual hangout, perfect for clinking drinks. The bar in the front has darker lighting providing a more mysterious intimate feel. Just a good vibe all around. 

The servers are so nice and so quick. If you're sitting at the tables, they will come around and take your orders. Water glasses were filled continuously and I never noticed them to go less than half empty. For such a busy bar on a Friday night, I was so pleasantly surprised and happy. Such a good ending to the night.
author: Winnie T.

description: The bartender had a hard time being able to accommodate the amount of guests that were in the bar. They also were very rude and aggressive towards the people that were trying to order. The wait staff was argumentative.
author: Jessica P.

description:
Good drinks, good snacks, great service!

Nice space that easily accommodates large groups and is comfortable. The service was outstanding, truly top notch both friendly and attentive. At the ready anytime we were ready to order or for more drinks. 

The kimchee fritter was good but absolutely loved the chicken pot empanadas. 

Looking forward to our next visit and to try more things on the menu. Only wish there were a few healthier bar bite options but very good. No complaints.
author: Melody T.

description:
After the party, it's the ABV! 

My group of friends know that ABV is the central meet up spot after we all went to whatever plans we had for the Friday or Saturday. We then meet up, chit chat, drink, eat, and go home :)

The service is great - environment is chill, and it's just the right amount of lively but not too crowded to keep me coming back.
author: Carina M.

description: An awesome little cocktail bar, walking distance to bart with amazing drinks!
author: Salini N.

description:
TIP:  They have the full line of St. George's vodka, including the Chile Vodka - get it in just soda - nothing more - so you can taste the full breadth of the chile flavor.  Don't worry, its pretty mild.

ABV is is a happin' little spot on a Friday night!  The rear of the place is a little restaurant where you can order simple food and appetizer.  The front is a bustling bar.  The light fixtures are trendy, the paint is dark, the appointments are dark wood - its a wonderful place for an evening with friends.  

One thing they do at ABV is that they have servers roaming to help those standing with drinks.  Its the worst when you have to order drinks from a packed bar standing behind 3 rows of people behind yet another row of people sitting in bar stools.  The roaming servers made it easy to stand in the rear and chat while still being able to order drinks.
author: Joel J.

description:
Absolutely one of my Top 3 favorite bars in SF.  The kimchee fritters and pimento cheeseburgers make my inner fat child want to do the truffle shuffle.  The bartenders are excellent and I always have a great time.  The door guys can be kind of douchey but I get how difficult of a job it must be, especially when you are dealing with a**holes.  Keep up the good work and I will keep throwing money at you guys...

Cheers.
author: Shaun C.

description:
Extremely creative and tasty fusion food, but you might have a hard time finding a seat. 

Like a lot of the good places in the city, the main downside is that ABV is super crowded. If you are coming with a large group that hasn't had dinner yet, come at your own risk.

I came for the cocktails, but will come back for the food. All the dishes can be conveniently eaten with your fingers and are truly fusion food. From the cocktails I tried, nothing really stood out. Below are some of the genius fusion dishes I tried.

Falafel Corn dogs: spicy, hot, great
Pot Pie Empanada: a genius twist to make the classic dish portable and provide a better surface to volume ratio. 
Pulled Pork Tacos: a small twist on carnitas, but delicious.
Sloppy Joe Chinese buns: amazing, might be both the best Sloppy Joe and Chinese Bun I have had. The buns were extremely fluffy and delicious. 
Kimchi fritter: the name is a little bit weird because it really is just an okonomiyaki with kimchi. Not bad, but not a big departure from the original. 

From the more conventional dishes, the hamburger was not bad, though a bit on the salty side. The fish and chips were by far the most disappointing dish. It was just not good. Potato chips instead of fries is a downgrade and the fish just wasn't very good. 

Despite the chaos, the wait service was able to keep track of all the drinks and dishes we ordered, so props to them. 

If you are not starving and are willing to wait a bit, I think you should definitely check it out.
author: Augusto T.

description: I love ABV! This is one of my favorite spots in the Mission. Their Gin and Celery drink is very good, and I'm not even a fan of gin or celery. It's a great place for a date, entertaining out-of-town guests, or just grabbing a drink before heading out for the night. They also have delicious bar snacks!
author: Rebecca O.

description: Great cocktails, nice vibe. Try the jackel. The bartenders here know what they're doing, so I'm sure anything would be good.
author: Travis B.

description: My favorite bar in SF. I'm a satisfied returning patron. The Mumbai mule and gin & celery are incredibly good choices. They also have a great small bites menu to choose from. Can't go wrong!
author: Honest O.

description: Fabulous bar with exquisite cocktails. Just delicious. Very nice atmosphere too with friendly bartenders.
author: Colin B.

description: Was eating a block away and had to wait for a friend so we decided to pop in here to see what the action was like.Expected a much more mellow feel for a monday but the front of the bar was full. Got a quick Highball which was Hashuku Whisky and Soda plus something else I forget. The hint of smoky whisky but also refreshing for a warmer night. Very dimly lit, wood and dark interior design. I didnt push my way to the back room but it seemed like some tables there. Next time Ill also look at the food menu and study the cocktail list more. The pedigree of Bourbon and Branch/Beretta/Dalva is too high to not return.
author: Kim N.

description:
I have been here twice and loved it both times. Creative dishes made for snacking, seasonal cocktails made for sipping, and a bar staff that is friendly and unpretentious. This should be your go to in the mission. Sidewalk seating and great decor within. I'll be back. 

Get the falafel lamb dogs or the fish tacos. Killer! Tarragon tonic is amazing too.
author: Sonia S.

description:
The bartenders are really not friendly !!!
Average food and cocktails.
It's really a business : all they want is just your money : they only smile when you pay !
author: Arnaud M.

description:
A couple of my yelp friends and I over to this place after touring the SF Armory on Mission St. and 14th.  I found it on my trusty yelp app while starving most of the morning running on just a Jamba Juice.  Was drinking the night before at SR so I didn't really feel like eating much actual food in the morning.  "Hot and New" or something of rather it said on the app.... really high reviews and delectable looking food on the menu got me thinking "gosh damn I need to try this place."  I was also feeling another B-day drink as well coming on; I'm not an excessive drinker since I'm such a lightweight but I love enjoying a nice artisan mixed drink and food pairing.  

The bartender was extremely knowledgeable and for some odd reason looked very familiar to me; they possibly might have worked at another bar that I have been to....?  Not really sure, haha anyhow.  I was debating between the Land's End and the Pina Verde.  Those drinks and the ingredients initially caught my eye, but I settled on the Pina Verde and was so glad I did.  Not too sweet and very well balanced summer drink; that pineapple helped it a lot I think.  

My friend did a couple of beer tastings to eventually settle on a house favorite Pilsner... I really forget the name of it now but I did have a taste.  Very good choice; and the type of better I usually enjoy tasting.  We ordered the dishes that looked amazing in the pictures to me and sounded great just reading them off the yelp captions.  

Lamb Corndogs with Greek Yogurt sauce?!?  Whoever created that dish here is a freaking genius!  So healthy and clean tasting; not heavy.  

The Kimchee fritter was so damn good; tastes like all the greatest junk food flavors are laid out on some easy to bite pizza like slices!  OMFG.  You need to come here to try this!  

I enjoyed my drink and water afterwards and I felt much better after a snack and drink. The bathrooms are very clean and we made our way out of the place and onto the next!  Thank you Yelp friends, you know who you are!  HAHA.

Sorry to the bartenders if we were acting or talking obnoxiously while we were here; it seemed like a pretty tame place until we came thru haha.  The bartenders were extremely cordial so I thanked them when were on our way to the next stop for some more food exploration.  

*****700th Review Done FTW*****
author: Kenny P.

description: Drinks menu is rich and long -- the bartenders here clearly know their stuff. Came here on an evening of bar hopping with the squad for a girl's 21st and each of our drinks were distinct and catered to us. Ambiance was a little too chill for me, but we also came on a Thursday night.
author: Julia L.

description:
Dropped by recently on a warm Friday night.  The place was packed and we weren't sure where to sit at first.  Then we spotted two seats along the wall opposite the bar.  They ended up being perfect since there is quick and efficient table service even over there!

We sampled a range of cocktails, loving them all.  Then the food started arriving.  Lamb "corndog" with yogurt dip was our favorite, but close behind were the chicken pot pie empanadas.

Really loving this place!
author: Patrick S.

description:
ABV, I'm adding you to my SF drinks/bar rotation! Just the right balance between classy and street-cred, in the Mission. Bartenders know what they're doing, and are friendly and unpretentious.

I had the Whisky in Church, which was just so. They have an impressive whisk(e)y collection too. I will be back!

Nice to meet you. Let's be friends.
author: Victoria C.

description:
Love this place. Excellent cocktails -- Lefty's Fizz is hands down my favorite, but I'm partial to mezcal and anything with egg whites. The bar tenders are great and very knowledgable. Makes great custom / off menu requests on top of the great menu. 
The food is great too. The burger is delicious -- I was very skeptical at first but it's actually really good. So are the fish tacos and the lamb corn dogs. 
The pbj ice cream sandwich I would forgo, wasn't very impressed. 
It tends to be a bit loud and crowded for my taste on weekends, but late night on a weekday is very manageable.
author: Rita K.

description: Decent bar bites but awesome cocktails, all of which are classics with some sort of twist.  Cocktail menu was extensive and well designed enough that there were choices for everyone's palate ranging from sweet and fruity, to crisp and refreshing, to dark and aromatic.  Crowded on any given night, but that is to be expected.
author: David C.

description:
I've been wanting to come back here to try their food items and other drink options. I ordered the cheese burger that was recommended but I wasn't really a fan of it. It tasted a lot like fast food burgers which isn't really what I was looking for. The bun was very flat so it's almost like you are biting straight at the patty but there is something mushy blocking your way... Definitely don't order that. 

We also got the broccolini which had good flavors but slightly saltier than what I'd prefer. It was also extremely hard to eat because they do not provide utensils. You have to just pick it up with your hands and it can get pretty messy. 

Overall, I wouldn't really recommend getting food here. I really enjoy their drinks but there is definitely rooms for improvement on the food menu.
author: Crystal W.

description:
I love this bar. I come here very often. The cheeseburger gets me every time, and they always have the best service. 

I saw a really strange situation tonight where the door person (who has always been fantastic) politely handled some clearly intoxicated people who were not to pleased to show IDs and he handled it like a champ. One of the people in the party promptly brought Yelp up and used it as a threat. Wtf?

This is always my first recommendation to friends.
author: Jessi M.

description:
Yummy drinks, yummy bar bites. This is definitely an unwind after work or before something else place, and I'd actually put ABV more at 3.5 stars, only because I felt a lack of specificity in the whole enterprise; the vibe is pleasantly above-average establishment inside an upscale, modern hotel. 

I remember the solid lamb falafel dogs and the burger, but can't remember the third item we ordered. My drink was the Fogerty, tasty. We had a nice conversation over the bites and spirits, then proceeded to the drag show down the street.
author: John M.

description: Fine selection of cocktails and beers. I enjoyed a nice cider though that was from Washington state. We had the fried octopus with fries, a meat and cheese plate, and fried cauliflower. Such lovely options for late night grub!
author: Kelsey L.

description: Great cocktails, very creative. ABV Has a clean relaxing hipster vibe. Didn't try the food  but will definitely come back for it, smelled delicious. ABV also does non-alcoholic beverages which too, are quite impressive.  Vibe is a great date/hang out spot. Outdoor seating is limited, interior seating is sparse as the bar is always packed (not a bad thing!).  Clean, high ceilings, modern-wood bar, munsel grey, modernish, industrial lighting, etc. etc. check it out, its a great bar.
author: Reena T.

description:
My husband and I had a great experience here. Our server was knowledgable, friendly, unpretentious, and gave top-notch cocktail and appie recommendations.

The burgers are a local favourite with the gourmet cheese and caramelized onion combo. Apparently it's a family recipe passed down to one of the chefs from North Carolina. The patty was flavourful, juicy, and that cheese just mellllted in our mouths.

Our server did stress that portions are "snack sized" and are not meant to satiate huge appetites. We found AbV to offer a nicer atmosphere for socializing (or ogling at your date).

Two thumbs up for the cool space, cooler staff, and drool-worthy fare!
author: Najin T.

description:
One of my favorite new cocktail places in SF.  I've found that a lot of times specialty cocktails are made way too sweet and include too much artificial tasting "fillers" that kill the cocktail.  So not the case with this place.  The drinks are perfectly balanced and they use all natural ingredients (LOVE it when places actually use fresh fruit and other herbs to flavor their cocktails vs. reaching for a processed bottle of crap).

My husband and I ordered and split the Mumbai Mule (saffron, vodka, lime, ginger, mint & soda) and the Jackal (rye, lemon, pineapple gum, cardamom & egg white).  Preferred the later; but both were delicious.

Also ordered the pulled pork, which was very tasty as well.
author: Rachael S.

description: Excellent service, easy in, easy out even in hours that would make most Mission counterparts wilt under pressure. Cocktails are strong, the people are pretty, the bartenders will pass muster with your picky queer friends. Squeeze into one of the small counter seats already!
author: Allonsy A.

description: Cozy cocktail bar that serves up both classics and imaginative drinks paired with delicious shareable bites
author: Ximena C.

description:
My favorite new bar in SF, hands down. I'm addicted. The staff is awesome - super friendly, talented and always willing to experiment with drinks for you! 

Food is outstanding: delicious/upscale bar food with a nice edge of comfort food. I've literally had everything on the menu and it's all so darn good.

I will be coming back over and over. Bartenders Cecily, Max and Donny are so awesome!!

Highly, highly recommended.
author: Jim T.

description:
Lemme start by saying...I had had a few drinks. Take this review as you may.

I loved ABV.

Bartender, you are very cute and I will probably come back to ABV just to have you make me another drink.

Chefs, the octopus was amazing. My friend swore that it was frozen. I don't think so but I don't care. It was tender, topped with that delicious squid ink sauce and I loved it. The potatoes, however, were a weird accompaniment and they were a bit too spicy. 

The sloppy joes were to die for. With my mezcal drink in hand, I felt like I was in heaven. I thought it was super cool that they were served on bao-ish bread. Anyways, they were great and I will probably order 12 just for myself when I come back to chat up the bartender.

Finally, the sliders. Really enjoyed that as well. But it was the last dish to come out and by then the mezcal had done its job. 

Great staff, excellent small bites. Slightly upscale prices for the mission, but a cute bartender so I'm into it.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I like to read reviews before I start my own.  
I was surprised to read that ABV is rude.  
I didn't find it like that at all--I did find it crowded and got loud quickly.
The bartender had a great memory and took four drink orders ahead of mine and without a blink asked me what I wanted and answered a question.

I like the honest thoughts--I almost ordered the Pimento burger sans cheese but was quickly warned "I wouldn't do it" the cheese was what held it together.  I selected the Kimchee fritter and pulled pork sandwich.  Kimchee fritter wonderful light, nicely spiced and not a heavy dish. I thought I wouldn't get full but the food was plenty.  Remember no cutlery--no worry though it is all easy to eat with your hands.

The mixology is solid; I ordered the Tarragon Collins--sweeter than I expected but Tarragon balanced this drink perfectly--nicely green and satisfying.  I ordered The Jackel which is Rye whiskey, pineapple, lemon and Cardamom.  So many whiskey mixed drinks is that you can often only taste the whiskey and everything else is secondary--the drink was the best of all worlds and I figured with pineapple it would be sweet and it wasn't--multi-dimensional and uber satisfying.  I can't wait to go back and order another Jackel.

I am going back soon.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description:
Fiance and I came in on Saturday around 4 for a cocktail.  Cool vibe, with your typical hipster, dark reclaimed bar look.  Hipster bartenders with beards and flannel.  They were so nice, welcoming and easy to talk to.  The bartender answered our questions about the cocktails and poured waters (even adding some lemon juice each time he refilled it, as I had asked for lemon!!!)  Every person that came in, they were very nice too - it was great to see. 

I ordered the Mumbai Mule and my fiance got the Quicksand.  I was hesitant about the Mumbai Mule b/c of the saffron.  This is why you trust a cocktail bartender though - it was AWESOME!! You could certainly taste the saffron, and it had that indian kick to it, though the lemon and mint quickly washed away the saffron, leaving a fresh note on your pallet.  The Quicksand was also delicious!

Highly recommended.
author: Sarah F.

description:
What a great find. The bartenders are extremely kind in service. This was the last stop of the night so I was just slowing down and didn't want a drink but they were sure to ask if I needed anything else, sending a nice glass of water down my way. The bartenders seem to actually care for the customers, befriending all of the people sitting at the bar, striking conversation, but not missing an order as well as checking up on everyone if they were all good. They were pretty crowded even at 1AM but not in a claustrophobic way. We were able to get bar seats right away; we didn't explore beyond the bar but they also have a small outdoor seating area. 

They seem to have a great food menu to pair well with the top notch extensive drink menu. Their wall was strewn with so many different types of gin and whiskey brands and probably much much more types of liquor so I can tell they're really into making a good drink for you to enjoy every sip. I felt it was too late to munch on something BUT they made sure to tell me their kitchen doesn't close until 1 AM so that is AWESOME for the drunchies and if you're craving some enticingly sounding fusion bar food rather than the classic trash drunk food.

So because this time around I didn't get to actually try the drinks or food (my friend had a gin and tonic and enjoyed it), it is mandatory I return and update this review on the quality of taste!
Otherwise -- ambiance & service already gave me a great 1st impression. Also, the fact that my friend enjoyably finished her drink is a good sign!
author: Janelle S.

description:
Coolest Tapas Bar in SF. We tried everything on the menu. Things to try..

Peppers
The Burger with Sweet Potato Bun
Lamb dog
Grilled little gems
Kimchee fritter
Empanadas 

All the cocktails were amazing and so strong!
Piña verde was my favorite Agave cocktail
And all 4 whiskey cocktails on the menu didn't disappoint.

It was a group of 5 and we were seated right away, great friendly bartender that even gave us free mezcal shots to welcome us to SF.
author: Julie R.

description:
This place is awesome!
1. Gin and Celery is my favorite drink there ( only one I tried, but everyone I've gone with enjoyed their cocktails as well)
2. The charcuterie and cheese boards are great but the really star is the Tartine toast that accompanies them. 
This place is always busy so there maybe a wait, but it's worth it.
author: Quang W.

description:
Boyfriend is infatuated with this spot. We met the owner at Eat Drink SF (he was manning the Del Maguey booth) and made a point to come try his new bar! Wide range of great-looking and yummy-tasting cocktails, definitely will find one to fit your fancy. It's a really nice spot, very spacious yet cozy.

Can I just say.. KIMCHI FRITTER I must have you. Next time.
author: Vivian H.

description: Great spot with an extensive selection of spirits. The bartenders know what's up and have never let me down with their recommendations. The staff in general is really nice and helpful - even on a more crowded night. One of my favorites.
author: DeAnna C.

description:
Dark ambiance make for a sizzling night with friends or the one you're trying (not to hard) to impress. With drinks that come readily and snacks that are sharable, this Mission bar is great for a pre-concert gathering space, post-dinner drinking hole, or for a quick drink with a friend. Share the KIMCHEE FRITTER and CHICKEN POT PIE EMPANADAS, not enough to call "dinner" but filling enough to pair with your drink of choice. 

Note: their high chairs do not have backs, so it's not a place to stay for too long; easy in, enjoy, and then proceed.
author: Regina D.

description: Service was amazingly helpful and pleasant. Our server could tell I wasn't sure what I was choosing, and quickly assessed what I wanted and suggested something much better. Drinks were delicious and beautiful.
author: Jade P.

description:
If you like whiskey, 3 words:  Trinidad Sour Cocktail. 
Crafted perfection.
author: Ericka M.

description: Great drinks (though the mumbai mule was not one of my favorites, like everyone else). Definitely some of the better cocktails I've had in the city, with some pretty great bar bites as well. Just beware -- the food and drinks will add up. Your after-work drinks will ring up a $100 bill really really quickly.
author: Kazu O.

description:
The food was great, no doubt about that. And the drink selection was good too. We had the fish tacos (outstanding), the buhn mi (delicious) and the burger (standard, nothing too exciting). 

My only real complaint is that this place takes the hipster vibe to a whole new level. I get restaurants wanting to distinguish themselves, but they don't have to reinvent the wheel in the process. ABV, stop being ridiculous and offer utensils. OR if you absolutely refuse and insist on everyone eating everything with their hands like it's a third world country, have wet naps or something at the table. Eating a burger with my hands? Yeah, absolutely. Sautéed broccolini though? No, give me a damn fork. 

Also, let's work on server responses. Us: "Hi, do you have silverware we could use?" Server: "Um, we don't really do utensils. The chef doesn't like it." Really? Did he use utensils to cook our food? Then I disagree he doesn't like utensils. How about something more eloquent like "We actually don't offer utensils since the majority of our food is meant to be eaten with your hands. However, I'm happy to grab you a hot towel to keep your hands clean during your meal, would that work?" 

I'm over the hipster thing so I'm getting fairly cranky with all the nonsense thrown at me when I go out to eat, so take this review at face value. If you enjoy all that silliness, by all means go and enjoy. The food is really good. You could bring some utensils with you, but they might throw you out for that, not sure.
author: Jen C.

description:
Do: drink gin cocktails, vibe, glow, shmooze, stay.

Don't: eat the lamb falafel corndog, show up dressed like a shmuck. 

You're ready.
author: Rachel R.

description: This is the best bar in SF!!! Hands down! They have great cocktails, delicious food and the bartenders are so nice. Completely laid back...no matter how packed this place gets the bartenders and staff will always come thru! They never forget you and are super attentive. My go to is the Reuben sandwich and bourbon neat. You would think I would have a favorite bartender but ALL of them are fantastic!!! Tell them what you want and they are more than happy to accommodate. ABV is definitely a place for locals and tourist destination. Forever grateful for your hospitality!!!! I love ABV
author: Trish Z.

description: Excellent place for food and drink. I'd heard about this place from friends and have been wanting to try it for awhile. The drinks all had a twist and were just perfect. I also tried the lamb falafel dog, octopus and potatoes, and kimchi fritters. I'd read/seen so many pictures of the fritters I had to try them. I don't even love kimchi but they tasted so good!! I can see why everyone loves them. The octopus was also very flavorful and cooked just right. Sometimes it can be too chewy but this was delicious. I also loved the falafel dog and would definitely recommend it. ABV is a new favorite place and will definitely be back :)
author: Emily F.

description:
Happened upon this place when we were nearby at other bars and wanted a change of scenery, and I'm so glad we went here! It was very crowded (Saturday night), so there was only room for me, my sister, and fiancé to stand, but the staff there kept checking in on us as if we were at a table, asking how everything was and whether they could get us anything else (I'm used to pretty much being ignored if you're not seated).

The mumbai mule was amazing! I tried some of my sister's since I didn't feel like drinking and wish that I had ordered my own. I am not a big vodka fan but would probably drink anything with the saffron vodka they put in that drink, it was so good!

Lastly, I had fainting episode there (unrelated to the place or to alcohol, this just happens to me) and the staff was extremely caring; they were knowledgeable to tell right away that it didn't have to do with drinking, helped me find a seat, and kept bringing me water and checking up on me.

Great drinks and great people here!!
author: Alexandra H.

description:
I came in here last Monday late afternoon to check it out with a friend. I ended up getting a Manhattan-type drink which was well crafted and perfect for a overcast afternoon. The tall, bearded bartender was cool and took care of us for the afternoon.

We also ordered some empanadas and a cheese plate. The empanadas were small but so tasty. And the cheese plate was devoured quickly.

Later on I ordered a beer from the brewery they work with (again, can't remember the name) and it was also great.

More like a 4.5 but I will round up for the excellent service.
author: Art O.

description: Bartender was top notch. Spotted me and brought me a menu the moment we walked in even though it was a busy Friday night. Great cocktails. Didn't get too crazy, was able to sit at the bar for a bit (not sure if that's typical here...)
author: Karl P.

description: When you can get a seat, FIGHT FOR IT :)  Great drinks, great atmosphere, friendly service.
author: Mariam W.

description: Excellent cocktails and great selection of beer! The bar food is delicious, creative and reasonably priced. The decor is really cool and loved the ambience. Will definitely recommend stopping by if you're in the area!
author: Jessica G.

description:
We visited ABV on a Sunday afternoon and loved it!  The space is beautiful and modern, the bartender was friendly and helpful, and equally importantly, the cocktails were amazing!

I loved the Mumbai Mule and Pimms Cup - both were tasty and refreshing!  My fiance had The Jackel (it had a clean citrus-y fresh flavor that toned down the whiskey making it a good afternoon cocktail) and High Altitude Highball (a refreshing whiskey based drink that maintained the flavor with a refreshing twist).

We are so excited to have this new place in the neighborhood!
author: Barnali D.

description: Kimchee griddles or whatever so amazing. It Tastes like okonomiyaki one of my favs! Then the lamb dog was so tasty and cool I loved it. Everything was unique and on point!
author: Est K.

description:
Great new spot in the Mission!

Everything we had were delicious:
 
Drinks: 
-Land's End
-Dartmoor
-Pina Verde

Food: 
-Kimchee fritters
-Lamb dogs
-Cheeseburger
-Mapo Sloppy Joes

Cool vibe and atmosphere.  No sign at the door so it's easy to miss.  Recommend sitting at the bar to watch the bartenders work their magic!
author: Wendy Z.

description: Great bar in Mission! It can get a little crowded and you may have to wait  to place your order but it has good drinks and a nice, inviting space. Nice day drinking spot with beer and cocktails. Really close to other bars so you can hop around with ease
author: Frank B.

description:
I don't see the hype that comes with ABV.  It's a 'hipster' bar but ultimately, not a thirst quencher.  

It's about $12 a drink, and here's my take on how they come up with that:

$8 - for the fancy showmanship
$2 - fancier ingredients (mostly herbs and fruits)
$1 - trendy bar in the mission (à la pretentious vibe)
$1 - the liquor content

Ultimately, the drinks (mumbai mule and lefty fizz) were refreshing but lacked a punch.  There are plenty of really talented bartenders that can add both innovative techniques and deliver a well loaded drink.
