However, service was good and the bartenders are pretty friendly.
author: Nikki G.

description:
My brother and I were hanging out, hungry and looking for somewhere to eat. We happened to walk by this place and decided to check it out. After reading the menu we were definitely intrigued. My brother is a chef who just moved out to the bay area and he had previously worked at The Kitchen at the brewery Discretion in Santa Cruz (which is an awesome place btw). We were hoping that the food at ABV would be comparable.
We were not disappointed. We got the pimento cheeseburger, lamb falafel dogs and the fish tacos. The burger was the juiciest burger I have ever had and the flavors were great. I was hesitant about the lamb falafel dogs... but they were amazing. The fish tacos were good too, but nothing to write home about. Over all we were very impressed and glad that we had stopped by.
However, this is not the place to go for a big hearty meal, unless you want to spend a pretty penny ordering 6 of the hamburgers for yourself.
We left satisfied but we were ready for lunch round 2 after a few hours.
Service was great too. There weren't very many people there at the time and the bartender made conversation with us a few times. He was cute and had an accent. The whole place had a very lumbersexual vibe. I liked it.
author: A K.

description: Great experience.  I have been in here before and hadn't even realized because it was a crowded mess, this time got there on a rainy early evening saturday.  All of the staff is friendly, down to the gentleman dropping of the food order.  Bartender I had was knowledgeable, friendly, and charming. I accepted her recommendations with confidence and she was happy to replace anything I didn't care for.  Cecily was her name, wonderful human being.  Fried cauliflower was one of the best versions of cauliflower anything I have ever had.  Falafel lamb corndogs were excellent.  Can't recommend highly enough.
author: Thomas S.

description: Slightly drunk bar tender refused to believe an English ID (we're both over 30) only time I've had this after 5 years in the us. Staff are far too pretentious and to be honest a bit simple to warrant anything better than a one star. Sort it out.
author: Tom S.

description:
Atmosphere is pretty cool and has a nice chill vibe to it. The drinks were good and unique (albeit a little pricey). 
But the food.. Even for bar snacks I can't give them a good review. The waiters talked up the food as the best they've ever had so I had pretty high expectations. They did not live up to them. The chicken pot pie empanadas were so doughy and barely had any filling in them. The burger was good, but very small for $10 (slightly larger than a slider). The lamb corn dog was the best out of the three. 
Maybe I'm being a little too harsh on the food, but for how fun the menu was, I was hoping for a better showing. I would definitely go back for drinks and to hang out, but probably skip the food.
author: Laurie Z.

description:
I did not think I could find a bar that I would enjoy as much as my beloved Trick Dog, but this place really blew me away.

Here is why:

1.) Fantastic cocktails that are truly expertly crafted - and I have only said that about a handful of places before. 

2.) Their food was wayyyyy better then I expected, and I expected it to be good. Also, they laughed at us when we asked for forks. "WHAT? This must be your first time here! It's all finger food!" they told me as I stared the the greasy broccolini in front of me. "Bring on the napkins" I replied. "I told chef he was pushing it with this broccoli..."

3.) Service was lovely, and surprisingly non pretentious feeling. They sweetly waited on our choices and were attentive to our needs. 

I think I have found my new favorite meet-up spot!
author: Stephie M.

description: The doorman rejected us in the most degrading of ways stating they cannot acknowledge Mexican Or Canadian IDs and demanded that we provide passports. Understood that not all IDs are accepted but the way he said "I barely let you in" to the Canadian ID holder was extremely unprofessional and a complete turn off especially after our friends told us this place was classy. A total disappointment and wish our night wasn't ruined by this man.  But then again, just read the reviews here seems per usual
author: Dee S.

description: Best bar in the world. If you haven't been; your missing out. The staff, drinks and food are the best around. Hospitality at it's finest.
author: Bill H.

description: Loved this place, and I don't write many 5 star reviews. We came on a Saturday late afternoon and it was neither too busy nor too dead. The cocktails were enjoyable, and the Kimchee fritter was one of the best things I've eaten at a bar. I would return here often (if I didn't live in Seattle).
author: Lisa B.

description:
Great spot. Met a lot of interesting people. 

Amazing assortment of food too! My friend who has been there before told me they constantly update their offerings. 

Drinks are great a very large selection of cocktails. 

Great place for people who are the DD for the night too as they have some great non alcoholic drinks on their menu
author: Yasin S.

description: Nice venue. Lots of bar seating with a couple of tall tables in the back and counter seating along the wall. I think there are some seats upstairs in the loft too. Drinks are pretty good and it's cool watching the bartenders do their thing from the bar.
author: Sherry L.

description:
We loved it. Especially the cocktails, we had a Mumbai Mule , Lands End and the mescal.  Great drinks.

We ordered the burger (one of the 100 top dishes to try in San Francisco on 7x7 list) the kimchee pancake (this should also be on that list) sooooo good and I don't like kimchee!
We also had the fish tacos which we liked but didn't love, a little,fishy.

A quick walk from 16th Bart.
author: Foodlover B.

description: Solid spot. The burger was great, but if Pimento Cheese is not your thing you may want this on the side. Also had some octopus fries which were great. The drinks were decent, but not the best or amongst the best we have had though.  Would go back, especially for the food.
author: Brent F.

description:
Loved it

I'm on a restaurant tour with my number one gal pal and we wanted cocktails and snacks (in that order).  I love a fun cocktail menu and they totally delivered.  I loved the cocktails and the food is a bit of a blur (full disclosure) but the little bites were great.  

Five stars because I can't remember a single bad thing from the night. From the decor to the service to he delicious food.  They did split some dishes for us which was great because I love a burger split in half.  

Yay abv!

Thanks for being so nice to us!

We were those two white girls.... That one time...

Remember us???
author: Bobbie J.

description:
THIS PLACE IS ONE OF THE RUDEST BARS I'VE EVER WENT TO. I'm sorry, I really am. I was hoping that ABV would live up to its 4 star value, but what a complete waste of my time / money.

I came here last night with a group of friends on a Mission bar crawl adventure, and because one of my friends has never had an AMF before(I KNOW RIGHT? talk about insane..) I thought now would be a good time for her to try one.

So I politely flag down a waitress(I don't usually like to use that term because it sounds degrading but she was so rude that I'm going to use it now) and ask for three AMF's. 

She responds in the rudest way possible that this establishment not only does NOT make that drink, but that they only serve high quality cocktails and if I want a high quality AMF, it'll cost me $50 a glass.

At this point, I'm more shocked than anything that she was so curt to me, as I thought I asked nicely. Struggling to figure out how to bounce back and order another drink, I mumble a bunch of random "classier" drink names that hopefully she'll accept, only to which she says "nope, we only make what's on the menu."

The lady needs to calm down, I haven't gotten into a fight here yet, and she's already looking like she wants to kick us out. 

My friend saves me and asks the lady nicely that we'll take 3 of whatever is the most popular drink, and she takes my credit card and disappears for what felt like forever and comes back with a disgusting concoction of apple brandy and other things I can't even begin to pronounce.
 
But she doesn't bring back my credit card. I asked her where it was, and she looks at me like I'm an idiot and says "I left the tab open."

No just give me my credit card back, I only ordered that drink because it was too embarassing and shameful at this point to just walk out.

I really can't find words to describe how frustrated I was that on top of treating me like I was some mongrel who didn't deserve to step foot into ABV, she treated my other friends who were there as well really nicely. I guess I should have just ordered my drink up at the bar, because the bartenders seemed really nice, but if the rest of the establishment is going to be rude and impatient with newcomers, I don't need to come here anymore.

I guess ABV's too good for me but that's fine, I'll take my credit card elsewhere.
author: Zoe H.

description: I like it but I'm not a cocktail bar kind of guy. I'm a manhattan and a dark beer person so there's always going to be something for me. Love the vibe and ambiance, they have fun drinks and pretty good bar food. The drinks aren't obscenely pricey but the drinks are small. This is the only bar that I've been to that doesn't carry common alcohols - jameson, hennessy, jack daniels etc. As it may be, they seem to believe they're better than that. The bartenders were nice, this place is nice to discover new cocktails if its your thing but I haven't found anything that really stood out.
author: Ryan L.

description:
A
Bit loud
But decent
Drinks and menu
Is inventive for bar crowd. Fills quickly.
author: Justin L.

description:
Stopped in with friends yesterday while exploring the Mission District as we wanted cocktails to counter the warm day. I got the Pina Verde which was great (I would call it a pineapple sour margarita), two got the Mumbai Mule (fantastic with just a hint of curry flavor), and the Dartmoor (this one fell a little flat but was ok). They also have a small (like 3) draft and wine option if cocktails aren't your thing
Service was friendly and quick-ish, just what we wanted.
author: Angie L.

description: 4 stars because the drinks are super yummy i just asked the bartender to suprise me. The food was good and service were great. I didn't feel to hot after the corn dogs and I know it was those because I'm the only one who ate those but everything else including the environment was really chill
author: Dana B.

description: Delicious delicious cocktails, and the food is also quite yummy! Friendly staff. Good date spot, especially on a weeknight. Can get crowded, but absent that, can't go wrong!
author: Soo J.

description: ABV is awesome! This little spot is tucked away and doesn't have a sign (at least not that I've noticed), but it's a great place to get a drink or some apps. Excellent date spot as well. Their moscow mules are really incredible, the bar itself is well-decorated and clean, and there's a little room in the back to hang out in. It's a nice break from the other dive bars in the mission.
author: Molly V.

description:
The prices are a bit high but the quality of the drinks make the prices worth it.

There were two bartenders around 3pm or so. The first bartender was fantastic and the other was a bit pretentious and talked to her friends more than tend to customers. She was attractive but I'd rather have a weird looking chick who chats with customers and balances chatting with service to customers. I like the weird ones since I am weird and the first bartender rocked. I wish that I remembered her name to give her a shout out.

Get consistly good bartenders and this place will be five+ stars.
author: Sean G.

description:
Excellent cocktails! Thoughtfully prepared, wide selection, and friendly bartenders who readily learn your tastes and are happy be creative with you. I like him drinks and was a fan of their Gin & Celery drink as well as the Tarragon Collins. The Mumbai Mule was also wonderful. 

Very busy on Friday night, but we were still able to get two seats at the bar and eventually a third seat when two friends joined us. 

Only thing that makes this 4 stars instead of 5 is the limited vegetarian options on their food menu. But for drinks, this place is top notch!
author: Jinja R.

description:
I was with the same reviewer who got pushed out after having just ordered drinks and things only escalated from there. 

As the 4 of us separated, 2 of us walked down 16th toward Valencia and the bouncer had waited for us and gathered friends. 5 or 6 guys come over to 2 of us and the ABV bouncer started pushing my friend trying to start a fight. My friend tried to ignore him but the bouncer wouldn't stop and was able to get a hard slap in at my friends face. Thankfully, neither of us were drunk enough or stupid enough to fight and managed to walk away.

The only way to put it is the ABV bouncer/manager assaulted us for trying to finish and pay for our drinks. 

Obviously won't be returning to this place. I'd suggest avoiding it if you don't want to risk getting assaulted.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Wow, I loved this experience. I had a little trouble finding the place but, i kinda like that cause, when you do, you feel a little special and accomplished.

First of all the staff were all incredibly knowledgeable and friendly. You feel like the whole place was waiting on you. I couldn't have asked for more.

Second, the menu has something for everyone. Regardless of your preferences or restrictions, they have a gustatory adventure for you! All in all a good time.

Go.
author: Robert M.

description:
SHADY!!! 

I'm not sure if the bartender thought we were drunk so that she could take advantage of the situation. But last night when I went to pay my tab there were 3 extra drinks charged that I never ordered or said I would order. When the issue was brought up to the bartender she said they were from your group (WTF!) One of the drinks listed, my friend had ordered and already paid for. I ordered only 1 mule and was charged for 2. No one ordered beer in my group, so I'm guessing the beer charge was from the guy sitting next to me at the bar. My husband didn't want me to pursue this problem any further at the bar. So, I at least want people to learn from my mistake. DON'T OPEN A TAB!
author: Tiffany R.

description: I cannot say enough good things about ABV. It is by far our favorite place to grab a drink and some snacks with friends. The cocktails are all made with care, and are well balanced and delicious. The wine selection is limited but all are tasty. The food and snacks are all meant to be eaten with your hands (no utensils available). I love the rotating toasts and of course the Box of Veggies - we sometimes need to order two or three of those for the table. The best part about ABV, however, is the service. Everyone who works there provides really excellent customer service. My favorite bar in SF by far!
author: Kelly G.

description:
more great eats & drinks to be had:

Kimchi frittata (tastes like okonomiyaki!)
Pulled pork tacos
Churros with chocolate mole
Mumbai Mule

Service is awesome, love the mixed professional crowd.
author: Josie M.

description:
Came here for a friend's birthday which we had upstairs in the loft. All-in-all, it was a great place. The drinks were very well crafted and unique and the prices seemed about right for a bar like this in the this neighborhood these days. 

4 stars is because the service we had was pretty snobby. The woman who was our server (and whom we tipped very well) was pretty rude on multiple occasions, to the point where several of us in the party were asking one another who had upset her. We also tried to ask what kind of tequila she had and when we threw out a few names (herradura, DJ black, etc) she scoffed and said "we wouldn't carry those."  She then didn't offer us alternatives until we stopped her again and said "what DO you have...?"

I'll go back in hopes of this being a bad night for her, and update my review if the service is better.
author: Min M.

description: delightful drinks. mumbai mule was perfectly refreshing and the whiskey in church was the smokiest drink for my smoky flavor loving husband. didn't get to try the food, but there will be a next time. highly recommend!
author: Archana P.

description:
Awesome place!

Killer cocktails (I recommend Lefty's Fizz), solid food, great atmosphere and service. 

For the food, fish tacos were awesome, chicken pot pie empanadas were ok.

Service was also excellent despite how packed the place was.
author: Adam W.

description:
As a native SF'ian I *know * what to expect from the bars that still hang on in the Mission. Hence, I typically drink beer and go elsewhere for a good cocktail. 

For the past months I curiously observed the old Sushi A Go Go transform into the presently sleek, and industrially monochromatic ABV. 

The storefront has no sign which I find to be a smug trend along Valencia Street. Did this indicate the new space had become a prohibitively expensive restaurant? But no! 'Snacks and Cocktails?' suggested my well cultured and down to earth friend... I must... have... snacks... and cocktails... 

We simply raided the menus. Cocktails were beyond exceptional, not a dud in the bunch. Special gold star goes to
the piña verde - sour, a mite bit of tequila smoke and just sweet enough to be balanced with a beauteous freesia green color. Snacks? The little fish were crunchy and salty; I face-palmed at the delightfully textured collard green dolmas (typically tough and soggy). That mini burger with sweet potato bun gave me a vein-slap moment.

When you giggle incessantly and you can finally unwind and enjoy your charming friends, you know all the elements of the evening are right. 

Of special note, the waiter was patient and bright. The efficiently creative, accurate and refreshingly female Mixologiste, mixed without a flaw.

Here's where I log a serious complaint:

I had to use a tooth pick to split a food item...

BECAUSE THEY DON'T HAVE SILVERWARE!!! 

WTF?!

When I return - likely tomorrow - I'll bring my own silverware. I will look like a completely neurotic idiot eating my burger with a fork and knife but that's how I roll. I live for face-palms and vein-slap moments.
author: Artemis A.

description:
Alcohol By Large Volumes I say! pour me another one! I break all my drinking rules when I am here.
I love love love this place! Great drinks! not too sweet, not too mild. Great selection of drinks, cocktails and food too.

Nice chill bar, not overly crowded, not teeming with tweenies.
Good music playing in the background which is just the right volume so that you can talk to your friends w/o having to scream your lungs out.

I've never eaten here, but I'll admit I letched and drooled over it while the server passed me by with the delish looking, well presented food on plate.
author: Kinjal S.

description: LOVE this place!!! Sat at the bar for brunch on a Saturday and fell in love. The bartenders (two females) were both extremely nice and accommodating even though they were slammed busy. Cocktail menu was impressive and I wanted every one of them- had a mezcal Bloody Mary to start and probably the best avocado toast I've ever had on Tartine rye bread topped with trout and watermelon radishes. Then had the ABV breakfast sandwich that was delicious yet small enough I didn't feel overwhelmingly full. That cheese mornay sauce is everything. Next time I want to try the kimchee fritter and chicken karage/ biscuits. Also tried the Mumbai Mule and it was incredible!!!
author: Sarah A.

description: Looks like a cool vibe inside but can't imagine a more uptight bouncer on a Thursday night.  The guy took my wife's license as a man's and demanded to see a second ID.  #sexist will never be back.
author: Hunter D.

description: I was thoroughly impressed by this place. The staff was incredibly nice and the hospitality I experienced was superb. I ordered the lands end and as I was watching the bartender make my drink I could tell she was trying to craft a high quality cocktail, something to be proud of. It was delicious and stiff! Would definitely recommend!
author: Kristen R.

description: Good place to have a bday party. There are plenty of areas for large groups to congregate. Plus they have enough tables for large groups. Plenty of drinks to choose from. There is something for everyone. A little pricy compared to other places, but you get what pay for. My favorite drink here is the Lefty's fist. There's also snacks here as well. Someone in my group got the fish and chips and the peanut butter jelly ice cream sandwich, which were ok. Cool place to hang out. Only street parking and it's a little hard to find in this area. Would come back again.
author: Lisa T.

description:
I like places that have a decent amount of seating, good bartenders, good food and great service.  ABV accomplished all of the above, so I'm a fan.

It was crowded on a Friday night, but we were able to snag some barseats and ordered a round of Jackals.  It was a hot night, and that drink was so refreshing and delicious.  I don't generally order mixed drinks at bars, but I would have had another one of those.  The whiskey sour Tintin got was also great, ie not sweet.  

We moved to a table in the back later in the night, and the servers back there were great at making recommendations and keeping our drinks refreshed.  Almost all the food is fried but the chicken pot pie empanada and the peach fry pie were fantastic.  We also got the box of vegetables, which were a nice break from the fried, but I doubt people come here for that.

So, I will be back for more drinks and to try the pimento burger, which I heard was excellent.
author: Seong P.

description:
They don't do reservations, and it was packed by 6pm on a Friday.  The bar seating immediately in front of the bar is probably best for dining.  The other counter seats have a more narrow table, so it's not great for eating, but it's still good for drinks.  There are some communal tables in the back that fill up quickly. 

Drinks: 
1. Jackel: I love rye, so I had to start with this. It's rye, lemon, pineapple, cardamom - a bit complex from the cardamom, a bit tart, a bit sweet - it was a great drink to start with
2. Pina verda: I don't usually order tequila based drinks (but I love my mezcal), but I tried my friend's, and this drink was good.  It's tequila, lime, pineapple, bitters - a tad sweet but well balanced
3. Lefty's Fizz: topped with egg white. The base is mezcal, which was nice and smoky, and they use dry curacao and a grapefruit shrub so that it's citrusy but not too sweet.  I think I liked this more than the pina verde since it was more complex

Food: Family style, no utensils.  You get a wet napkin and a dry napkin, and most dishes come with skewers when appropriate.  It does make it a little harder to split some items such as the lamb dog, but you can get creative with skewers.  Most are $6-10 each.
1. ABV: bucket of vegetables. We expected something pickled, but this was a bit more oily than I was hoping for. There was a good variety of produce including more interesting things like daikon and a mild ginger. The peppers and eggplant were a bit too oily for me
2. Padron peppers: hit or miss in spiciness, with some being numbing.
3. Octopus: wonderful char and tender octopus, topped with a squid ink ranch. The accompanying potatoes had a good crisped outside. 
4. NC style pulled pork sandwich: topped with red slaw inside. This was flavorful, and all the juices soaked into the bun. It's split in half, so it's good for 2 people to share 
5. Falafel lamb dog: the lamb had really good spiced flavor (not spicy), no gaminess, but this needs to be eaten hot so that you don't lose the texture of the breading.  The skewers are kind of big, but they're a bit difficult to split, and each order comes with 2, so plan for 1 skewer of the lamb dog per person
6. Pimento burger: lots of flavor, super juicy, on the smaller side (but also cheaper). This is also cut in half, good for 2 to share

Favorites of the night: the falafel lamb dog and the pimento cheese burger - both were interesting and had lots of flavor.

I loved sitting at the bar and talking to the bartenders and watching them in action.  I had only heard about their drinks, but the food was unexpectedly good, and I will definitely be coming back!  It's rare to find a good craft cocktail bar with such good bar bites.
author: Marilyn T.

description:
Stopped in last night for some cocktails and snacks. Spectacular on both accounts.

The bartenders definitely bring a sense of professionalism and pride to their work. This place seems to be one of those bars that bartenders like to go to (It's always a good sign when people who work at the bar go there to get drinks on their days off). Our bartender (I forget his name, but the tall, red-bearded, handsome viking looking fellow) was particularly excellent and deserves some recognition. The drinks from the menu were all excellent, as were non-menu drinks and mescal flight he recommended. He clearly has the proficiency to make great drinks but he was also able to explain them clearly enough to people (me) without the palate or vocabulary for it. The drinks were all well balanced, not too sweet, not too dry, not too much of anything. The only downside is the price, which is pretty standard for SF. I'm not sure at what point it happened that we see a menu, and we're like, "great! only 11 dollars per cocktail!" At least here the drinks seem worth it.

The food was also good. We tried the pimento cheeseburger, which was small but amazing and the pulled pork sandwich as well, which was also solid. Most of the food items seem to be made in house and the bread is sourced from tartine. 

I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Baron C.

description: Me and my brother were visiting SF for his birthday last week and couldn't have picked a better spot to celebrate. Our waitress, Cecily, was super accommodating and so friendly! She made us feel right at home. I'm of the gluten-free variety and she kindly let me know all of the options on the menu that I could enjoy. The drinks were uh-mazing!!! John the bartender makes the most delicious pomegranate grenadine on the planet and his vodka sodas are the best. EVER. They made us feel like we were regulars, even though we were only in town for a couple days. Although we didn't get to meet the chefs, the were awesome too! Every dish we ordered was fresh, healthy and flavorful. We had the brussel sprouts, the little gems, the mushrooms who's name I forgot but were yummy, and the foie gras stuffed olives. YUM! Everything here just dazzled the birthday boy and was the perfect atmosphere for some sibling bonding time. Love you guys and thanks for all of your recommendations and your hospitality!!! Will definitely be back next time we are in town. xoxox
author: Emy J.

description:
This is the best bar I've ever been to. 

The atmosphere is nice. Feels spacious and warm. Not too loud. 

The service is excellent. Servers are attentive and knowledgeable. 

And, the drinks, are fantastic! Until finding ABV, I avoided cocktails, because all cocktails, everywhere, are way too sweet for my taste. 

When I first arrived here, seeing the cocktail menu, I asked the server, if there was anything on the menu that is not sweet. He responded by saying that nothing is sweet, they strive for balance in all drinks. The moment I heard that, I knew that I stumbled upon something special. 

It's clear a lot of thought and integrity goes into the drinks here and I've now had a few cocktails and enjoyed them all. Tremendous depth of flavor, and balance between bitter, astringent, sour, and sweet. 

This is my go-to place for drinks now and the first time ever that I actually enjoyed a cocktail!
author: Eater S.

description: One of the best cocktail bars that I know in town. A little pricey but totally worth it. Going on a Saturday night around 6pm is feasible without having to fight the crowds. The food looks fantastic too but I didn't try it (had a dinner planed after).
author: Melanie P.

description:
A good place for a small group or intimate get-together. The decor is dark, but cozy. Service is excellent as there is always someone to check in on you and your guests.  

Came here as a group of four. Sat at the communal table on the second floor - perfect for our slightly talkative, loud group.  We ordered 4 different drinks (highly recommend the Mumbai Mule) and several appetizers that were all really good (the burger, churros, and little gem salad).  The food is meant for sharing, but they are just the right size. 

Overall, highly recommend to anyone looking for a nice cocktail and light bites in an intimate setting.
author: Reb R.

description: Great vibe, lively atmosphere.  This is the former Tokyo Go Go now an awesome cocktail spot with 2 big communal tables for food.  For cocktails I love the Jackal (if you love egg white drinks you should get) with a hint of smokiness, citrus, very well balanced!  This new spot is still in soft opening. I like!
author: Edmond T.

description:
Was told to check this place out from my coworkers.  Its a nice little place down in the mission and I got in with my friend around 5:30PM on a Wednesday so it pretty chill when we got in, but by the time we left around 7:30PM the place was packed.

Do yourself a favor when you swing by make sure to try as much of their food dishes as possible!  We were not disappointed in anything and would differently would recommend it to anyone around the neighborhood!
author: Ferdinand L.

description: This is one of my favorite date night bars in SF. I have come here with my boyfriend and also met up friends. The cocktails are tasty and the food is amazing. I love that all the dishes are small so you can order a bunch and try different ones. My favorites are the box of veggies and the pot pie empanadas. The waitstaff and bartenders are always super nice. It gets really crowded on weekend nights, but so does every other bar and restaurant in SF.
author: Nina K.

description:
Was pleasantly surprised when we stumbled across the soft opening of ABV (for all you non-beer drinkers, Alcohol By Volume) last week. We went to a movie at the Roxie and were on the hunt for a new place for sips and snacks. Boy did we luck out when we walked into Abv. 

Fantastic cocktail menu broken down by spirit. I went for the Mumbai mule which is a twist on your usual sf mule by using Saffron vodka and house made ginger beer. Those extra steps really stood out. Hands down the best mule I've ever had. Spicey and refreshing with a balanced tart finish.  Can't wait to go back to try more cocktails from the list. It was hard to pick just one.

But you must make sure you come for the bites.  All the food is finger food, aka no silverware needed. We chose four small plates, but I must say the descriptions could be a little clearer on the menu. Once you ask the staff, they are happy to give you details on each dish, but wouldn't it be easier to have the menu give us the info so our bartenders can keep on making their bomb libations!?

We got the little gems, so delicious. Grilled leaves covered in green goddess dressing. Smokiness really comes out in each bite.

The abv (a box of vegetables) which was a great sampler of pickled and grilled veggies ranging from golden beats to miniature carrots, to radishes and so much more! Was definitely more complex then it sounded.

Next was the kimchee fritters. They were a little too out there for me, covered with Bonita flakes. But my boyfriend, who is a pescatarian was all about them. He gobbled them up!

Lastly, and my absolute favorite was the Chicken Pot Pie empanadas. The crust was absolutely divine. We are talking tender, flakey, buttery cooked to perfection. The filling was great flavors of your traditional Chicken Pot Pie. The best part you may ask? Ummm.. As mentioned my boyfriend is pescatarian, so I didn't have to share the empanadas.  All mine!

I should mention another bonus, this place won't break the bank. Small bites are mostly $8, but I believe all $10 and under. Fab drinks range from $10-12. And the staff is super friendly! All of them were knowledgeable, attentive and willing to walk you through your choices. Better yet, is that they followed up with you to make sure that you were happy with your drinks and food.  My only is hope is that this doesn't fly out the window once word gets out. Because this place is a spot not to be missed!
author: Victoria O.

description:
This place was fantastic!

We went here for a late night drink and were pleasantly surprised to find that in addition to a great drinks menu they also had amazing food with a kitchen open until 1AM.

We ordered the empanadas and the bao bun sloppy joes and were speechless with how good they were. The portions are small so, I would recommend ordering a few things to share. Eater SF has more amazing things to say about their food (next time I'm told to try the Lamb dog)

At the end of the evening when we got our bill we were pleasantly surprised again to find that everything is priced so reasonably ($4 12 oz beers in the Mission, what?!).

Of course, I can't forget to mention the great service we received. The waiter was very friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive. I have found that when places first open you usually have to give the staff a break since they're still getting in to their rhythm but ABV seems to be on top of this.

I think I have a new Mission bar top 5!
author: Amanda G.

description: Nice change of pace from the many dive bars in the area. The bartenders are super friendly and the drinks are excellent. The food is pretty good too. Portion sizes could be a little bigger but everything was tasty. Great place to catch up with friends since it's not too loud.
author: Diana S.

description: This place is badass! We got their house infused pineapple sherry, and it was SO GOOD. We also got the oloroso ice cram sandwich...and damn. It was amazing. It had an oatmeal raisin cookie and a white chocolate coating!  seriously to die for. Our cocktail server was super friendly and attentive. This was a pretty cool cocktail bar, I would definitely recommend.
author: Jayna F.

description:
I've only come here once, so I'll need to get a follow-up review for sure.  The cocktails were just okay.  I ordered a slightly sweet rum cocktail and my friend ordered a smoky mezcal cocktail and I felt that the flavor profiles of our drinks were a bit off relative to the other places in the city where I have spent my time imbibing.

We did not get any food so I can't really review that, but I can review the vibe. Slightly intimate, slightly cold.  There is table service and I found the staff over-attentive.  Having the staff repeatedly visit your table can cause breaks in conversation that make the vibe of a place sub-optimal for me.

4 stars will try again.
author: Alex H.

description:
Great cocktail/food bar in the mission with fabulous service!

Pros: Amazing food choices, all for under $10; amazing service - someone came and brought us water as soon as we posted up at our spot; hand crafted cocktails with interesting ingredients (ex. cardamom)

Cons: Could get a little crowded on the weekends - but we were there on a weeknight and it was perfect!
author: Grace Y.

description: I've been to ABV a couple times now and I've enjoyed both times. For one, it is a pretty spacious bar for the city. Both times I have gone, I was able to get a table in the back. Tables in the back get waiter service too. I enjoy their playful menu. I remember lamb sausage corn dogs and kimchee fritters the first time I went. The last, I enjoyed a play on banh mi with steamed buns where the 2 got married, but had Laotian baby inside of it. Cocktail menu is large and is divided by alcohol base. Drinks are good. I like the minimal design too. Think wood, dark metals, and industrial lighting fixtures. Pretty much how all the bars I go to look like. Good service too!
author: Hazel F.

description: Really delicious drinks at this popular spot. Not overly crowded, but definitely busy place on Thursday around 9pm. Zero complaints. I'd return and try the food.
author: Becky T.

description: Excellent drinks and bar food here. The cheeseburger was juicy, cheesy and wholly enjoyable (I only wish that it was slightly bigger). The Mumbai Mule is a variation of the Moscow Mule but with saffron and more spices, giving it more flavour and tang. Overall, great bar with a good ambiance.
author: Michelle Y.

description: I guess a place that has a blue wall with no obvious name posted outside of it already carries with it a certain level of mystique. That being said, this place definitely serves up some tasty cocktails and caters to a slightly older crowd. Food served out back. A little more of an upscale place amidst all the classic dives on 16th.
author: Mel G.

description:
Fantastic cocktails! Love the Jackal and they have a kickass Moscow Mule. Would give them five stars but food is really small for the price and in some cases (boiled peanuts) not at all enjoyable.

Luckily for them, it's super crowded Thursday thru the weekend so check it out early, early in the week.
author: Raj T.

description: San Francisco's cocktail popularity produces a lot of cliche and overly hyped bars that might be beautiful but often the cocktail program's fall short. I am bartender/manager of a bar and when I visit SF I always end up at ABV. The drinks are not overly complicated, but delicious, and the execution is solid. Although I'm bummed that boiled peanuts are off the menu, I tried the chicken tacos and they were layered with flavor and wrapped in a homemade tortilla. The bar design is nice to, again not overly hyped, clean modern efficient. Lastly I'm huge fan of Del Maguey Mezcal and Springbank scotch which they have every bottle of it seems. Check this place out. You won't be sorry. Cheers
author: Scott B.

description:
i've book marked this place for a while now, and it was pretty good! tried two cocktails off the menu, and also one of the bartender's signatures that tasted like a negroni, which is like my fave drink. #winning. will be back to try their bar bites.

the location is pretty central! its good stuff :)
author: Christina L.

description: Delicious drinks, juicy burger and incredible service. Afternoon ambience could use some work
author: Alex T.

description:
Context: Friday night pre dinner drinks for two at about 7pm

Atmosphere: place is packed but this is one place where the communal tables paid off. We scrunched in with some other people and while the place is super loud around us we were able to hear one another at our table and weirdly enough tune out all the other people. On the first floor is a long bar and then stand up tables, in the back is a large communal table and then the small loft upstairs has a communal table. That's where we sat. Industrial decor.And, did I mention it was loud? But I am almost 50. . . So maybe a younger crowd would not find it so loud.

Service: excellent. Truly some of the best service I've ever had in the city or elsewhere. Not hovering or weird, "hi, I'm bob and I'll be your server";  just efficient, quick and unobtrusive. Made the experience. Even our water was filled regularly. And we were on the second floor!

Food: we ordered the lamb corn dogs. They were great. Nice, spice lamb flavor dipped in a spicy, crispy batter with a cucumber yogurt like ing sauce. Two dogs are served with these greatsmall metal plates. And, we ordered the cheddar cheese. It came with fantastic bread, I would guess from tartine, some kind of jam and a smear of butter. The cheddar itself was an excellent dry, flavorful cheese. Enjoyed every bite.

Drinks: we tried one drink with cardamom and one more traditional cocktail. Both were good but on the not sweet side. 

Wonderful service; great food and perfect cocktails....what is not to like
author: Vivek V.

description:
I rarely review, even places that aren't very good. Most places at least try to keep the customer happy, even if execution falls short. But I have to speak out about the completely rude service my party was given this past weekend.

I had a large party for my birthday and tried to reserve some space at ABV. When they emailed me back, they told me that they don't take reservations on the weekend but I could walk in and secure space as it became available. A few friends and I came an hour early to do so and finally a table became available. We were even told by our server we should "stretch out." So we did precisely that. My small party of 4 saved 4 more seats by putting our purses and jackets on the chairs adjacent to us. Little did we know this would incur the wrath of the server that told us to stretch out in the first place! He repeatedly told us we couldn't save seats like we were children with learning disabilities, and when we tried to calmly explain that we were told we could (BY HIM FER CRISSAKES), he became even more condescending. He even came back and accused us of shooing away customers when we absolutely did not do anything of the sort.

Even worse, after we had left to change venues and spend our money on a place that wanted our business, a few more friends showed up and asked the staff where the birthday party was. They replied that we were gone and proceeded to talk shit about us to our friends. Very professional.

In short, thanks to the the attitude of one guy, I know a big group of people who will not step into ABV again. Which sucks, because the drinks are good!
author: Michi A.

description: Nice place to have a drink, hang with a friend, and soak in the wondrous chatter and clinking of glasses that is the SF hipster nightlife.
author: Steven C.

description:
We checked this new place out during the day last weekend and were very impressed! The drinks were creative and delicious, and the bartender (Cecelie) was awesome. She made us all sorts of unique off menu drinks that we asked for and seemed excited about the challenge and helping us mix up new drinks.

All the food is finger food, so no utensils required. These are mostly all small plates, ready for sharing. We got:

- The veggies (can't recall the name), which were a great combination of colors and flavors; the sauce that came with them was some kind of aioli-esque sauce amped up with something (maybe saffron?).
- Little gem salad, which are smallish wedges with sauce and the same croutons they use on their burger made with sweet potato-- delicious. 
- Dolmas, which are a unique spin on this middle eastern favorite; they come with a black sesame tahini and are packed full of flavor (tons of chicken parts in here so beware if that's not your thing). 
- Pulled pork tacos, which were one of my favorite dishes! They were incredibly flavorful and had a nice veggie crunch on top.
- BURGER! This is the best burger I've had in recent memory, for sure. The meat was incredibly flavorful and was really a stand-out at this meal. It was a good size-- not shareable like the other plates. I don't even normally like pickles, but they were fabulous with the burger. Do yourself a favor and order it-- now!

Overall, a cool spot to hang out for drinks and/or food. I will definitely be back, and I foresee this being a really busy spot very soon, so get in while you can! :)
author: Erin B.

description: Went here for a business meeting. Fun spot, not a lot of space but was good for our purposes. Seating was kind of awkward, but the menu made up for it. Beer list was on the smaller size, but the cocktail list was significat with some fun custom drinks on the menu.
author: Kian A.

description:
Talented knowledgeable bar tender Ben. Limited beer taps. Unique multi cultural food menu, all finger food. Good bar space double row of 32 bar stools. 2 small dining table areas. 

Intentional underground lack of signage is annoying. I had to ask the name of the place and the bathrooms are not clearly marked. They both look like women's rooms, I went through a door to the alley.
author: Brian L.

description:
This bar reminds me of NY and you get five stars! My friends and I sat upstairs which was prime seating. Get here early to snag seats upstairs because they seem to go quick. 

I'd say for a gastropub, the food menu is legit. I stuck to beer but the drink menu looks enticing. Will try one of them next visit.
author: John M.

description: Small bar that gets pretty lively in the evening. The drinks were amazing! The bartenders are awesome! Also the abalone mushrooms and fish tacos are a must eat!
author: Annie R.

description: This place is dope. Considering the consistent sh#t show that is that part of the mission these days (which can be great when in the mood), it's a fun change of pace to sit down at the bar for a really well made cocktail and some surprisingly DELICIOUS small plates. Had a killer sazerac and a great glass of French red on tap. Also had a beef tongue Reuben on some perfectly toasted rye pan de mie, some super tasty Brussel sprouts, and some foie gras stuffed olives. Great place to share a few things, good ambience and super attentive bar tender on a weekday. Cool spot, fun drinks great food. Good date spot.
author: Trevor M.

description: Yup. Just sitting here waiting to be acknowledged by Emily (the nice barback told us her name) its been 12 minutes. Pretty ridiculous. Just got up and left....
author: Thanna C.

description: Have a large backpack or a bicycle?! Don't worry about going inside. There is amazing curbside service. To top it off Andre at the door is full of jokes and fun, we wish he could join us at our table. He was amazing!! The drinks were amazing to boot!
author: Jody N.

description:
First off, I have never written a bad review of a restaurant or bar (for that matter any kind of review for a restaurant or bar) but this needs to be addressed as I think it will happen more if the owner and ABV staff does not get their business/customer service/basic 101 on how to treat people and run an establishment together.  

I went to ABV the other night after about a month or so after first going there and remembered the owner (Ryan) and said hi along with with my date, we met the first time I was there and told him I thought he had a cool new spot in the mission.  When I was leaving this is what happened:  The owner Ryan comes up to me and says "hey I was asking for some feedback with my bar tenders" (here I am thinking he wants me to tell him how I think they're doing, which they weren't doing a very good job for starters, the staff was rude to me from the very beginning but I don't buy into that and know people have their days and I don't rat on people unless they attack me which in this case happened but I wasn't planning on singling anyone out) and then he starts laying into me about something his bar tenders said I did.  

Now, before I go any further, this is a bar and restaurant/small bites lounge that charges high dollar for food and drinks, that said you expect some level of service, not kindergarten he said she said bullshit that I had to deal with in front of my date that didn't even pertain to me, and even if it was 100% accurate, have some manners about how you approach a situation and ask before telling and maybe speak in private if you really feel the need to accuse someone.

Ryan starts into this thing about me asking for grapefruit juice (here I am drinking a margarita and then realizing he is talking about what his bartenders said I did on some other occasion,) Ha! I'm sorry did I miss something? it's important that your bartenders are happy, but its more about whether I'm happy as a high paying customer, this isn't some run down beer bar that can get away with locker room language, this is a place built to take a lot of your money (which I have spent there and will never again).  

I can understand if I threw food/drinks/punches etc and came back in.. that deserves a talk, not something so petty as grapefruit and how his "bartenders/servers felt about that and how I need to not be doing that and there's nobody in the city that does fresh grapefruit" and that he's pissed about it etc, by the way tons of bars do fresh grapefruit bud, shit even hemlock fucking squeezes grapefruit.  Even if I said what his staff was saying I did I as a owner would never approach a good paying customer over something so small, pick your battles wisely as that was very unwise and childish, pissing me and my date off and almost (key word) ruining the rest of our evening.  I know the owner Ryan was drinking and it was 130am but does not in the slightest way justify that behavior.  

How you approached me without knowing any facts and assumed what you were told to be verbatim makes you a very inexperienced owner and staff, I've ran businesses before and know thats one of the biggest no no's.  You don't even know who I am dude, you just don't do that.  Unless you know something to be empirically factual don't fucking accuse a paying customer of something, got it?

Here I was thinking before how I thought it was a cool new bar/food lounge in the Mission that I'd be happy to invest my time and money into with my friends etc but not now. I've been in the city over 15 years, have numerous friends that own/manage/work in bars and restaurants in the city and help advise some on others.  This is just not good all around for ABV.  

In conclusion, 
For what its worth Ryan did apologize at the end when I said your barking down the wrong tree and probably realized he messed up but the damage had been done and frankly I see this place going out of biz if they don't make some huge changes soon.  I've never said anything mean or nasty to anyone in your establishment and this is what I get.  Either someone took what I said completely wrong or I am simply the victim of mis identification, either way it was handled in the worst way possible and I hope you guys change your ways of conducting business.  

Take this for what it's worth to you, that's exactly how it happened and I needed to get this off my chest as it was quite humiliating and upsetting in front of my date.  You reap what you sow, You really do reap what you sow.
author: M S.

description: Very good drinks,  great environment and delicious food.  I especially enjoyed the kimchee fritters and the lamb dogs. Don't miss the Moscow mule!
author: Nicholas P.

description: Excellent cocktails, decent food. The gin & celery is one of the best drinks I've had in awhile. The fish tacos are pricey for the quantity you get, but the flavors are really good. Great date night spot.
author: Amy Y.

description: A fairly new spot in the Mission with plenty of seats and cocktails to please your palette. The bar is hip, modern and have small bites. We started our Saturday night here and the bartender, Jackie, was super awesome. The food all looked mighty tempting, but we only had room to try out their Sloppy Joe buns, which were spicy and an interesting bar food option. I like this place, but I'm not ready to say I love it yet...!
author: Lisa R.

description: Cocktails Bitches! Every Single Menu Item is a MUST TRY! Large beautiful chunky ice cubes and the freshest ingredients! I love the the way they mix it up! Custom Concoctions ! Great Atmosphere! Great Energy! Great Food!
author: Roman J.

description:
Love love love this place! I had my birthday here and the staff was beyond amazing. They were friendly, accommodating, and generous. All of their cocktails were great and the food was even better. Try the burger (aaamazing), lamb corn dogs (why hasn't anyone thought of this before), and chicken pot pie empanada (four more please!). 

I am hesitant writing this review because I wish I could keep this place a secret. However they are so awesome, they deserve this review!
author: K V.

description: Yummy cocktails and it wasn't overly crowded! Great place to hang out and chat with friends. The wait staff is super nice too, they accidentally made an extra cocktail and gave it to us to enjoy.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
The bad: it's crowded. That's it. No, really - I think this place's main downfall is that it's so awesome everyone wants to come here! As a result, space is limited, and the servers can forget things. They always make good on it at the end, though, so I'd give 'em 4.5 stars if I could because the stuff they serve (both food and drink) is so dang good!

Now, the good. The bites, the drinks, and the vibe are all so dang awesome. My friends and I came here for a snack and a cocktail, and ended up eating an entire meal of what I'd describe as "American comfort tapas" and experiencing a combination of classic and creative cocktails along the way.

All in all, a pretty rad option for both light grub and awesome booze. I'll be coming back. When I've got a good chunk of time to wait out the crowd. And it'll be worth it!
author: Kevin B.

description:
This new spot on 16th street has become our favorite late night grub in Mission. 
The food is yummy and the drinks are delicious! My favorite is the Land's End as i like light rum cocktails.  
The staff is friendly and attentive! The place is clean and greatly decorated.The chef is brilliant -he knows what he is cooking up in that little kitchen of theirs! 
I recommend THE BURGER! Holly cow is it good? mmmmm...... home made sweet potato bun? Yes please! Seriously i don't even like burgers.
Dolmas are yummy-  warm and full of chicken! My boyfriend won't stop talking about them. Chicken Pot Pie Empanadas are also must try!!! 

I definitely recommend this place to anyone who is up for some good cocktails & some good food. Glad something this good opened up in my neighborhood!
author: Tumay A.

description: If i could give this place zero stars...i would solely based on terrible rude service. I politely asked the bartender for a drink recommendation and he walked away. When I asked for a chaser, I was denied. The bartender was not only ignorant but was rude as well. Never coming back here again. Also, very overpriced for the lack of service.
author: Anda S.

description: Sunday funday'd here. Was great, the cocktail list is extensive- they have a few beers/ciders to pick from as well but was really blown away by the food. Perfect american dim sum style (and well priced) with some really funky and cool dishes done in creative ways. Can't wait to go back.
author: Nick D.

description:
My wife and I stopped in on a Sunday afternoon to check out the new space. They are doing the mixology & fancy bar food thing. The interior is nice, and during the day, gets a pleasant amount of daylight. We had very delicious drinks, which took a very long time to prepare. The bartender was very excited about the food menu, which was southern-inspired, very heavy gourmet bar food. I didn't try anything, but my wife enjoyed the fish and chips. 

We stopped by again on a Monday night, and the place was absolutely full of nerds. Not a very cool scene at all. We didn't stick around. However I'd like to check it out again, and I am interested to see how the scene plays out in the next few months.
author: Steve E.

description: I'm a visitor from Singapore, and introduced this "great" place by  head bartenders from TIppling Club and 28HKS. As a visitor no one would bring out our passport but a legit ID with us just in case we lose our passport. But ABV insisted for a passport and not serving us. I mean when I go to other famous bars they accepted a Singapore ID, I know is some policy you all need a passport and you guys did not mention anything about having a passport to be drinking in a bar right? Such a shame that someone who had travelled so far and got rejected.
author: Colin Y.

description: Great cocktails and delicious food. Kimchi fritter and cheese board were both amazing!
author: Brittany B.

description:
This place is, simply put, absolutely incredible.

First off, the staff is super nice, they know a lot about where alcohol / food comes from, a bit of history, which was very interesting.

The cocktails  menu is not too long, just enough variety to try new cocktails, they're made to perfection (try the Mumbai Mule !) 

The food was amazing. It's snacks / small dishes, very tasty, easy to share with friends, and the Grilled Green Gems are so good !!

The place is really nice, looks very good, and the music is excellent.

Such a great place to hang out with friends, I would recommend this place in a heartbeat !
author: Alexei C.

description: The Mumbai Mule was fantastic and the padron peppers were really well prepared, cooked just right and not too oily. I also enjoyed the atmosphere, lots of space to spread out, solid long tables, just enough lighting. Oh and the waitstaff is really nice and welcoming, almost like long lost friends.
author: Erin W.

description: Great drinks, great atmosphere, and amazing staff. However, the bathroom smells like homeless haven. I don't understand why everyone decides to pee on the floor when there is a toilet right there. It smells downright nasty even when you are standing in line for the bathroom.
author: T D.

description:
Checked out this spot for the first time in the Mission.
Alcohol By Large Volumes I say! pour me another one! I break all my drinking rules when I am here.

Loved their Fogerty drink since its made with Campari something I used to mix with my drinks back home in the Bahamas.

The food and drinks overall were good and now any friends visiting in town, I always make it a point to check out this place. 

2- Fogerty (@$11 each)
2 - Pina Verde (@$10 each)
1 - Tiny Fish ($8)
1 - ODB ($11)
1 - Land's End ($11)

A good night at a good bar with food and awesome drinks for under $80!
author: Marc M.

description: Boiled peanuts and mixologists that make fantastic cocktails. Seriously what more could you want?
author: Nic F.

description: ABV knows what's what in the cocktail department. They may have created my favorite cocktail yet- the gin & celery. Gin, celery bitters, lemon, and tonic. How can something taste just like celery and also be refreshing and slightly sweet? It's magic. The other cocktails are also well prepared, including the one with Japanese whiskey. We snacked on their veggie/pickle plate, a unique combination of veggies and aioli dipping sauce. The fried broccolini with lemon and garlic were sublime. Service was smooth and the space was chill, though it got much busier as the night progressed. Recommend.
author: Cori W.

description: Cool space, offensive service. We had a small group and they hovered over us, demanding that we order another drink before we'd even finished the ones we had. Barking at us for moving a stool over and more hovering. Food was fairly good, but I'd rather go somewhere more welcoming.
author: M D.

description: I visited ABV briefly this past Saturday. My love and I were in the mood for a quick drink, so we order a Tarragon Collins. This drink was positively delicious and refreshing, and the presentation was beautiful. Furthermore, the bartender split the drink for us without us even having to ask. What a great place! I'll definitely be back!
author: Miss M.

description: This place has a good atmosphere, from bouncer to bartender. They are quick to help and give grew at recommendations. I'm new to SF and they made me feel like it was my hometown bar. They have Japanese whiskey and do a good grilled octopus.
author: Vincent A.

description: Stiff drink, very stiff indeed. The drinks were stiff, the place was stiff, the staff was stiff: an all around stiff experience. So stiff it inspired me to try to make "stiff" happen as slang for "good". Mean girls say it won't happen, but they aren't stiff. I may have drank one of their old fashioned before I wrote this and realized I need to take the red eye to NYC in a bit. Still #stiff though.
author: Jon B.

description:
I was visiting from San Diego and found this place on Yelp. The food, service, and booz were all fantastic. Dare I say, some of the best for the price in SF. 

I highly recommend the burger, Fogerty, and The Jackel.
author: DJ H.

description: After having spent the past year and a half obsessively trying out every cocktail bar I can find, ABV takes the top spot for me. The bartenders are super friendly and their dedication to the craft is obvious. While pretty much all of their signature cocktails are amazing, I suggest asking for something with Mezcal in it as they have they stock the full portfolio from Del Maguey. You can even sample their Mezcals in the traditional Oaxacan clay cups.
author: Alex P.

description: The Jackal at ABV is one of my fave drinks in SF...so good. If you're looking for something a little different and like celery try the G+C (gin and celery), great refreshing and light drink. They have a great variety of craft cocktails and everything is house made. In addition to drinks they have fantastic food! All small bites and nothing that requires a fork/knife (don't think they even have flatware). The pork bun and corn dog are 2 of my go-tos. It's a great spot to do happy hour with friends, a couple drinks and share a few of the snacks. Finding a seat late night can be a challenge, but there is plenty of standing room and he bartenders/servers are great at making their way over to you to get your order.
author: Mac C.

description: The Japanese drink is a watered down whiskey+soda. Could taste basically no alcohol. Menu said $13 I think, put down $14 but was told we cant pay without getting the check, and that it wasn't enough after the taxes. Even if you wanna go to a trendy bar that serves food, there are better options.
author: travis w.

description: Amazing cocktails and the foods look fantastic. The bartender, Eric, has a great personality and is very passionate about cocktails.
author: Eric C.

description: Their Kimchi Fritter was to die for. Still think about it everyday.
author: Phoebe G.

description: Great drinks and friendly service. Had the Dartmoor and Mumbai mule and highly recommend both.
author: TZ J.

description: Enjoyable space and crowd, good drinks and what really puts the bar above others are the creative culinary snacks. Nice to have some interesting and tasty plates along with wine or a cocktail. Service was a bit abrupt and pushy when we were in conversation and not ordering the next round..., though definitely attentive and in the end backed off a bit when we ordered another drink and food.
author: J K.

description: Cecily was out server during a holiday party at ABV. She was awesome and really made our experience there top notch. Thank you Cecily!
author: Sarah D.

description: Horrible service, bartender was very rude. Thankfully we walked over to the Monks Kettle = much better!! Go there instead!!
author: Marcela M.

description: So happy to savor spicy concoctions that also have vodka. Refreshing and clever with a bite  of hot at the back of the throat. Fun bar!
author: Kathleen S.

description: Amazing cocktail option along 16th street (there are a few options on this street). Friendliest bartenders I've encountered yet. They give you incredibly attention despite how packed. Bouncer is good at keeping crowds in this spacious place to a comfortable level. Cocktails were outstanding; they've got the classics but creative renditions too. ~$14 a cocktail. Didn't order any of their small plates but was drooling over the menu the entire time. Mid-twenty to early thirties crowd. Upscale wood/industrial decor. Chill lounge music. General seating; order at the bar. Proper tables for groups at the back.
author: J. M.

description: Obnoxious staff that questioned my moving of a a stool to an empty space. They don't seem to understand the concept of what a bar is.
author: Jia S.

description:
This follow-up visit to ABV was pre-dinner hour, with daylight still coming in at the door and a rash of seats available to choose from. 
This time around I ordered The Jackal, with trepidation since I am not much of a whiskey drinker. However, whiskey is a writer's kind of drink, so what the hell I thought. Mixed in are: rye, lemon, pineapple gum, egg white and bitters. This cocktail was so gentle going down without losing the taste of the whiskey, was delicious, and provided all the alcoholic punch one could hope for. 
My drinking partner ordered the Pina Verde (blanco tequila, lime, genepy, pineapple and orange bitters), that was likewise sophisticated and a pleasure to consume. 

The music--my source of complaint, or head-scratching, in my last review--had improved, was this time 80s punk rock that was decent.
author: Brian G.

description: All you need to know about this place is the gin and celery. Had my bday shindig here and was glad to have the snackies on offer in addition to the wonderful cocktails. Love!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Wandered in here after a quick Yelp search and was pleased to have it live up to the reviews! Great cocktail bar with a delicious range of cocktails, grouped by spirit type. Lovely small plates if you want a nibble. Staff was incredibly attentive and helpful. Slightly pricey but worth it for a quality cocktail experience. I was in the bar during a non-peak hour so can't speak how full it can get.

Wouldn't mind some non-tall-barstool seating options (i.e., a regular height table and chair) since I was with an older person who is less comfortable in a bar stool, but clearly this was not a deal-breaker.
author: Jayne T.

description: Serious (and strong) crafted drinks. Awesome, friendly bartenders. Gets (too) crowded. Have yet to try the food.
author: Howe L.

description: I love ABV, it's the perfect place for some quality food and top notch drinks. Staff is super attentive and nice and it's got a great vibe going every time I have been there.
author: Jesse W.

description: Great place for drinks and who knew the food was so awesome!! I would come here just for dinner! The burger is AMAZING, love the falafel dogs and the jackal drink is quite yummy as well. It can get super loud, as bars often do but great decor, friendly bar/wait staff. This is the ideal spot for a bite and a drink. Is it weird that I like the food better than the cocktails at a bar?!
author: Kelly C.

description: I had a great time at ABV. The drinks are amazing, try the Piña Verde and the Lefty's Fizz. The grilled Little Gem Salad with Goddess dressing was terrific, and the Lamb Falafel Dog was one of the most amazing corn dogs I've ever had. Great service, Thanks Cecily!
author: Rusty R.

description: I'm a fan. It's not your standard SF cocktail pricing of $10, but once in awhile, it's ok to indulge. Had my birthday party here. The top of the stairs seating is for reservations only I think, but the party that was up there before left early so it became open seating to whoever came in. We had to crowd around the bar a little when we got there (on warm nights, this place is a swamp...next time, I'm wearing short sleeves), but the waiters were really nice in being our scouts in telling us when tables could be opening up, as they were just given their bill. The Jackal was my libation of choice (I'm a fan of the whiskey/lemon 1-2 punch), and the PBJ ice cream sandwich was tasty. They serve some type of mezcal shot at 11pm (unsure if this is SOP or not), so I made sure to partake in that, even though I'm not a tequila guy. While parking is miserable (we drove around for a long time, as this area fills up fast), I'd still be back.
author: Dan M.

description: Absolutely love this spot. From the drinks to the food, you really can't go wrong! Next to Trick Dog, this is probably my 2nd favorite bar in the Mission. Get the kimchi fritter while you're there. It's amazing.
author: Kristen C.

description: walked into this packed little bar in the mission. looked new and interesting. Our bartender was great and the drink selections were popular with our group, esp the taragon tom collins. i liked the snacks they had as well...really good food and drink selection.  standing room only, but worth a visit if you're in the area.  we'll be coming back!
author: Roy N.

description: Came here for drinks and some appetizers with my friends. It was definitely packed by 7 pm on a friday- and for good reason. The drinks are good- and strong. Price point is definitely fair. The appetizers are diverse and dynamic for bar food. I recommend the kimchee fritter and the winsom cheese plate- both so good!!!!
author: Laura S.

description: Stopped by here almost as soon as we arrived in town. Our hotel manager suggested we go here, and what a fantastic way to start off our trip in San Francisco! We had brunch, which for us was the breakfast sandwich and their special today. The wonderful ladies behind the bar offered lots of great suggestions to do while we are in town. We will be back before we leave to try out their drink menu!! Thanks so much for treating us well and we look forward to our next visit!
author: Josh L.

description: I have been here three times, really wanting to like the place. Some of the drinks are very good, some are mediocre.  My main issue with the place is that the services has been lacking significantly; both at the bar and at tables.  Servers don't seem to care too much, want to explain drinks, etc. (except for one bartender at one of my visits).  Not sure if they are too busy or just don't care.
author: Rodney G.

description: Very solid place,  and the drinks are on excellent! My favorite is the Mumbai mule,  it's a must have :)  It gets super crowded and loud on weekends,  so that might be something to consider when you're picking a place, but it's a great place for a group outing looking for a fun night!
author: Alex R.

description: Came here on a Sunday night at midnight for a quick drink. Bartenders are friendly, knowledgeable and skilled in their craft. Excellent service. While their draft beer selection is limited, Moonlight brewing, which they do have on tap, is legit. Food menu is open till 1am which is a huge plus. Ate before we arrived and wished we hadn't as the menu looks delicious. Would definitely come back again.
author: Desirée G.

description:
I've been wanting to go here for awhile and check it out. We finally went on Saturday around 600pm. When we walked in, almost all the seat at the bar were taken but there were seat along the wall still available. They had food selections on the wall above the bar so I had to hunt down a drink menu. We looked at it for a few minutes and then finally Jovanie went up to the bar to order only to have the bartender tell him that someone would come over and take our order. The couple next to us didn't hear this interaction and a minute later , went up to the bar and they took his order. Hmmmmmm.
We sat there for another 5 minutes waiting for someone to come by and we were about to leave when a few seats opened up at the bar so I just shrugged and we sat down and were greeted warmly by the bartender. I got The Jackal which had lemon rye and cardamom and it was pretty good. Jovanie got a Whiskey in Church and that pretty much tasted like straight up Lagavulin. It looked like there were only 2 bartenders for a full bar which seemed a little overwhelming , especially when they make the kind of cocktails that take some time, so I'm not necessarily mad about the blow off when we came in but I definitely wouldn't need to go back unless I was in the area and wanted a well made drink. And if that happened, I'd just go to Trick Dog.
author: Jim M.

description: We close at 2 but we stop letting people in at 1:15 said the professional dbag at the door.
author: Matthew G.

description: Cool atmosphere, mostly low noise, good for chatting, they've got a lot of space and tables, they serve food until 1, good food, small portions, smallish beer selection, large liquor selection, very clean place. Friendly service, they come to you at tables or bars along walls. 4 stars.
author: August Y.

description:
Just as a follow up to my previous rating our group will be following up with the management to let them know this bouncer attempted assault on our group even after we complied and left the restaurant.

After we left the premises the bouncer decided to wait at the corner of 16th and Valencia for our group and took a swing (and made contact) at one of the men in our group. He had gathered friends of his in an attempt to instigate a fight and even while the two men in our group repeatedly stated "we are NOT engaging, we do NOT want a fight, we are JUST going home" he continued to advance and eventually hit one of our party members.

This is absolutely unacceptable. There were several witnesses to this unprovoked violence including management of nearby restaurants and patrons of other restaurants/venues.
author: Rishita P.

description: Great cocktails and food. Wasn't too crowded when we went and we were actually able to hear each other talk.
author: Reba N.

description: Got a Death & Taxes black lager and the falafel lamb dogs. Will be back fo' sho'.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Excellent food. Smaller plates which left us satisfied but not uncomfortably full. Pimento burger was cooked well, juicy, good flavor. Homemade pickles were a nice touch. Sloppy Joe steamed buns worked well. Spicy. Boiled peanuts were unique, never had them prepared that way.

Bartender may have been the best part. Friendly, knowledgable, excellent cocktails.
author: Aaron C.

description: Yummy saffron vodka cocktail!  (Can't remember its name right now but so good!!!)  Can't wait to go back.
author: Amy M.

description: Nicely decked out bar. No happy hour. On the pricier side for drinks. Saluki plate options looked inviting. All up just a nice experience but nothing flash or noteworthy to mention.
author: Livia M.

description: I had excellent service here with my boyfriend. Their snacks were unbelievably weird and delicious. I recommend the falafel lamb dogs
author: Vince S.

description:
ABV is a great little bar tucked away in Mission! It has an upscale, classy vibe and is filled with a relatively older, less rowdy crowd.

Drinks are on the pricy side (and no happy hour....sadness), ranging from $10-$14. However, they are pretty well-made with interesting combinations of flavors and nice presentation, which makes the price more worth it. I tried a delicious drink with pisco and fernet. There was also a variety of other drinks with unique liquors. 

Fitting for coming with a group that you want to catch up over conversations + drinks with!
author: Angela H.

description: Great drinks, but as with all crafted cocktails, the wait can be pretty long. Came in on a Sunday afternoon with my twin and service was great and loved the atmosphere. I got a little impatient at times since the drinks took awhile, but they were delicious and well worth the wait. Maybe if they had additional bartenders or cocktailogists (as the cute bartender called himself)? Will be back when I have another lazy Sunday to spend day drinking.
author: Kimberly M.

description: Get the dartmoor and the Jackel. Delicious beverages. Good vibe. Great bartender. Decent neighborhood.
author: Ira M.

description: Love the cocktails at ABV. Definitely one of the best cocktail bars in San Francisco.
author: Jeff M.

description:
most people come here for drinks at this neighborhood bar.  the food here should not be overlooked.  
order the fish and chips- 4 small fish strips but very high fish:batter ratio.  very good potato chip fries.  and the tartar sauce was chunky and very flavorful.  I dipped both fish and chips in the sauce.
author: Mabel F.

description: Super friendly cocktail bar, very cozy and warm environment. Seemed to have a fair number of regulars, even on a weeknight. One of the bartenders broke a glass near me and bought my friend and I a shot to apologize for the near-miss. I think their moscow mule needs more ginger, but they had a fabulous chinotto soda. This place is a good nightcap for a pleasurable dinner.
author: Amanda R.

description: Went to ABV for the first time with friends last night, and will definitely be going back!  The staff was amazing, knowledgeable,  and extremely helpful with recommendations and descriptions of the cocktails and food.  The cocktails were interesting, but the food was a real treat!  There were 5 of us so we ordered a bit of everything, and it was all wonderful!  Prices and portion sizes about what you'd expect in SF these days (don't go in with an empty wallet or stomach), but their chef is an absolute genius and the food was exquisite! Some stand out dishes were the kimchee fritters, grilled octopus,  and chicken pot pie empanadas. ... but seriously, everything was great! And another thing i forgot to ask. .. what the heck was on top of the kimchee fritters that made them look like they were moving?   It was the coolest and craziest thing ever!
author: Matthew S.

description: I came in for the Pimento Cheese Burger right at 2PM when they opened so that I could check off a 7x7 100 Things You Need to Eat in SF Before You Die item. Normally, I'd order a glass of wine, but this was a bar, so when in Rome.... The bartender talked me into the Gin n Celery which did not disappoint. They make their own bitters here and I think that was the secret ingredient in this scrumptious refreshing day drink. Then the burger came. Oh my god, it was good. Again, they make their own buns and pickles and that attention to detail and quality really pays off. This isn't a HUGE burger. But perfect bar food or for a late second lunch. For dessert I got the Land's End raspberry drink. I'm sure this is an awesome night spot, but I'm happy that they open at 2 so that I could truly enjoy the splendid quality crafted food and drink in relative peace and quiet.
author: Tracy B.

description: What a great addition to the neighborhood. Went here for my first time last night. Really love what they did to utilize/change up the old Tokyo A Go Go space that was there previously. Candlelight , bar seating, attentive servers even when it's busy (SHOUT OUT TO CECILY WE LOVE YOU GIRL). Excellent specialty cocktails . Their bar food menu is super interesting and well done. As many have mentioned the Lamb dog is a standout. Tried the mini fish and chips , wasn't as in to that found it to be overly salty . The special of a flatbread with artichoke hearts was excellent. Will definitely be back
author: Lauren V.

description:
Small place but serves super good drinks and snacks. Their house special sausage bun is a MUST TRY!!! Very juicy, tasty and little bit spicy. It blows up my mind. Highly recommend! 
Also they serve Rittenhouse Rye. New fav place~
author: Albee Z.

description: This place was so good. The cheese plate, the pork buns, the kimchee fritter, the cocktails... they were all fantastic. I will definitely come back.
author: Jessie L.

description: Great food, service, cocktails and atmosphere.  I met a friend at 6 on a weeknight, and we got seating with no problem at the bar.  By 8:30, it was packed, and we were happy to move on.  The food was all tasty, but they may want to consider silverware. I also love that they have Unti on tap! Such a treat!!!
author: Alisha A.

description: The good news is, the perfect Aviation and the thoughtful Manhattan do exist.
