Visited ABV on it's 8th night of existence with my knucklehead bro's, and was delighted by perfect mindful mixology, and scrumptious small plates.  Who knew that fish and chips could be reinvented?? Owner Eric stopped by, as did Chef and the lead bartender.   Maybe they thought we were exacting food bloggers.   But more likely, they were just being gracious and enjoying their trade.    Get there while you can, because soon enough there will be no room.
author: Matt P.

description: Nicely crafted cocktails: unique flavors and menu, at a competitive price. We had the Mumbai Mule and Lands End. Saw a few items on the menu (bar bites) that i'd like to try on my next visit! I'll be back another time.
author: Adrianna C.

description: Great bar food and decent beer selection. Only one vodka available though which was kinda strange. It was decent though.
author: Nicole O.

description: I love this place. It is gorgeous inside. Industrial modern decor. So sexy. It's clean, which is so rare for SF. Most importantly, their service is excellent. You don't have to wait at the bar for a drink, the minute you walk in, they hand you a menu and inform you that you can order from the waiter/bar guy. So convenient. And best of all, the cocktails are all to die for. Really great experience. Hope it stays this way.
author: victoria s.

description: The drinks were great (these bartenders/mixologists take themselves seriously) & food was delicious. This is a crowded spot but our party of 6 was able to find a corner at the bar. We had the kimchi fritters, chicken pot pie empanadas, and plantain churros. Everything was so good but portions are small- tapas style. I ordered the Mumbai mule and it was very tasty & not too sweet. This is a fun place but it's kind of a ~scene~, a little pricey, and gets packed so be ready for that. I was surprised at how great service was since they were so busy. Try this place out.
author: Rocio G.

description: Good service and liked the atmosphere. I wasn't crazy about the whiskey in church but I loved the burger and kimchi fritters.
author: Xteethx B.

description: Really good new spot. People seem to be talking about the drinks, but the food was damn good! Had the following: falafal battered lamb dogs, box of veggies, crispy apple pies, persimmon/eggplant toast. The apple pies easily were the best, kind of a cross between a beignet, a donut, and a mcdonalds apple pie. My japanese whisky was decent, but want to come back to try some of the other concoctions.
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Showed up around midnight Saturday night in a state of hunger induced delirium.  Wife and I stumbled around looking like lost dogs probably.  The staff was extremely nice.  They brought us stools when we mentioned wanting to eat and sit.   Food was tasty, sloppy joe buns were amazing, wife's burger looked amazing....  falafel corn dog was a bit confusing since it seemed to have nothing to do with falafel (the consistency of the batter is much more similar to a regular corn dog).  Still tasty though!   Only had one drink since we aren't big drinkers nor do we go to bars very often, but it was one of the better craft cocktails I've had.  The Dublin Cobbler... not too sweet, not too sour (a big pet peeve is drinks that over use lemon).
Mainly I just couldn't get over how nice everyone was.  3 different people helped us out and all were super friendly.  We looked out of place and were acting strangely and yet were treated very respectably.
author: howard t.

description: Had some great cocktails here during the week but had a very unfortunate experience there tonight.  I went with two other very successful friends tonight.  We are in our early 40s.    We were denied entry to the bar bc the bouncer didn't accept the UK drivers license of one our.  friends.    They requested a passport for Id.  Seriously????  Who goes out with a Passport.?? We are all over 40 wealthy and clean cut. And you won't let us into your bar ??  Are you kidding me???  I will never return to this place and encourage others not to return as well.   We gladly  walked over to locanda and had some lovely cocktails and weren't carded.  What a disappointment  that the bouncer couldn't use any judgment to let us in.  Pathetic.
author: JEFF B.

description: Love it. No snobbery or pretense. Good for after work and even before work. Hope they stay the way they are. Burger rocks the house for a midnight snack.
author: Lenny K.

description: Excellent whiskey selection with great bar bites. I slightly refined setting in an otherwise grungy neighborhood.
author: Bill S.

description: Solid place to eat while at a bar.  Late night eating until 1am.  The peppers were tasty as was the goddess green wedge.  The cheeseburger was super tasty but relatively small for being a $9 burger.  There's lots of burgers in this city and to keep up with the top contenders ABV should make it sizable.
author: around town e.

description: Went here on a Friday night with some friends.  The layout of the space is unusual in that there's a ton of room in the rear (near the restrooms), but not a lot of seating, so everyone ends up crowding the front by the bar, as there are stools on either side of the narrow walkway.  ABV does food very well, and I wished they would focus more on expanding that aspect than the drinks.
author: Jenn C.

description: Not only are the drinks amazing but the service is phenomenal!! 5 starts all around! Will be returning and recommending to everyone I know! Great find in mission district!
author: Marissa P.

description: Excellent cocktails! Down to earth and skilled bartenders. Nice vibe. My favorite bar in the city.
author: Mary M.

description: great vibe, delicious drinks and yummy bites to share.  A perfect place to grab drinks and a lite bite.  The services, at times, was a bit slow- but overall, we had a good experience here
author: M D.

description: Went with a girlfriend on a Friday night around 7ish.  Was difficult to find a spot even with just the two of us but with some maneuvering we did just that.  We ordered the charred padron peppers, falafel lamb dog, and cheeseburger with a couple of the Mumbai Mules. It was not a cheap night out but it was certainly tasty. We went for the cheeseburger since I had seen a write-up on it, but we'd return for the lamb dog. And the Mumbai Mules.  Those suckas are dangerous. The crew here looked like pretty standard new Mission, most people in their 20-30s with a few in the older demographic.
author: Sandra Q.

description: Freshly opened and totally on it! The staff is all very into what they do and treat each other and their customers very very well. I own Body Manipulations, right up the street. With all the vacancies on 16th lately I was really looking forward to ABV opening. Wanted a place to have less formal meetings. I had my hopes up after reading all the press about the owners. They certainly did not let me down and have surpassed my hopes. The food is all finger food and well thought out. Very tastey! The drink menu is simple yet full of amazing options. I'm a Japanese whiskey fan and happy to report the fantastic Japanese selection. They even have a high ball on the menu with Hakushu. Great snacks and good priced drinks that won't bust you even in SF.
author: Paul S.

description: Great addition to the hood! The food and drinks are great, and so is the service.  I could never do that kind of bar tending myself, but i guess some of us are just patrons of the arts. Thanks Boris for keeping it tight.
author: California B.

description: Such unique cocktail and food choices!  I loved the chicken pot pie empanadas and kimchi hoecakes.
author: Meggan C.

description: This new spot is Mezcal Mecca.  The staff is very knowledgeable about all the varieties / complexities and are super passionate about teaching you.  This is definitely one of the best joints to hit up in the Mission.  They did a great job with the place, love the minimalist decor and chill music.
author: Jonathan C.

description: Man, this place just *nails* it. The drinks are phenomenal, whether on menu or off menu, the bar tenders are knowledgable and friendly, and the food is delicious. Both the kimchi fritter and the pimento burger are too good to pass up, but too big to eat alone, so bring reinforcements. I'll acknowledge the absence of silverware is a little bit odd, but a small price to pay for deliciousness.
author: Brett W.

description:
This place is amazing! Great atmosphere, the staff is very nice and extremely knowledgeable.
I don't give 5-stars often but this is a place that really deserves them.
author: Nils H.

description: Food is great and the atmosphere is fantastic but they should get over their "we are too cool for silverware" schtick because it is annoying.  I would enjoy the place way more if I could use normal forks to eat the food.  It feels gross to use one's hands for some of the dishes regardless of how tasty / "finger food" friendly it's supposed to be.
author: Em P.

description: Fantastic cocktails.  Delicious food.  Super cool interior.  Knowledgeable service.  Go there.  (Or don't, actually; more room at the bar for me.)  Enough said.
author: Angela K.

description: I NEVER review on yelp but feel i have to. I am a local in the neighborhood, live half a block away and have for years. I've seen many businesses come and go and would normally give this place 4 stars. Though it's not my type of place I have frequently been to ABV and brought others there because what ABV does they do really well. My two stars come from some exceptionally rude and aggressive service I received on Friday night Feb. 12. A waitstaff gentleman with blonde hair and a baseball hat on was incredibly aggressively rude to me and my 4 family members. The night culminated with him saying "if you can't play by the rules you can leave". I was shocked and embarrassed. We were happy, mellow, and hadn't even ordered a drink yet. We left. Couldn't handle staying after such unwarranted bad behavior. Not sure what we could possibly have done to receive that treatment but  I work with people on a daily basis as well and often have to check any bad energy at the door when I show up at work. When I go out I have complete empathy as I understand how much energy is required to work with people and do it well. I am sad to say this place will not feel the same to me now. Places in the Mission come and go, what makes a business special are the people who work there and sadly this gentleman did not represent the business well at all that night. I would love an opportunity to talk to management or even the staff member about it. I did speak to two female staff at the bar who were incredibly kind and sincere about the situation.
author: Harini M.

description: awesome, inventive cocktails.  the banh mi was also excellent.
author: Jennifer N.

description: Great drinks! And for snacks, I highly recommend the "box of veggies", which came with a delicious mayonnaise, and the grilled octopus with crispy potatoes.
author: Aaron S.

description: Stopped by ABV for a cocktail as I waited for my sons for a dinner date late yesterday afternoon.  The cocktail I ordered was delicious and a treat (Mumbai Mule) as was the veggie box that contained a beautiful, colorful assortment of fresh, crisp radishes, cucumbers, beets, and snap peas, along with a tasty dipping sauce.  The bartenders were knowledgeable, friendly and personable.  I will definitely be back to try some of their other cocktails and creative snacks.  Can't wait.
author: Consuelo Rebeca A.

description: Great service, delicious bites.  Thumbs up to the grilled octopus and grilled little gems.  Be prepared to use your figures.  The Jackal is delicious.
author: Diana L.

description: Great addition to the Mission. Food is on point bartenders are top notch.!
author: Beddaden B.

description: Great food: everything on the menu is 'finger food', meaning  no utensils necessary for any of the items. The kimchee fritters were actually really substantial. Their twist of a Mule with saffron was awesome. Communal high tables make the atmosphere friendly and relaxed.
author: Laura D.

description: come for the drinks and stay for the food. everybody's been talking about their drink menu but the real star of the show is the food menu - original, delicious, affordable, surprising, highly recommended!
author: Ruben K.

description: The food is delicious, drinks are on point and the bar staff are crazy cool!  I'm a total fan!
author: J D.

description: i came to check out ABV within their first week of opening. our server seemed enthusiastic, unique and engaging, which was sort of refreshing. the cocktails were good, though the service was a bit backwards. our drinks came after we'd eaten half of our food but i imagine the bar was slammed with all of the people coming in to check them out. food-wise i only really tried the tiny fish n' chips which i will recommend. i definitely want to go back to check out the rest of their bar bites.
author: Regina C.

description: 4 stars only because I haven't tried the food. I stumbled upon it a few weeks ago and loved it the second I walked in. Casual menu, creative, insanely delicious drinks, and the staff couldn't have been nicer. The bar was packed but the owner Ryan went out of his way to make sure we were taken care of. Three words -- gin and celery. Life changing and so unique.  I could drink 1,000 of these. Savory like a michelada or a Bloody Mary but way tangier, fresh (not spicy) and oh so delicious. I will definitely be back to drink more of these magic elixirs and to try some of the food (from what I saw it looked delicious).
author: Rebecca R.

description: Great bar with bar bites and good people!  Their drinks are good and strong!  Their kimchee fritters and empanadas were to die for!  I love the atmosphere.  My girlfriends and I are coming back again.  This time, we are coming back on an empty stomach so that we can try more little bites.
author: Marie S.

description: Friendly bartenders. Amazing food. The whole place is first come, first serve. Give it a shot--it's worth it. Kimchee fritters, lamb dogs, and chicken empanadas.. You seriously cannot go wrong with ABV.
author: Jamie M.

description: Chill spot for day drinks, food, and good service.  The burger, kimchee fritter, padron peppers, and lamb dogs were all yum.  The beer list is minimal, though there's a good IPA, and the whisky list impresses with several rattray and cask strength bottles.
author: dark l.
